name: Freya Renee
text:
I was very disappointed with my encounter here, the staff are awful.
I was referred by my dermatologist to have an X-ray done. I do not have insurance but was fully prepared to pay out of pocket.
The admissions clerk made a spectacle out of me not having insurance, getting her boss to see if they would see me or refuse me service.
Her boss tells me I need to get the specific code so she can look it up, which is literally her job.
She has all of my information and the dermatologist information in front of her and she tells me I have to do it myself, call her for a price, and then come back to get the X-ray.
This entire exchange was very loud and unnecessary, I left in tears.

name: April Rowell
text: Xx is Zaza zzzzzs zdx zzz cc zzz zzzz z. Z s.  Xxx

name: Sister Sabotage13
text: All of the staff have been caring and very attentive. I've never had a better stay in a hospital. The food leaves a but to be desired but I feel like I'll be great. It started in the er and now I've been in for 3 days. I'm getting great care. I couldn't ask for a better experience

name: Lisa Marie
text: DO NOT COME HERE FOR AN EMERGENCY. We were passing through and a family member had a serious seizure nearby. He was puking in the waiting room and no one cleaned it up. They said "housekeeping is gone for the day." The nurse wasn't wearing scrubs or a mask. Patient was barely able to communicate and they kicked his spouse out of the exam room. They attempted to kick the spouse out of the hospital completely, saying "no visitors." Refused to let family communicate with patient to gauge his decision-making abilities and kept saying he was fine, even though they had to come out to the waiting room to ask about meds and medical conditions because he couldn't communicate this information!! Place is filthy, please Alabama do something about your rural healthcare.

name: classic rock Kelley
text: I was so so sad to hear that this hospital 🏥 was closing. One of the best there was. Would have my loved ones there over Troy, Greenville and Luverne. Doctors and Staff were like Family.

name: Will Weider
text:
This community is lucky to have a quality local hospital and emergency room. They have great staff and provide personalized care.

When I was there the hospital leaders were serving nachos to the employees. I think this reflects the caring culture of the organization.

name: Talisa Reaves
text: Although we had a 3 hour visit, the staff was  phenomenal!!!! We had the sweetest nurses that actually took the time to talk to my children to keep from being scared and to help them feel better about our visit. My boys we’re running high fever and hurting all over, the staff immediately tested them. Our nurse was very gentle with my children during the nose and throat swabs that my 4 and 7 yr old didn’t even cry or flinch.  They ended up having the flu and one of our nurses even brought them suckers. All during this time they were serving 6 other patients for way more serious conditions. It meant so much to me that even though they were working under a lot of stress they still treated my children like their pediatrician would have.

name: Kiamonte Gulley
text: THE WORST HOSPITAL IN THE STATE DO NOT GO IF YOU ARE IN EMERGENCY NEED !!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Thomas Schofield
text: This review has been in waiting for years! Thank God for Google Dr Nami almost killed my dad in critical care due to neglect and negligence on her part I will not retire in Alabama instead Michigan thank God I will never see the inside of this band aid hospital

name: Daniel Taylor
text: Waited 4.5 hours for lower back pain from bulging disc flare up. Was never asked about my meds so I told the doctor that I was already taking nsaids and muscle relaxers daily as he rushed out of my room after 30 seconds. They bring me a muscle relaxer and an nsaid! When I asked the doctor about it, he said he NEVER gives anything more than that for pain. Uncaring ER staff who will not treat you pain.

name: lee black
text: Do not go here they will take you to court over the smallest amount of money and then if you still don’t pay they will garnish your wages. They are relentless when it come to pursuing you.

name: Isabella S
text:
There is a nurse there named “Troy” who has no bedside manner whatsoever and is unapologetic when addressed.
Definitely shouldn’t be working there.

name: Michael Owens
text: This place doesn't even deserve a star. Been here almost 2 1/2 hrs and haven't even seen doctor for a large gash in my 3 yr olds head.

name: Roger Mulnix
text: Sitting here almost 3 hrs and ain't been seen yet, website says 30minute pledge..just wondering when that kicks in?

name: kerri sanfilippo
text: Taking forever to see my ole man he might of had an heart attack

name: Brandon Hinson
text: Horrible service and horrible attitudes I think I would rather take my chances on making it to Montgomery during a life threating experience

name: JoAnna Hall
text: Slowest hospital EVER.

name: FRANBAR PRODUCTIONS
text: Saved my Life

name: Faye Cobbs
text: Recently spent several days in this hospital.  Great care by Dr. Keith Anderson. Excellent tech care by Celeste & Kathy & Megan.  Outstanding  Therapy by Kelly & Tina. Mrs. Saint took care of my wound from surgery in  an amazing way.  Great case manager and lots of kindness shown to me and my family by Marcie Bullard.   I would definitely recommend this hospital to friends.

resp.text: Thanks for entrusting us with your care, Faye. We’re happy that you had such a good experience!

name: April Baker
text: I do quite a lot of notary work at Encompass and have never had anything but positive experiences with their staff. They are always kind, thoughtful and considerate to their patients and family of their patients. They jump through hoops to fill the needs of their patients  while still managing to keep everyone involved safe and socially distant. Y’all are amazing!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing, April!

name: Big P Bullwinkle, Jr.
text:
My mother was discharged from Encompass 4 days ago. I will start by saying everyone I was in contact with was extremely friendly and kind. Case Manager and front desk were my favorite folks. My mother was there for 2 weeks. She received several hours of PT/OT therapy per day. Based on the reports of her progress while there, I was under the impression my mother would come home being able to do most things..simple things...walk to the bathroom...dress herself...on her own with supervision. NOT THE CASE. The first couple days home so far have been hell. My mother is far more dependent and way less capable of caring for herself than she was when she was admitted two weeks ago. She walked into the last doctors appointment before being admitted to Encompass. Now, she can barely walk to the bathroom. Definitely not the outcome I had anticipated....sorry to say.

re·ha·bil·i·ta·tion
/ˌrē(h)əˌbiləˈtāSH(ə)n/
noun
the action of restoring someone to health or normal life through training and therapy after imprisonment, addiction, or illness.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your concerns with us. We have forwarded this information to the appropriate contacts. If you’d like to share additional details, please email us directly at feedback@encompasshealth.com.

name: VICKI BREWER
text: My uncle was in after a traumatic brain injury. The staff for the most part were excellent and any problems were quickly resolved. The therapists did a wonderfully job. If he ever has to go again I only want him at Encompass

resp.text: So glad to hear your uncle's experience at Encompass Health North Alabama was great! Thanks for sharing, Vicki.

name: Ken Hamilton
text: I would NOT recommend this facility.  We were only allowed to visit one time (I understand the reason).  The staff was very nice.  While we where there, they never came in to turn him or get him up.  The reports we were given on a daily basis, was very encouraging.  We were informed by the case management team, that the family member was doing very well.  We were also given a report that the family member would only need a little help walking, feeding themselves, and sitting up.  The family member would need more assistance in other areas of activity.  Once we got the family member home, we was total bed ridden.  It took two people  to get him up or to move him.  When the home health nurse came to the house, she confirmed that she had also been told the same thing that we had been told.  The family member also had a wound to his heel and signs of break down on his back (the family member was only at Encompass for 10 days).  After completing Encompass' survey, I received a telephone call from someone saying she was from Encompass and wanted to talk to me about the survey.  After talking to me, she stated that she would investigate the issues and call me back in a couple of days.  It has now been over 2 weeks, and I have not hear back from her.  If I know then what I know now about Encompass, I would never had allowed my family member to go there.

name: Donna Traylor
text: I had 2 strokes I a row (smaller ones), this fall.  Huntsville Hospital referred me to Encompass for rehab.  I was scared!  Being in a new place was very scary for me.  I was pleasantly surprised, actually the nursing care I received was excellent! The doctor and nurse practitioner were very, very caring.  I recommend this rehab and give it a 5+ stars!  The aids, cleaning staff, maintenance dept, nurses, techs, physical therapists, and occupational therapists are AWESOME!  Thank you Shannon, ( my occupational therapists!  I was very off balance and unable to do much at all, before Encompass!  Thank you and God bless you all!

resp.text: Donna, thank you so much for sharing your positive experience at our Huntsville hospital. Thank you for entrusting us with your care!

name: Dale Lowe
text: I found that every aspect of my rehab was handled very professional and the staff made the rehab enjoyable as you could have hoped for.  The nursing and the staff are top notch!

resp.text: Dale, thank you so much for sharing your positive experience at our Huntsville hospital! We agree that our Encompass Health team is the best.

name: Lynn Johnson
text: It’s a great facility with very friendly, helpful staff. They did a great job helping our loved one get stronger to prepare for double knee replacement surgery. The therapists worked with her a lot to help her reduce her pain and chances of falling. Once she gets the surgery done, I hope they send her back there to recover. I would definitely recommend Encompass.

name: Mary Smith
text: Horrible place to work for nurses at the Huntsville, AL location. Good pay, but if you are not in their "clique" the employees start to bully you, trying to get you to quit. If you do not quit and are a good employee (good work, no absences, not late), you still get put on probation with no explanation (in the facility(90 days)-not towards licensing-being a single-mom I had no other choice but to accept it). However, people that are constantly late, call in alot,are lazy, etc, move up in the company. Very unprofessional and backwards place to work.

resp.text: Mary, thank you for sharing feedback with us. We've passed this information along to the appropriate contacts as the behavior described does not align with our Company values. If you'd like to provide additional details, please email feedback@encompasshealth.com.

name: Jane Thurmer
text: We could not be happier with the great care our mother has received at this rehab facility after her total hip replacement.  Thank you all for your attention to every detail of her care and especially the great planning for care at home after her discharge!

name: Calethea Martin
text: My husband is currently at healthsouth now and he has done just awesome since he has been there. This is a great rehab facility.

name: Jeff K
text:
My son was in HealthSouth. It's an aggressive program and very well suited for young people who heal fast. I don't think it would be that great for the very elderly who have physical injuries except in the right circumstances.

My son had a brain injury, bruised spleen, and broken ribs. The physical therapists didn't believe that he had broken ribs. I was told that the pain he was feeling was in his mind due to his brain injury. This was not true. The doctor who first examined him at Huntsville Hospital verified that he had broken ribs on both sides. HealthSouth was either ignorant or chose to ignore this fact until I chewed some ass and got him some pain medication. They even brought in a portable x-ray machine and still said he had no broken ribs. The physical therapists tried to move him around and were too aggressive for someone in that kind of pain.

I don't know if they lie as a part of their aggressive approach, or if it was a mistake. It's hard to believe it was a mistake when it was in his medical record that his ribs were broken.

Most of the staff is nice and helpful. A couple of them were rude but you get that anywhere.

resp.text: Jeff, we are sorry to hear about your family's experience. This does not align with our Company values and we have forwarded this information to the appropriate contacts. We do use intensive therapy as part of our approach to returning patients of all ages back to their optimal level of independence. We do not encourage aggressiveness and in no way condone overlooking important information in a patient's file. If you'd like to provide additional details, we encourage you to email us directly at feedback@encompasshealth.com.

name: Ty Farr
text: Would never recommend this rehab hospital to work.

resp.text: Ty, we'd appreciate the opportunity to learn more about your experience with our Huntsville hospital location. Please email us directly with additional details to feedback@encompasshealth.com.

name: Ricky Boothe
text: About this time last year I had a spinal injury I'm not like I was but I have to give a thanks to my  ooccupational and physical therapist that worked with me if wasn't for you and my determination I can't imagine what shape I'd be today thank you !

name: Amanda Carroll
text: I took my father-in-law here after another hospital discharged him with injuries after a car accident. He was in terrible pain. Two nurses greeted me at my car and picked him up to put him in a wheelchair. They took him straight back and immediately started tests and scans. They discovered several injuries the other hospital missed. They transferred him to UAB via ambulance. The nurse, Danielle, was so kind and compassionate. Dr. Crawford was amazing and even prayed over us before we left. I had tears in my eyes when I left because I was so thankful for this hospital.

resp.text: Reviews like this are inspiring. Our teams are committed to compassionate care. Thank you for sharing! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Leah Thompson
text: Overall two ER visits and only two highlights for rating above the two stars,, nay, one star for the administration staff, no better for even the janitorial service person. I wish I could be excuse their lack of care and 99% rude presentation of the hospital.  As a person in pain and over whelmed with anxiety... the reception failed miserably. Maybe management should place those two employees on a schedule they can stay awake, do their job correctly and with some attention to detail and quality of service. Am I wrong St Vincent?

resp.text: We'd like to look into this. Would it be possible for you to reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm). Thank you! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Alexis Dempsey
text: My daughter was in a jet ski accident and had a Huge gash in her face that was deep and bleeding. We sat in the ER for over 4 hours with no chance of even being seen anytime in the near future from the point we left. They did not even bother to clean the wound in triage so that it would not get infected considering it happened in Lake water.. I will never recommend this hospital to anyone.

resp.text: Hi, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Could you please contact us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we may have someone follow up? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: A B
text: My father was admitted 2/14/21 with covid . I cannot say enough kind words about the care he has received . I appreciate every single health care worker he has had. I called a couple of times each day and everyone was so friendly and informative. I believe their work and caring hands have truly been touched by God and I could not be more thankful with the entire thing.  They made a really grim situation go smooth!! Thank you all !!

name: Star Stemas
text: Takes hours for you to see anybody, and assuming someone brought you cause this is an emergency, you'll be in there together cause your driver will have a heatstroke cause they're not allowed inside.

resp.text: We understand your frustration and would sincerely like to give this situation the time and attention you deserve. May we ask that you please call us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we can address your concerns? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Lana Wright
text: I truly had the best experience the week i was there for Covid pneumonia. The ER, Ms Cora and especially the 2nd floor nurses were angels. I credit them for nursing me back to life. They were so attentive and caring. I don't know what would have happened to me if I did not have them!! Thank you from the bottom of my heart. I love you all ❤️

name: Sam Norwood
text: I’m very pleased . Doctor Dumas and Kaley was very helpful.. I thank them VERY MUCH.  This hospital I would I recommend anyone to come. They truly care about their patients. Again I thank yall

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! We wish you good health and wellness. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Susie Alvis
text: Absolutely loved the staff which is why i hate to write this review . Billing dept is the most atrocious customer service i've ever had to deal with. Its embarrasing this coming from someone in the healthcare field. I will never use st vincents again after this experience ya'll should be ashamed to even allow your billing dept to answer the phone . Also if you have a sleep study because you stop breathing in your sleep don't count on financial assistance to help because its "elective" so i guess pay there bill or die in your sleep is st vincents moto . Will not be back which sucks because i adored the staff . I

name: Barbara Fisackerly
text: Everything went right  on schedule..no problems

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Chris McGill
text: Worse place I've ever been waited four hours took other people around me then the lady behind the counter got rude when I asked what was taking so long my blood pressure was 170 over 125 I have a problem with my blood pressure glad I didn't fall out this place is a joke

resp.text: We understand your frustration and would sincerely like to give this situation the time and attention you deserve. May we ask that you please call us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we can address your concerns? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Taehyungie “Randi Jo” Wifeu
text: The staff, doctors, and nurses were friendly but only surface. They do not listen, and they were only concerned with getting rid of my husband's symptoms and getting him out as opposed to finding the cause, the underlying causes and symptoms that have continued on and off for over 2 years. they did not even refer him to a specialist. I tried to explain this to them, and they just smiled and pacified me. They said they were just going to give him some stronger medicine to try and knock it out, and if it comes back, he needs to come back. The issues have been coming back for over 2 years. They will come back. This is not a question. Stronger steroids is not the answer. The symptoms are more severe each time. I do not recommend this hospital.

resp.text: We understand your frustration and would sincerely like to give this situation the time and attention you deserve. May we ask that you please call us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we can address your concerns? Thank you. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: kristy williams
text: If I could post ZERO stars...unfortunately that is not an option. The physicians and nurses here are incompetent. They change the story and prognosis every time you talk to them...he lost consciousness...no, he coded...no, he actually had a heart attack. They diagnose a MI with cardiac markers and NO ECHO in someone with severe acute inflammation. An ICU nurse can’t access ABG results on a patient that is being ventilated in a chemically induced coma. COVID + pneumonia + renal failure, yet not a single diuretic given since admission. If you want your family to survive an illness, DO NOT GO HERE. This place is a malpractice attorney’s dream.

name: baver smith
text: My Mom was here in ICU for 10 days. I am with a major hospital system in Houston, and was astonished and humbled by the level of care she received here, in a small town, just a very small operation of St. Vincent's healthcare system. Selfless care, staying after 12-hour shifts to stay in the room with her, in this time of local and national crisis - you - ICU - you are my heroes.

resp.text: We’re glad to hear you and your family were comforted in your time of need. We are always here for you. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Donna Nicholson
text: Very friendly and caring staff!

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback! -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Ralph Pair
text: Going back today for two more breathing session.   From Ralph

resp.text: Thank you for these comments. Your feedback is important to us. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Angela Davis
text:
I was very pleased at how quickly the ER was able to see my mom. However, I was very disappointed with the treatment that my mom was given. Staff immediately assumed that we were Hispanic and asked several times if she spoke Spanish or could understand English.  We are not Hispanic. We are Americans and understand English very well.   My mom has never been diagnosed with diabetes. And she was only given her blood pressure medicine one time after having her gallbladder removed. The staff quickly treated Her as if her condition was due to not taking blood pressure medication and diabetes medication.  My mom has never been Prescribed medication for either conditions. They finally did an MRI which showed that she had a spot on her brain. Yet no one qualified at the hospital could evaluate it.  They was reluctant in sending her to another hospital with a neurologist. And did not see her condition as critical.

Overall, the staff was friendly, But we’re not culturally diversed. Communication between nurses and patients sucked

name: TaNya Morgan
text: The doctor I had about a year ago was very unprofessional and I have to pay a $837 bill and they didn’t prescribe me anything or fix my problem and I had to wait 4 hours just to be seen I wish I could them negative reviews

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We'd like the chance to look into the situation you have described. Could you please reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm)? We look forward to hearing from you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: stacey watson
text: Excellent staff. Very caring of their patients!! Amber in the lab is amazing, thank you for taking extra good care of my mom. Wish everyone in the medical field cared as much as she does.

name: Susan Mathews
text: Very good doctors. Would not leave them and so somewhere else.

resp.text: Our care teams aim to deliver high quality care. Thank you for sharing this feedback with us! -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Jennifer McCain
text: Terrible patient rapport and customer service. Any and all receptionist; no matter the department; are extremely rude, speak to patients as if we are ignorant for asking simple questions, and treat every phone conversation as if it's such a bother to do the EASIEST JOB of any emloyee in that hospital! My suggestion would be to either make them all go through better training AGAIN just to keep that job they have been blessed with when so many of us CAN'T find work, or can't work due to our condition. Or clean house and rehire any department answering phones and speaking directly with patients. I ran a customer service DEMANDING business for 6 yrs and my clients favorite thing about me was the fact that I never brought my personal life or feelings to the job, and treated every client with a certain personability easy to relate to and ALWAYS happy to help with a smile! Because THAT'S what customers wanna see. Make them feel like u love being there to help them, not as if it's such an inconvenience to even answer the phone! Or, I would be glad to come show u, first hand, how it's done! See,I hate not having the easy job and watching others do that job so horribly... Yet, still keep it! Just a suggestion from someone having to deal with you guys a good bit, get better receptionists with more personality and your customers will be much happier! Thanks

resp.text: Jennastasia Mccain, thanks for taking the time to leave your rating. We'd like to learn more about your experience. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns.

name: Becky Mazingo
text: I have never had such a great experience at a hospital. Everyone was awesome, from ER to all staff and Dr's. The food was great, I thought I was at a hotel.  Thanks to all the great people for taking care of me. God bless you all.

name: Marcie Crump
text: The Doctors and support staff is amazing.  Dr. Cox is amazing.  The second floor staff is the sweetest.  Food was great. They went out of there way for me and my husband.  I will forever be greatful. I was treated like family.

name: Chris Arnett
text:
Most amazing hospital. Everyone from the housekeepers to the doctors
took care of our every need. I can't sing their praises enough. Special thanks to Chaplain Clay for his kind attention. The ICU nurses and 2nd floor nurses
were wonderful. Don't have a single complaint after spending 17 days there.
The Lofton family

resp.text: Chris Arnett, thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team!

name: Lynn Crowe
text: I will start out by saying that one star was way to many for the service I received on 5/19/2017 I was carried by ambulance to the ER after falling and splitting the flesh around my eye socket open because of an epileptic seizure. I have epilepsy and know for a fact that I do, I have been diagnosed by two different Dr's. The last time I had to be taken in the Dr in the ER  Dr said I wasn't having seizures, what changed her mind was the fact that I had one right before her eyes4 they instantly transported me to a hospital with a neurology department  . Since their are no neurologists at St Clair I wouldn't have chosen it this time but I wasn't aware enough to make the choice. When I got onto the room the Dr came in and recognized me from the last time and make the rude comment "oh you have another seizure?" Forget the fact that I had two cuts around my eye and blood on my face and blood that had dripped onto the front of my shirt. I have been and always do take my medications regularly. After a CT scan which took quite awhile to get taken back for, the uncaring Dr which I do not even remember the name of discharged with no stitches no nothing. Even the nurse asked if they had done anything yet, and was clearly surprised that I was not at least given something for the horrible headache that was left behind from the fall and the seizure. This ER is horrible. I had to be taken to another hospital one because they couldn't deal with the Pneumonia I had. If at all costs stay away, if it is a last resort then go by all means and pray that a good Dr is on call that day. I will be getting in touch with my insurance company to tell them of the quality of care and service that i received. Now the nurses on the other hand are INCREDIBLE. I hate that they have to deal with the Dr's. Well at least the Dr that I had on the visit yesterday 5/20/2015

name: Peggy Edgeworth
text: Could not have asked for any better service. Everyone was kind and considerate. Went above and beyond to help make my daughter's stay comfortable. First time in years I felt comfortable enough to leave a loved one alone in a hospital!

name: Alesia Ray
text: I brought my Mom in for a procedure and I was totally impresses with the level of care she received. Being Catholic, I was so at home in the beautiful chapel. Everyone was very helpful, service was excellent,  cafeteria was superb,  and I highly recommend.

name: ShitforLuck Smith
text: The doctors and nurses was very professional and nice and did exactly what they said they would. Thanks

resp.text: Shitforluck Smith, thank you for taking the time to review us and for the positive rating. We’re happy to hear the staff were able to help you.

name: Michelle Fitzpatrick
text: The best hospital I have ever been to. The staff and doctors we're great and very caring. Thank you, for making me feel better.

resp.text: Michelle, thank you for taking the time to give us a 5-star review. We appreciate it!

name: Suz Martin
text: Admitting can’t seem to keep up with orders. It is always a major ordeal to get anything done there...very frustrating.

resp.text: We understand your frustration and would sincerely like to give this situation the time and attention you deserve. May we ask that you please call us at 205-930-2375 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we can address your concerns? Thank you. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: vickie simpson
text:
It depends on which Dr. you get.  I have seen great doctors. and there are 2 that should not be doctors.  they have no concern for people  at all.  If you call to see which doctor is working they will not tell you.  If you could find that information then you know where to go.  St Vincent East is where we go for most of our emergencies since one Dr. has come to the er at St Clair.
Great hospital if you get past the ER Dr.

name: JENI T
text:
Absolutely a charming little hospital. So clean. Everyone is so helpful.
I see a wonderful doctor. I drive from Bham to Pell City because the treatment and people are like night and day from other big hospitals.
Their outpatient surgical center is top notch.

name: shelea brooks
text:
My son was sick and went there to ER on Christmas Eve. We didn't have to wait long and he had great nurses and staff. Being a nurse at another hospital, things take time, however he was treated and released in a timely manner. The facility was very nice and clean and the staff all friendly.
I have also been there with my mother-inlaw and she had the same treatment. No problems on either visit. The only problem on one of her visits were the computer at admitting was down, but they still took care of her with no problems.

name: John Jackson
text: Had to go to the ER last night.  Met with a smile and just enough humor to put a smile on my frowny face. Every person that worked there was professional dealing with me.  The doctor and nurses get outstanding marks from me.  I recommend  St. Vincent's ER.  And a shout out to my good friend Dr. S.  Lakinpal.

name: Breonna Stephens
text: Took my daughter in for an arm injury and before even taking xrays the doctor wrenched her arm all around and “diagnosed” it as nursemaid elbow, after his unethical methods didn’t “fix” the problem, he ordered xrays and saw her arm was broke and made it worse of a break by the way he messed with her arm! After receiving a second opinion from another hospital and set of doctors, they all agreed the methods use were unjust and we will NOT be returning.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Breonna Stephens. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns.

name: Kevin Fowler
text: The staff was prompt and extremely courteous. They took great care of me and the situation.  I would go back.

resp.text: Kevin Fowler, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at St. Vincent's St. Clair.  Ascension Medical Group Community Manager

name: Robin Hines
text: I went in the ER... That Dr needs to go back to school.. she couldn't even read an x-ray right!! Splint my finger WAY wrong... luckily I went to Dr. Savage in Birmingham, now thinking about getting a lawyer... she could've messed up my finger for the rest of my life the way she had it done!! I work with my hands, I am a hairstylist!! And they wonder why they don't get paid & yes I have insurance!!! From now on... I don't care how much pain I'm in I will drive to Birmingham to go to the hospital!!! So yall... think twice before you take your loved ones or yourself here!!!

name: D H
text: So your ER doctor thinks it's OK to denigrate a senior citizen? I won't go into the full story because it's useless waste of my time. What a horrible  emergency room. I suppose St. Vincent's and Pell City administrators are just as incompetent as the people they employ... or.... just as incompetent as the people they employ. What other explanation? Idiocy is a sickening state of affairs in Pell City and at St. Vincent's.

name: Elizabeth Brand
text: Atrocious

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case. We're here to listen, if there is any additional feedback you would like to share with our team, feel free to reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm). -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Latonya Chatman
text: I took my two children in to the ER both complaining of headaches, nausea and throat pain. My youngest had a low grade fever but had been up all night crying and talking but making no sense, she had also fallen on a gym floor and bumped her head pretty hard which concerned me also. I gave all this information to the admitting nurse. The wait to get in a room was short but the wait to see the doctor was at least two hours. No nurse ever came in to ask if we needed anything and looking at the symptoms you would have thought they would have swabbed them for strep or even the flu. When the doctor finally came in, he "assumed" it was strep, never ordered a throat swab or any other tests and said he was going to treat them both as if it was strep. He repeatedly told my older daughter that she was "not as sick" as my younger one and that because her throat was not as red, she should feel ok. He prescribed my youngest medicine to take by mouth even though I had informed him that she had been nauseous and even thrown up; to me it would have made more since to give her a shot since she was not keeping liquids down. This was the worst ER visit ever and I will never take my kids back there or recommend that anyone go there. Everyone deserves a good visit whether their illness is minor or major.

name: Roland Adkins
text: Brouht wife in with major leg pain. Didnt wait long at all. Very short wait time . doc came in quickly. But they are the worst hospital to go to. Doc ordered a ct. They. Blew a vein. Her arm swelled tremendously. I had to step out, told the nurse where i was. 20 minutes later everything went to hell! The doc scared my wife to death with vague results of the scan. Wife was alone because i was still in waiting room. We left with wife being in shock and i, her husband, was told anything! They pracitly tossed her out with no diagnostic answers. They wouldnt even tell us where or who we need to see. Just no help at all! We're going to another hospital. She should have been kept! She was hysterical, and told them suicidal! I brought her there for help! I needed help with my wife! They dont care for people! They only care for what insurance card you have! So i came home with a wife that was already scared! We know she has cancer again. But to be told to go somewhere else! Not even try to help!should have read the reveiws more! So my advice! Just spend the extra gas and time and go to U.A.B.! DONT WASTE A COPAY! ITS NOT A REAL EMERGENCY ROOM! ITS ONLY FOR THOSE WHO ALREADY SEE SOMEONE THAT HAS A OFFICE THERE! IF DONT SEE SOME OTHER DOC THATS THERE, YOU WILL NOT BE TREATED!

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Roland Adkins. Please email us HospitalReviews@Ascension.org so we can address your concerns.

name: rusty payne
text: My mother-in-law was recently admitted in very grave condition from her nursing home. The care and attention from the doctors, nurses (G & Sonya are the bomb), the lady who fed her, as well as the Jefferson State nursing students was above and beyond expectations. She was quickly back to as well as could be expected and is back to her nursing home.

name: Craig Parker
text: Dr. Rivus has the most terrible bedside manner of any pysician that I have hired to treat my medical diagnosis.  He admits having a treatement plan devised before he even enters exam room and then will not listen to suggestions on what has worked in the past. I truly believe that he is a doctor that has lost all Humanity and humility as he thinks he is better than any one of his patients that walks in the room.

resp.text: Hi Craig Parker, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. If you would like management to follow up, please reach out to us HospitalReviews@Ascension.org; reference this review and include your contact information. Thank you.

name: Jayy TV
text: They don’t have their stuff together  and they seem like they’re understaffed, the wait had been about two hours, don’t waist your time coming here go to grand view or the hospital in Trussville...

resp.text: Hello, we try very hard to meet expectations and regret that we have not done so in this case. We'd like to look into your experience. If you are interested, please email us your contact information, and reference this review for faster service at HospitalReviews@Ascension.org. Thank you for reaching out to us.  Social Media Community Manager HospitalReviews@Ascension.org

name: Gina Grant
text:
Went to the ER  in April 2016 with poisoning from a packaged cake bought at a popular convenience store that sells barbecue on Martin St. The owner called ahead to let them know I was coming. I had stopped by to ask them to remove the product, which they didn't. The  Dr. on call practiced in Birmingham, and the first thing he said was he had 4 children to support. He saw me twice for 3 min each. Ordered blood work, told me I had a UTI, which I knew, and said it was causing my symptoms. NO Way. The nurse was much more intelligent and caring and advised me a food product tampered with would not show on any hospital blood work.
I was given 1000mg of Ciprofloxacin, a buckshot antibiotic used to treat anthrax poisoning, and prescription for 3 days of pills. 2 days later a store employee ate the same packaged cake and in minutes had symptoms severe enough that he couldn't walk. He went to the same ER and after much testing including an MRI was told he had an inner ear infection.
The hospital bill was less than the doctor's bill, I guess because of the 4 kids. My beef is with the doctor and not so much the hospital. The nurse and lab people were good, the admitting nurses could definitely be better.

name: Lexi Johnson
text: Outstanding service both times I came here. Very friendly staff. I came a year ago on 9/27/14 and now its 9/27/15 with my fiance. Got in and got out. Awesome job! I love St. Vincents hospitals!

name: Gail Benefield
text:
After my husband's car accident on a December Sun afternoon, we were pleased with the care he received in the ER.
In our recent visits to their diagnostic testing area, we were impressed by the cleanliness and by their professionalism and promptness.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to share!

name: John Santoro
text: STAY AWAY!!!!!!!   The St Vincent 's (Pell City) ER should be shut down. I would give them a negative score if I could....when I arrived at the ER I had been choking on a piece of food for about an hour...the person in the,front was,very rude and Very unsympathetic....all she wanted the whole time from me was my signature...all the while I couldn't hardly breathe and barely talk and if I tried it hurt...she finally called to the back of the ER and told them I was choking. Almost 2 minutes went by when the double doors open up and 4 people are standing there looking at me hunched over hanging on the front desk gagging and gasping for air...one lady said , ah he's breathing, while the other's looked at her and she now tells them I'm breathing and he's Ok....they again stare back at me and now she tills them I'm breathing and fine they turn around go back into the ER and the doors shut.....they were 20 plus feet away from me and made this observation.....What a JOKE!!!!

name: Colton
text: Much better than Talladega, ER. Close to I-20 and UAB is also big plus to me. Although UAB is too far to drive so i've been here to Saint Vincents a few times. Really good ER doctors, and I've had pretty great treatment here.

resp.text: We're so happy you had a great experience with St. Vincent's St. Clair and you took the time to share it with us! We will continue to provide this community with the same exceptional care you experienced. Thank you for sharing your story!

name: Jessica Oneal
text: This is the best hospital ever the nurses and doctor are so nice and deserve a 5 star

name: Rachel Baltzer
text: Had the flu and hadn’t eaten in four days. Extremely dehydrated. They didn’t give me I’ve fluids because I am private pay. Also when receiving my injection in my hip the RN saw the tattoo on my lower back and made a statement about my “tramp stamp”. I was a nurse for ten years and I was appalled by the behavior of their entire medical staff. They were “mocking me”. I will never be back and I definitely won’t be paying for this humiliating experience.

name: Mary Simmons
text: My daughter was in a car wreck.   While she was 17, all of the air bags went off and the EMTs called for the older lady in the other car said she should go to the ER to be checked out.     Make sure nothing else was wrong, right?     Logical, so we went.    They got her back in a reasonable time for someone showing no obvious symptoms.    They did no testing, but checked her out and saw no signs that there was something wrong.   Give us advice on what to be on the lookout for.   So forth.     And THEN they filed the insurance with a diagnosis of anxiety, meaning it is a mental health claim and not a medical claim.      Seriously?     Anxiety over having had half a dozen air bags go off in her face.   Anxiety over the EMT saying she needed to be cleared by a doc before we took her home.      10 months now and we still don’t have it all settled out.    I hate ER’s, but I especially hate it when they lob stupid diagnoses at things.      Color me irritated.      We are unlikely to ever use this ER again.

resp.text: Hi, Mary. I'm sorry to hear about your experience. Thank you for taking the time to provide this information. I have sent your comments to our leadership team. Please send your contact information and any additional information to feedbackAL@ascension.org

name: Gayle Johnson
text: I was the only person in the emergency room @ about 2am. I came in because I couldn't stop throwing up, fever, chest hurting, dizzy, not peeing well (told them I had just stopped peeing altogether the week before) ...after telling this to 8 or 9 different people. They still came in and dramatically would ask in the most animated way you could talk down to anyone. What brings you HERE (WAVING ARMS) at this time of the morning? I would proceed to tell my symotoms...and they'd say no no no...what brought you HERE.... finally I said I begged not to come here. The guys who picked me up (who were great might I add) told me everyone had requested to go to the other two hospitals I chose and they were very busy and I would be seen quicker in Pell City.  So I went. They didn't do anything. Thank the Lord above I puked in the ambulance and they gave me a shot of zofran. As I'm trying to tell these people at Pell City answers to questions I could easily answer at anytime, I was dazed and confused...I found out later was a side effect of the zofran....but all I got was aggravated questions and replies that I was drug seeking or in withdrawals. The cab ride home, this man said everyone he picks up says the same thing. He told of their stories and his own experiences.  They were worse than mine. So, if you are sick.... do not go there.  .   ..... "

name: Mellissa Goetz
text: Always had wonderful caring services here.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about your experience, Mellissa Goetz. Listening to our patients is important to us.

name: Vianca Hart
text: I didn't appreciate the experience I had there,they didn't do anything for me the doctor didn't even come back in to discuss my test results my symptoms are worse than before

name: Resheana Howard
text: This hospital is very slow they sit around laughing and carrying on with conversation like they have sick people  I should’ve stayed at home in pain. 3 people has left

name: Michelle Brand
text: The nurses and Drs were very attentive I didn't want for anything

name: Patricia Young
text: My child had a temp of 103.1. Waiting an hour before being called to a room in the back was understandable. So, while in the waiting room a nurse took a swab of my child’s nose. Once we were called to a room in the back, we waited 1.5 hour for any sign of a doctor. I stepped out of the room to make sure they had not forgotten about us. By then, the doctor approached as I was asking the nurse behind the counter about how many doctors were actually working. The doctor then introduced himself and I preceded to ask him why has a doctor not checked in with us, at least. He was defensive, and responded as if he was overwhelmed. I can admit that I was frustrated as well. We continued the conversation in the room.  During the doctor’s initial examination, I explained to him that I was concerned about my child having a throat infection because of the way he had been behaving earlier that day. Especially since the flu and MMR swab was negative. He discounted my concern and told me how he had consulted with doctors at Children’s hospital in bham about how it was impossible for a < 2 year old to have strep, and how he had 25 years of experience. He checked my child’s ears but not his throat. He didn’t even attempt to shine a light in his mouth and eyeball his throat. I feel he did not do a thorough examination of my child, and was rushing to a diagnosis because he was obviously overwhelmed. He said that 24/7 St Vincent St Clair only has 1 doctor working the ER. The doctors/staff at St Vincent St Clair should not have the feeling of being overwhelmed. That causes health care of fair to poor quality. An average to excellent doctor would have a challenge working efficiently and effectively in an environment such as the one at St Vincent St Clair. The hospital should invest in having at least 1 more doctor in the ER. Logistics issue. There are more 1 star reviews than 5 star with a trend in between.

resp.text: Patricia Young, thank you for leaving us feedback. We are disappointed to hear that your experience was not a positive one. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. Please reach out to us at feedbackAL@ascension.org so we may identify ways to improve your experience.

name: Cynthia Harkness
text: Horrible Emergency Room. Nasty and incompetent people that call themselves nurses, doctors and aides. The last Dr. I saw, after the shift change, was the only redeeming person there. Once admitted, the 2nd floor staff was great. Don't judge the whole hospital by the ER. Sadly that is the one area that some will only experience. This one is deplorable.

name: Brandy Nickens
text: I'm a Crohn's patient and ended up here .. the doctor and nurses were very good ! Thank you all for everything you've done !

name: Riley Robinson
text: The rudest most unprofessional staff I have ever witnessed.

name: Maya Mayfied
text: I hope no one comes to this ER and receives treatment from the uncaring and unprofessional Dr.Sunkavalli . Also there was a nurse with the worst attitude possible . This ER doesn't even deserve one star. STAY AWAY!! YOU WILL REGRET IT!!!!!

name: Dana Renee
text: I was stung by 8 yellow jackets on 7/12/15 to which I am allergic.  My husband carried me to the St Clair ER as it is the closest to our home.  My husband had called ahead to tell them I was having difficulty breathing and was deteriorating quickly.  We pulled in and two or three nurses met me at the door with a wheelchair and directed my husband to register me and my son to park the car.  They were extremely efficient in getting me stabilized.  I wish I could remember everyone's name that assisted in my care and bringing me back from a serious reaction.  I saw all of the negative reviews placed here about the er but I did not experience anything but positive.  Thanks to the staff and Dr. I am able to breath and live today.

name: Robert Brewster
text: I was in severe pain in the parking lot and unable to walk inside, had to yell for someone to get help for me. They sent a security guard with a wheel chair. They then left me in an empty waiting room for twenty minutes. once they finally got to me they treated me like a pain pill junkie. I never asked for anything but a shot to stop the pain in my knee from gout,and for them to look at my back. they gave me a pill and discharged me without even looking at my back. When I asked for a reason why they wouldn't check my back? none was given. To complete my nightmare visit, I had to request for a wheelchair. They then rolled me out to the parking lot and didn't even take me to my car, I had to literally hop to my car falling on it for support. I was then allowed to drive away not feeling any better than when I arrived. I will NEVER go back again if I can help it!! Worst service I've ever gotten at an ER. REALLLY!!!!!!

name: Kathy Hogan (Princess Gata)
text: i was seen on june 7, 2017 i wemt in with compantes of my hep c inflamed, swelling in my thyroids, and an issue with my kidney. they issued me a ua but refussed to find out if the swelling was cause by my thyroids as well as doing blood work to check my liver levels to make sure my hep c had not flared up. so over all i am no pleased with them. and i pray that thier misdignos does not kill me within a week or have to be addmitted.

name: Ashna S.
text: I would give it 0 Stars if I could. You all suck and need to find a new line of work. Pathetic.

name: Amber Hudson
text: I went in with a possible miscarriage, it took them over three hours just to get me into a room. When in the room the doctor only came in twice! The nurses were so very rude, i ended up staying a total of 9 hours in this place. Never will come here again.

name: Samantha Smith
text: Terrible came in for stomach pains turns out have a cyst told me to take over the counter meds in so much pain they had to give me morphine after begging to stop the pain went to another hospital turns out my cyst burst had to keep me over night I coupdnt even stand up straight or even walk right with out blood pressure through the roof rude nurses dont wamt to do qnything but talk and tye doctor talks to u if ur stupid and dont know whats happening oh I was also throwing up the whole time took an hour for meds I wouldnt semd my worse enemy there

name: Wendy Wallace
text: Do not got to this ER! I was bitten 3 times by a cottonmouth while in the water. 2 times in one ankle and one time in the other. We called ahead of time. Fiancé driving me and parents not far behind. The pain was excruciating. I have a zoo animal technology degree and my fiancée works with exotics too. There was no doubt what kind of snake it was. My fiancée carried me in and I was quickly put in a room. The first doctor was nice and reassuring. They began taking measurments of my legs. Within moments there was a shift change. The new doctor came in. He grabbed one of my ankles as I cried out in pain saying, your grabbing the bite....he dropped my foot to the bed and proceeded to grab my other foot. My mother and fiancée explaining I was bit on the back of ankle but he didn't bother to even look at the puncture holes or care. I was given pain medication thru IV but not antivenem. They explained to my dad how expensive it was and how I might not need it. I have insurance and would like to keep my feet so really didnt care about expense. They only kept me for 2 hours and decided to send me home with ibuprofen 800 mg and Ultram. No tetanus shot, no 10 hour monitoring, no bedside manners, no real help at all. My family and I  wanted to see the doctor. The nurse asked him 3 times to come in. I couldn't walk or put my legs down. The doctor came in with a bad attitude asking what do i want him to do. That he can't admit me and that I would need to keep my feet elevated for several days. He was rude to my mom and me. I asked that he stop being mean and help me. How do I get out of bed to wheelchair if I can't walk. He again told me to keep my feet elevated...so apparently I was supposed to levitate to wheelchair. The doctor was horrific so much that it even seem to horrify the nurses. Five days have passed I can not stand or walk. My ankles and feet are swollen and black going all the way up to the knee. No home health care. I can't shower and trying to make it with a bed pan. Thank god for my family otherwise I would be dead not being able to care for myself. According to every hospital in area I should have been given the antivenem. Too late now. Have no idea about when I will be able to walk or when this pain will subside. Never been treated so terribly in my life. Never seen a doctor with so little care for a patient.....not sure if he thought my legs were swelling and turning blue because of something else as he didn't seem to think I was bitten. Three people saw me get bit and again I have a zoo animal tech degree and 40 years old, so I think I would know. I will be calling the hospital and speaking to administration. I CAN'T STAND OR WALK STILL AND I WAS SENT HOME. WHAT KIND OF MEDICINE ARE THESE PEOPLE PRACTICING. DO NOT GO TO THIS ER!!!!!!!

name: Kim Maxson
text: Y'all sucks ass they told me my results  came a hour and half ago and I'm still waiting for results. Like I'm pregnant and thus is how you treat a pregnant person.

name: Michael Crowe
text: About 2 weeks ago I was taken by ambulance to St Vincent's St.Clair. I have Epilepsy and that day My wife counted at least 20 seizures when we got there the Dr said I didn't  have seizures and sent me home. The very next say i had a seizure and collapsed in my home and hit my head on the bedside table and split my eyelid open and ended up with 5 stitches. I would mention the Dr's name but i am sure he would sue me. I have called the Admissions office and told them of my experience, a man there said he would forward the information and they would be back in touch as of today I have yet to hear back.

name: Michelle Brewster
text: My husband and i live in California, my husband is from Alabama. We came to bury and have service for his grandmother. During this time, there were severe thunderstorms and tornadoes and due to the weather, we were stuck there and could not fly home. I am on several medications, and due to the extended time there, I did not have enough meds to last til I got home to refill.  I had to visit the ER to see about getting g a couple prescriptions, so that I would continue on my meds, and not have any problems. After 45 minutes I finally saw a doctor, and while he said one of the meds was ok, he said they don't prescribe these meds in an emergency room. Um...what? This is an emergency! What kind of sense does that make. I gave him my doctors name and number, I even showed him my bottles,... I was bewildered.  Who turns a cancer patient away to suffer. I understand not prescribing narcotics or whatever but this wasn't anything like that. And I thought doctors swore by the oath to do no harm. Well, my feelings were hurt, and I was beyond upset. Feeling much like a person who knows they will run out of air soon. Panic set in, and thank goodness there are kind hearted people at walgreens, because they called my doctor, had him fax over the info, and filled the prescription.  Had I known to do that, I would have done it first. In any event, I don't think it's a bad hospital, but I do think they go a little too far with some things. This situation was bot that difficult, and due to the response, I will only give them a 3.

name: Erika Ward
text: Worst ever do not go to this hospital in pain. I went to the er with extreme pain in my lower abdomen and extreme swelling.they got me to a bed qickly but left me there for one hour befor they seen me. When the nurse left after doing my blood work I heard them say they weren't going to examine me because I was bleeding. The doctor came in pushed on my stomach and said it was a csyst. No utra sound no pelvic exam. They finially gave me a shot and sent me home. Not only that I had to beg for a doctors excuse. They treated me like a convict or white trash and I have good insurance. I say they are lazy incompetent.

name: Mark Burkhalter
text: I would avoid this Hospital at all costs!  They are staffed with incompetent individuals that cannot complete a simple task like updating a billing address.  This has resulted in two years of billing nightmares all because they couldn’t correct my address when I provided.

name: Joe Noe
text: Went in with an inflamed appendix I thought it was a kidney infection three times they sent me home with antibiotics. Finally I came back with severe pain and they found a aneurism which was good but they sent me to UAB and there they found the appendicitis which they removed my appendix but had to wait 3 weeks to fix the aneurism I almost died. Then I had to come back and they let me languish in pain for hours before giving me something for pain turns out I was losing my kidney and they sent me home because I had an appointment the next day with my Dr when I saw him they admitted me immediately at UAB. Another time I had sever back pain from a pulled muscle that was spasuming it was awful I could barley walk and they treated me like I was a pill popper and gave me nothing some kind of fake narcotic he said it would trick my mind into believing they were narcotics and muscle relaxers that did nothing I wasted my time there and wish UAB was closer. They do have some nice nurses here but the black ER Dr lady is not going to help you.

name: SAMANTHA HAWKINS
text: Every time that I have been there for inpatient or outpatient care I have received the BEST care from the nurses and staff. I wouldn't go anywhere else!

name: Kevin Hawkins
text: Over two hours wait in ER to be seen. All the while in constant pain. Was told an hour when I signed in.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case. Please email your contact information and reference this review if you would like management to follow up regarding this concern at HospitalReviews@Ascension.org. Thank you for reaching out to us..

name: Alexandria MacEwen
text: Worst place. They took an IV out of my arm and threw it on a chair. My blood is still probably in that room. I had to yell for the nurses to pay attention to me because the main practitioner forgot to give me the “buzzer”.

name: Marinda Spradley
text: Paid up front for a test and was told I had paid in full. Months later, St. Vincent's sends me a bill for an additional $500! Said they did additional tests that I didn't ask for nor did my Dr ask for but I have to pay for. Very deceptive Drs.  Watch your wallet.

resp.text:
Hi, Marinda. I'm so sorry to hear about your experience. Thank you for letting us know. I have sent your comments to our leadership team. Please send your contact information and any additional information to feedbackAL@ascension.org.

View and edit

name: Renny Reyes
text: Nice care passion staff

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about your experience, Renny Reyes. Listening to our patients is important to us.

name: Derek Walrond
text:
Arrived at 11:45am left at 3:30
NEVER SEEN!!!! This place is a joke.

name: Renee Callahan
text: Did great job in a emergency for a good man.

name: Country Mg
text: Shitty

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Country Mg. Feel free to email us at HospitalReviews@Ascension.org with more detail if you want to share.

name: Deborah Robinson
text: Great

resp.text: Deborah Robinson, thank you for the high star rating!

name: Myra Grimes Lunsford Bedsole
text: I had a small surgical procedure done recently at AH.  Everyone was great!  I couldn't have asked for a better experience than what I received.  All the staff was very professional and very skilled at what they do.  Everyone from admissions, Dr. Kelly, outpatient staff to OR staff was awesome!  Thanks for all you do AH!

name: Carrie Grissett
text: I had the best birthing experience!  All the nurses, Dr. Carney, and Megan provided me with excellent care. The EVS and food services were very kind and did great job as well. I plan on having more babies and will definitely have them here at Andalusia health!

name: vickie grissett
text: The Outpatient Surgery Unit is great! They did a very good job with my husband when he was there. Nice, courteous, friendly and caring staff!

name: Deb Gladney
text:
In and out quickly for out patient surgery.
Every one was helpful and very good at their jobs. Can honestly recomend Andalusia Health.

name: Rick Taylor
text: I went in for upper GI with Dr. Day, last week. Everyone was awesome and very attentive to my needs. Very good experience with all the staff from check-in to check-out. I have used this facility on several occasions and have always gotten top notch prompt service. I am going back this Wednesday for a colonoscopy and hoping for the same kind of care. Thank all of you for your dedication.

name: Tyler Ryals
text: I had an EGD by Dr. Day. Excellent service from all of the staff from the time I walked in the door to register until I left to go home. I would recommend Andalusia Health to anyone looking for excellent and professional health care.

name: Douglas Blackwell
text:
I have had a lot of medical procedures the past few years, I have never had an experience as good as I had at Andalusia Health!  Dr. Long is top notch & has a great bedside matter, which I believe is missing these days.  Every nurse & hospital personal I came in contact with during my procedure was the most professional, caring , patience, nice & understanding group.  A special shout out to my nurse, I am sorry to say I do not remember her name because I got side tracked after she told me she was originally from Prichard, Al.  I have relatives from Mobile .  So I started calling her Ms.  Prichard.  She was absolutely
Amazing!   She took her time. She did not treat me or my wife like she was on a time schedule & had to get us out of there!  Wonderful experience when you are stressed & concerned.  The only average to low side was the front of the hospital morning receptionist, she was just a little grumpy!

name: Carrie Hawkins
text: My husband has had 2 procedures here in the last few weeks. Both times we had a great experience. Staff was friendly and helpful. Instructions for discharge were detailed. The outpatient surgery department and OR staff were great!

name: Carol Bray
text: Had aVERY nice experience at the Radiology department at Andalusia Health!! Called back 15 min before appointment. The ultrasound tech,Jason, was very nice and professional!!

name: William Hall
text: I had hernia surgery this morning in the outpatient unit. The place was spotless, staff were extremely nice, professional and very helpful!! I wish I could remember their names so I could publicly acknowledge them. I would recommend this place to anyone!! I hope I never need another procedure but if I do this is the place to be!! Thank y’all for the care that you provided me!!

name: Jason Hawkins
text: I had a great experience in the surgery department. I was made to feel at ease from the time I walked in the building. I felt the staff was knowledgeable and prepared for my procedure. The doctor was on schedule. I was provided with excellent instructions on discharge. Everyone was great!

name: Robin Eshbaugh
text: I experienced nothing but professionalism and care from the staff. From check- in through discharge everyone was great. Thank you

name: Jo Anna Straughn
text: I had outpatient surgery, all the nurses were amazing and put me at ease, provided me with everything I needed and thoroughly explained each step of prep for my surgery. Ava Morrow, Nicki Hall, Amy Rayborn, and Carrie Hawkins were my nurses and each of them were amazing. I would not hesitate to use this hospital for an outpatient surgery again.

name: Daniel Wells
text:
I had an outpatient surgery procedure recently. The entire staff was friendly and professional. Pre admittance and day of admittance went smoothly and surgery was a success. In and out in just a couple of hours.

Great job offering quality services to the local community.

name: Libby Barnes
text: My husband had outpatient surgery and we were pleased with the care, friendliness and positive bedside manner provided us.

name: Julie Bembiri
text: I had surgery here on Tuesday. From the ladies I met on Monday for my preop work until I had surgery and left on Tuesday...everyome the nurses and doctor were wonderful. Thank you for doing a great job❤

name: Candida Nelson
text: The staff in outpatient and surgery did a fantastic job.  The were friendly and kind and took great care of me. The nurse who took care of me during surgery, explained every well and Anesthesia and the tech were all professional and kind!  Thank you, your team did a great job

name: Sally Gaines
text:
Went to ER was taken back quickly. The gentleman was very polite and kind.
The nurses was not. She was using the needle digging around saying I can’t get any blood as it was pouring out and she had to wipe it up.
Dr Miller was very professional and kind. The nurse sure needs a new profession.

name: Loy Sordo
text:
It was ok a wonderful experience,the labor room was big.
We got treated good,The hospital fed me and my husband,hospital gave him a free mask, we received a upgraded meal with sparkling grape juice champagne bottle and a strawberry cake. The nurses
gave me everything i needed. My doctor was their, that was very important to me.Over all nice service.I would refer this hospital.

name: Keith Mckathan
text: Professional and polite, really had a great outpatient experience.

name: katara k
text: Had a very terrible experience working here will never go back. If you are in the medical industry and you are Afro Latina, Hebrew, or Any person of brown ethnicity do not bother to work here.

name: Sonja Godwin
text: I want to rate one part of the hospital the outpatient part. Went in as a patient for Dr. Day. I found the out patient staff to be very professional and seem to be concerned about my comfort and well fair.  While I don't remember much about the Operating room or recovery.  My pre-op  and discharge nurse Sarah was great, along with the anesthetist Willie.  There was a slight problem starting an IV but that was the only thing that could have went better.

name: Chris Reynolds
text: Just got home from outpatient surgery. All went extremely well. Nursing care was great. Anesthesia, operating room and recovery personnel were great. Great directions for aftercare from Dr. Wells. I stated to my wife as we left, we’re so lucky to have such a good facility locally.

name: Lauren Hose
text: I had a great experience with Andalusia Health. The staffing was friendly and helpful. I needed to get imaging done, and Andalusia Health was able to fit me in quickly and get me out efficiently which allowed me to get to work on time. I come from a bigger city where normally it would take weeks to get in. “Some times you wanna go where everybody knows your name..”

name: Heisenberg Parks
text: If there was an option for 0 stars I would give it. First off theyre the MOST inconsiderate hospital me or my family has ever had the displeasure of being sent to. Secondly theyre not a hospital, theyre a band-aid station. They don't even bother rating your pain. Everything from a scratch to a broken back gets Tylenol. If I broke my back and I'm paying out of pocket for the bill, give me something stronger than Tylenol. And third, my wife has called and called begging them to send a bill so that she can send it to her insurance company to be paid and they straight out refuse. They've sent everything BUT the actual bill. Do yourself a favor if you find yourself needing an ER trip. Go to Opp Hospital. Its not far its worth the extra miles. Andalusia WILL KILL YOU BEFORE THEY HELP YOU!

name: Mari B
text:
My issue is mainly with the ER. I went in with serious breathing issues and the flu. First off...the room was not at all clean which was disturbing! Next they took their time as I was put on a IV for my medication. They left me there without checking on me long after the bag was empty. They walked around talking outside and mind you....it wasn't busy at all in the ER!
On top of that they give me tylenol and another drug that could be OTC not telling me my Medicare and supplement insurance would not cover these OTC drugs and the amount I have to pay is astronomical!! I wish that there was a better hospital near me!!

name: Kristie Lagarde
text:
I really wish that you were able to give zero stars. This place doesn’t come close to deserving a half of star.
Yesterday while visiting our camp in Alabama I became very ill all of a sudden. Started passing out, loss of strength, shortness of breath, and severe vomiting. My husband rushed me to the nearest hospital which sadly was this one.
Never have I seen a hospital that instead of being manned by a human being you had to press a doorbell for assistance. With so many people in the waiting area no one could remember who pressed the button first and we were told it was a first come first serve basis. This is ludicrous. It should be based by emergency circumstances. After sitting down for a few minutes and no one coming to check on us another patient said he had been there for over 2 hours and hadn’t spoken to the first person yet. I asked my husband to drive to the nearest fire station so that someone on call could check my pulse, blood pressure something to ease my mind that I was not having a heart attack. Needless to say no one was at the fire station and thankfully we found The Main Street clinic that was able to see me. If you feel like you are dying you are better off driving to another hospital you may have better chances on surviving.

name: Crystal Lopez
text: Very bad experience

name: Daniel Sordo
text: Great memories. Thank you

name: Thomas Moore
text: I had surgery fri. Morn., all nurses and doctors were very kind and caring they took very good care of me during and after surgery.  Would highly recommend hospitals and staff.

name: Charlene Walls
text:
My 75 yr old mother was seen here and diagnosed with a very severe UTI, so severe she was slurring her speech and dropping things. It took 2 hours before they started any antibiotics or fluids. She was told a ambulance could get her back home as she had no ride, that was a lie. I found out the next morning she had to sleep in the waiting room from 10 p.m until she got picked up at 9 a.m..no.pillow, no blanket, no food and Not one person checked on her during the night. She should have been admitted but instead was placed in the waiting room...disgusting care...

home when she was discharged as I did

name: Alex Benet
text:
I just had my colonoscopy and EGD. The addition was fast and uneventful. In the outpatient surgery the room was clean and the gown and towels ready. The nurses were very polite and professional. The anesthetist came to my room for final questions and to sign the informed consent. They did bring me into the operating room where the full staff was ready. The procedures were done after i was under general anesthesia performed by Willie Furr, CRNA. The surgeon surgeon, Dr. Tim Day did come to my room about 30 minutes after the procedure to inform me about the preliminary results.
Great job, in about 1 hour I was ready to leave.
If you need a colonoscopy I highly recommend this facility.

name: Kirk Webb
text: Could not have been happier with this place. We were in the ER for quite a while, due to the rooms on the second floor being full. But once a room became available, they moved my wife right up there. The nurses were very helpful, knowledgeable, and kind. It did take a while for the doc to come see us and tell us what the verdict was, but there were other patients that were in much worse shape. My family has been here multiple times for this or that and I have no complaints.

name: Cameron Tankersley
text: Good. People writing bad reviews just don’t know how hospitals run and think everyone should bend over backward for their terrible mannered selves.

name: Amanda Owens
text: I wish I could give this place zero stars!! Do not waste your time going to the ER if you are bleeding out. They have no concept of what the word "emergency" means. The incredibly rude girl at the desk that had the nerve to roll her eyes at me needs to be FIRED! I'm currently in the ER in Dothan with my husband who will be having surgery soon...much better care here.

name: Amber Skye Cook
text: E.R. absolutely horrible. Had to wait almost an hour just to get a room in the back an another hour before I even saw the doctor. 10/10 would not recommend. It would be better to die in the comfort of your home.

name: Taylor Sikes
text: Bet hospital in the world... No Cap

name: Dance It Out
text: This place is the worst you can hardly get any service, the people don’t check on you what so ever, I have been here for 5 hours and have barely had anyone look at my friend I brought to the hospital. The staff is terrible, I’m disappointed this is my third time in this hospital with a bad experience like this. Someone take these people back to medical school and re-educate them in the field of medicine, because obviously they can’t do anything other than sit around and talk or go to the cafeteria.

name: kaleigh bowden
text: Really should be a zero!! I gave birth to my 3rd son at this hospital. Very very very unprofessional. This place is not equipped to care for newborns. My week old son still has 8 different little cuts in his heels from being poked for labs. Another spot in his hand from an iv. He was noted by a nurse to have rapid breathing a few hours after being born. And because the nurse felt my mixed babies complexion was not normal. Hint MIXED they started blood work. After keeping his under lights even when his levels were not high and poking and running labs when they all kept coming back normal. They continued to give him antibiotics and iv fluids against me. I am a lab technician myself. I knew his labs and his levels were fine. The Dr ignored my request all day. Even advised he was keeping him for jaundice for 5 days even though his levels were so low that he wasn't even a low risk. His breathing was rapid but his vitals were noted and taken when his temp was 99 degrees from the incubator or at the same time they were poking him for labs. After seeing his regular pediatrician I was notified that the levels were never high enough for him to have suffered any of the treatment that was given against my wishes repeatedly!!!! I even asked if I could sign an AMA form to have my son released. We were treated as prisoners with no regard this being my child and I not agree with treatment. I sincerely hope no other person or baby ever has to endure this horror. A birth is a wonderful beautiful thing but this is one awful experience I will never forget.

name: James Boswell
text: Used the ER on Friday 13th 2018 for my wife Hilda. The only gripe I have is the way you are handle when you arrive, they let you wait in the waiting room until they decide to take you. Should something be serious they have no way of knowing. This needs to be changed... Quickly.....

name: Denise Jewell
text: Stayed there in early June for 5 days due to surgery. Took my pillow with me because hospital ones are horrible. About a week after I got home, started noticing bites on me. I thought it was fleas since I have 2 dogs. IT WAS BEDBUGS! Still fighting the infestation. Of course I can't prove I got them from the hospital and nobody there will help me and I can never talk to the same person twice. Wound up having an allergic reaction to the bites and being put on steroids. Thanks a lot!

name: Jessica Armendariz
text: Do not attend this hospital unless you want to die, lose a limb, or be completely ignored. They will use you for your insurance/money. They will not treat you. They will act as if they are better than you. They have no idea what they are doing. Please, for the sake of your life. Do not attend this hospital!

name: Laura Baker
text:
For those who need to know and won't encounter rude employees. When you go I , ring the doorbell and a nurse will call you back. Both times they've gotten me back pretty fast and got us out fast. Only good thing about this ER.

Anyways, I have been to this ER twice since I moved here and BOTH times I have encountered RUDE employees. The nurses were nice and helpful, but as for the others, no. I get working on night shift isn't the best thing in the world, but please learn how to be nice to your patients. Worst hospital I've ever been too.

name: Kaytreen Ziglar
text: I really wish there was an option to give them 0 stars, they don't even deserve 1 star! 😤 This is the sorriest hospital I have ever visited! They have major additude issues (the nurses especially) and they take their precious time no matter how bad you're hurting! 😠 I really believe the only way they would actually MAYBE try and help you the way they should is if you flatlined, other than that......THEY WILL NOT DO ANYTHING FOR YOU!! If you need help of any kind the Andlausia hospital is not the place to come looking for it.. 🙅🏻

name: brandon stiller
text: A week after taking a drug test and not hearing nothing back my company calls and say they never sent it off... this is the 3rd time this hospital has messed up with paperwork

name: Deirdra Trawick Belton
text: I don't have any complaints with the Andalusia hospital,nor do I have any complaints with the doctors  or the nurses. my complaints are with Dr. Wells OBGYN clinic front desk staff in Andalusia .
