They are nasty with their patients ,they have nasty attitudes,they are the biggest liars I've ever known. and  unwilling to help in a serious situation I will be taking my complaint to CEO Clint Kendall. ASAP

name: Cyndi Oneal
text: 1 patient ahead of me...I was n there 2 1/2 hours.  Go elsewhere.....

name: Rob Bettis
text: For a regional hospital, I was very pleased. I had to stop in the ER, while traveling through town. The staff far exceeded my expectations. The service was quick and caring. It was a very positive experience.

name: colt eppes
text: The emergency room staff is awful. I came in with severe head trauma and was not seen for an hour. No one even checked on me in the waiting room and that is a state requirement with head trauma. I was bleeding all over the floor and everything. And here recently I went in with the flu only reason I went in there was because it was the middle of the night. I didn’t get proper treatment and a week and half later i get tonsillitis so I go to the Main Street clinic and they gave me antibiotics shots. Prescriptions and a steroid shot and iv fluids. AT A CLINIC. why the hell couldnt a hospital do that!

name: Hau Boutno
text: This place is the worst. While there are SOME very caring nurses and doctors, they don’t seem to be around often. Treatment is slow and drags on longer than it should. The air filters in the rooms are COVERED in a thick sheet of dust. Can’t imagine what they look like behind the A/C cover. Know-it-all CNAs talking down to family members, saying there are no such things as HIPAA release forms. Telling family members to go back to their rooms. I could go on and on. You might be better off going to another city’s hospital, unfortunately.

name: Terri Moore
text: My 2 year old grandson was admitted into the e.r. with a 102 degree fever. The e.r. doctor was rude and told my daughter in law he did not know what to do since he just had a fever. 530 am at 1030 am she is able to get him in to see his soon to be pediatrician. They swabbed him and it comes back that he has strep throat. How could a e.r. supposedly doctor not know to do a simple swab test? Do not take your babies to this e.r..

name: Joseph Land
text:
Andalusia, we have a problem. And it’s a big one.

On Monday (May 20,, 2019), my brother had an outbreak of Cellulitis, a bacterial skin infection that he has had since college. When he has a Cellulitis outbreak, he has to get medical attention immediately because it is a life-threatening infection that can spread into your lymph nodes and bloodstream quickly. Every single time he has had an issue, we have rushed him to the ER. Nearly every time he has been admitted for anywhere between 2 and 10 days. It is a serious condition.

Will is a truck driver. He was out to pick up a load when he came down with this infection and was so sick that he had to have a stranger take him to the ER at Andalusia Health. Typically, the ER nurses recognize the severity and get to him quickly. Not Andalusia Health. M the waiting room quickly, it was three hours before any medication was administered. Since he was on the road – and has insurance – he requested that they admit him for the night so he could regain his strength and get enough medicine in his system to get back home so he could see his doctor. Remember, he had to drive an 18-wheeler all the way back home. The ER staff at Andalusia Health knew this. They refused to admit him, telling him he “didn’t fit the criteria.” Please, can someone explain what criteria one must fit to be admitted into this hospital? Is it the Harvard of hospitals? He was extremely ill and had insurance. This should have been handled immediately.

While he arrived at the ER midday, since he didn’t get to see anyone until late, my mom called the ER to explain his medical history since they would not be able to contact Will’s regular doctor. The nurse she was talking to hung up on her mid-story. And, as Will was getting his bearings and getting dressed to go back to his truck to sleep for the night, he wasn’t fast enough for one of the nurses who told him – and I quote – “I know you aren’t feeling well, but you have to go. We need the bed.” Is Andalusia Health a Level 1 trauma center? The ER in a town of 8,787 (as of 2017) is that busy? The hospital has 88 rooms. Was 10% of the town so sick they needed to be in the hospital? I’m asking. No, seriously, I am asking. Someone please tell me.

Andalusia may or may not have Uber drivers, but my brother couldn’t find one. Nor a cab company. He had to call central dispatch and have a police officer take him back to his truck, where he slept overnight, with Cellulitis raging in his body. Without any medical attention. Because Andalusia Health failed. Big time. I don’t know who was on duty other than Sara Purvis, the certified nurse practitioner who saw him. But, I know that Kim Carol is the ER manager. I know that Amy Herrington is the director. I know that every time I have gone to their website, they boast the wait time being 30 minutes or less. I know that they claim to have “experienced” ER physicians and staff. I know that they failed to live up to that promise. I know that I expect a call from Kohen Johns Brannon today. I know that someone needs to clarify what happened and why it happened. I know that my brother is still sick and sitting in a truck in Andalusia, Alabama right now.

name: Secret Squirrel
text:
Horrible care facility. I entered the facility with my left index finger sliced open to the bone. I waited for over an hour and a half to be seen. Finally was put into a room just to watch TV for another hour. Finally a person come into the room to tell me there was nothing they could do for my cut. They sent me packing with some gauze and tape and told me to keep it clean. Days later it started to smell so I went to a real care facility that actually stitched my finger up. It healed but I no longer have feeling from the cut to my finger tip.

I received a bill for $275 a month later. I called and explained that they did nothing for me. A review was supposedly opened to explore the case. I was never apprised of the findings until a creditor called me to collect the money. Here I sit deployed in the desert of Iraq while my wife and kids are home worried about a debt collection.

I will be getting a lawyer to fight this!

name: Nicole Adamson
text: No star wasn't a option......be warned!!! In order to be seen by ER Dr you ring  a door bell to be seen by a triage nurse whom will take you to room.....my symptoms was heart issue, swelling and tight chest took them hour to ask who was next , I got in the room and dr came in and asked what was wrong the took my blood pressure and hooked things up to my heart all within 20 minutes dr said my heart was fine and I "could go home" so I had to take everything off...blood pressure cup and monitor and I walked out as I was told to do.......

name: Amanda Cain Few
text: Very friendly & knowledgeable staff they're takin gr8 care with my daughter during her pregnancy

name: Chris Spurlin
text: I was  at the hospital  with my gf we stayed  in there for 2 hrs today the doctor  had to be hunted  down  to come see us then when he came in he was a but hole from the word go he never looked  at my gf when she told him what was wrong with her and said what do you want  me  to do he is very rude!!!!!!!!

name: Madison Ward
text:
Terrible on call doctor.
Roger boyington

name: Zariaa Parks
text: This place is horrible and slow. When I came with my mother the nurse had a very bad attitude

name: violet cook
text: I wish I could give this place zero stars. I took a travel assignment there and stayed one day. the unit Manager was so disorganized. the employees were rude and jealous of travel pay. they still do paper charting, didn't have respiratory therapy at night, no person designated to watch telemetry for the entire hospital, AND I never got paid for an entire night of misery trying to work in this unsafe and hostile environment. they are the worst organization I have ever encountered.

name: Jared Nichols
text: Recently had an emergency visit to the Andalusia hospital, wow what a well run facility. Minor finger trama, was admitted, xrayed, dressed up the wound and had prescriptions in hand on the way out the door in 1 hour 25 minutes. Last time I had dealings with Crestview it was over 3 hours just to see the doctor for the first time. Andalusia is now my local hospital of choice.

name: Jennifer Brooks
text: Very over priced for mediocre care. Some of the nurses are very friendly but when I was in the er I had to ask to actually see the Dr. He was irritated by my request although he sent me a bill for $500 and the er bill was $1400 for 3 x rays and a shot. I couldn't walk and had to request crutches. This was my last visit and similar issues in the past with my children.

name: Dallas Pulley
text: They don't try to help find what is wrong with you whatsoever just a very sorry hospital

name: Ron “Yogi” Terry
text: Great people - Hospital had a name change in 2016, now Andalusia Health

name: Johnny Wilson
text: First impressions could be nice.  My wife is a diabetic with extensive conditions.  We have been to several hospitals on her behalf for extended stays.  The Andalusia Hospital was not only ill prepared to handle her condition when she was having a glucose low and her body was in the early stages of shutting down, but they immediately upon taking her back, which took 18 mins while gasping for air literally, cut her new shirt off even after we told them why she was short on air (diabetic ketoacidosis) and they did not listen at all, refused to listen, cut her shirt off even when she was able and we offered to take it off, then they refused to replace it!  They had the night Doctor to come see her and he said he was not able to help and he was calling another doctor, then after 20 more minutes we were informed that yes Andalusia Hospital was UNABLE to treat this condition, a common diabetic condition.  We had to leave that hospital, since they wanted to charge us for an ambulance trip to Pensacola FL, I drove faster and called the police depts ahead of my way and had no problem the entire way speeding very quickly, and she was treated immediately at the Pensacola Sacred Heart Hospital.  I will not return to Andalusia Hospital unless I have NO options.

name: Bobby Burke
text: Wish I could give a zero they didn't even check me out all they care about is money and these people are so rude

name: Theresa Noll
text: Slow emergency room, nurses that don't know, doctors that don't care

name: colton schofield
text: Been here five hours

name: Jennifer Kelley
text: Do yourself a favor and drive 30 minutes to an hour and get REAL medical care.  NO STARS!!!!!!  There should be a Zero Star rating!!!!!!!!

name: Mike Jackson
text: They came to me when I was icu telling me I owe them money and I need to pay it and I gave them my credit card and paid and at the time my family was there listen to what they done to me and she said she was only doing what her boss told her to do ....Now I find out they broke some laws took money when I was dope up now they wait till I was on drugs and ask me for money how do I know what they done to me after they put me out can some please tell me ?

name: Grace Wergin
text: The place is overall okay. My experience was decent. The food is good, and the rooming is pretty clean. The staff on the other hand wasn’t so nice. A lot of times they were demanding towards the psych patients and rude to us for no reason.

name: DeAsia Knight
text: This is a very helpful place that provides you with coping skills and therapy so that you are able to live your life happily again. You can actually have fun here even though you’re in an in-patient psychiatric hospital.  Does not feel like a prison like Mountain View Hospital.

name: Andrew C
text:
Amazing place with top notch staff. They have a gym you go to everyday to shoot basketball, lift weights, or do yoga type stuff. The grounds are well run. You'll paint, do crafts, listen to music, learn about your illness. The actual medical care is top notch. See a doctor everyday (not a resident). The nurses are all compassionate and dedicated. The techs are cool if your chill they are chill. They give Suboxone if you need it. They let you stay on methadone if your on it already. I've been there a number of times as a patient and I will not go anywhere else in Birmingham. The other hospitals are terrible compared to uab

The only downside is everyone wants to go here so you'll spend a little time in the ER waiting on a bed.

name: Ivy West
text: When I was 15, which was 5 years ago, I was hospitalized here. I don’t know if they still have the same rules and what not but It was honestly very helpful and I felt like I was being cared for. I was a troubled teen and was in and out of other mental hospitals that left me with PTSD. However, UAB was the best and I would recommend going here over any of the others faculties. You don’t feel like a mentally ill patient here! (Unlike the other mental hospitals)

name: Rebekah Peterson
text: the food is really good but the staff isn't very friendly

name: fawn
text: i just got out of this hospital about 3 weeks ago for attempting suicide, and it was the second psych ward ive been to, my 3rd time going to one. i will say compared to the other hospital i went to this one was pretty great. it actually made a difference in my life and, although there were incidents where other patients went off the wall and got into arguments (i have ptsd from domestic violence and abuse so that gave me anxiety attacks) i know that we all had our own problems and other than that everything was fine. there were one or two nurses that didn't have the best attitude and came off rude, but the majority seemed very caring and actually talked to the kids like we were actual humans which seems to be rare in places like that. the occupational therapy we did was really useful and taught us to occupy our minds with things we enjoy doing and saved all the personal talk for the therapist/doctor. i can honestly say i learned a lot from this facility :)

name: Elizabeth C
text: I was visiting yesterday and visitation hours are from 6-8. It was exactly 8:00 and they told us visitation was over, so as we got up to leave we asked who his nurse was because we wanted to speak to her. (He had just been admitted around midnight the same day) Another nurse looked at us and says "Ok well it's still 8:00 o'clock" in a very rude tone, like it doesn't matter we need to leave. 8:00 o'clock or not, we have every right to speak with whoever his nurse is. The hospital does not close at 8, just visitation hours and the nurse did come out to speak in the hallway, but that other nurse was very rude and unprofessional. If she acted like that with us then I'm sure she's even worse with the patients. I would like to file a formal complaint, but I'm not sure who I should contact and I didn't get her name, but I would definitely recognize her.

name: Jessie Odell
text:
Jessie Odell in regards to our autistic son George.

Well we were singing dr Kathrine sherry Freeman’s praises until we had to burry my granddaddy today who had been sick with cancer. Our son was in her care, and after checking him in, our granddaddy took a turn. I called Dr Kathrine freeman to advice we would be checking our son out for the funeral so he could say goodbye to the only granddaddy he has ever known since he is adopted. Dr Kathrine Freeman said she wouldn’t advise that. I told her I appreciated her advice but we’d still be taking our son to the funeral as that is what families do in Alabama. Evidently she isn’t from the south?  She had already explained her it was her opinion that my son didn’t understand anything. My son is autistic with a low iq. He understands just fine, the issue is figuring out how he processes things.  On top of her calling Alabama’s dhr supervisor in an attempt to block me from taking our son, she also attempted to issues an AMA (against medical advice) which could cause our insurance company to
Reject the charges, and refused to send any prescriptions for the mental health drugs my son receives.  When your child
Has been on mental health drugs for more
Than a week or so it’s very dangerous to stop them cold turkey. Luckily our family physician is able to help us so my son wouldn’t suffer from withdrawal symptoms, such as seizures and other issues. I fear for the safety of other children at this facility under her care who’s parents may not have the means to reach out to a trusted family dr to help in the event she does this vindictive, and unprofessional behavior to someone else’s child.

About the time my granddaddy’s service was over today she had her secretary call our cell phone to inform us that since we removed our son from the hospital she would no longer be able to work with us and took it upon herself to cancel all my son’s appointments at Ireland Center.

Mrs Ireland has been a friend to my family for years and this isn’t the kind of legacy for helping children she would have chosen to leave behind.

It appears this dr seems to miss the point that the parent is the one who makes decisions. Dr’s are hired to (advise), this doesn’t mean we will always agree with what they advise. Especially when the death of a loved one is concerned. At this point we are now filing a formal complaint with the Alabama Board to review this Dr’s lack of professionalism and dangerous practice of dropping a patient without necessary mind altering medications.

I’m really disappointed that she turned out not to be the caring dr we thought her to be and instead a very dangerous one.

Jessie Odell

name: josh wright
text: In order to be admitted into this hospital they MAKE you go through the ER. It took us 9 hours of waiting to be seen, only to be told oh well here's some other medicine, try it and follow up with your normal doctor. If you want to be admitted just threaten suicide because that's the only way to get in.

name: Nazmi Naziya
text: Dr. had great bedside manners and was super nice.  I am so happy that I found this urgent care and I highly recommend anyone to go there.

name: Agustin Latorre
text: Very professional and caring staff and Doctors. Fast service and kept in touch to make sure follow appointments were set with specialists.

name: Patricia Jones
text: Service is very slow.

name: Mary Scaife
text: The hospital staff the  nurses, LPN and, information center was kind.  They are taking care of my uncle in room 225. When you ask for assistance they will help you friendly every time. They take out the time to answer all your questions with patients. They made my uncle comfortable. I ask them  them for and extra pillows, so my uncle left neck be  supported. They gave me a pillow no questions ask and said i was welcome . I ask for some ice personally for myself . I receive ice  with a  you are welcome.  Thanks again Lake Martin Hospital you all are outstanding and generous.

name: Meka David
text: Unprofessional,Very Disrespectful,To Many Attitude And They Be Worried About How Many Times You Have Came In A Week's Time Like do it really matter how many times someone comes in it's your job to make sure the patient gets the properly medical care while their then maybe we want have to return so many times for the same thing in a week's time frame then have the nerve to speak on something situation behind they Back like we don't have ears y'all sorry staff didn't take correct procedures the reason why WE RETURN 8-10 I A WEEK TIME BC IM GOING IF I SNEEZED

name: J Darnell
text:
Great little country hospital...they've saved my accident prone husband more than a time or two! The doctors and nurses have all had the best attitudes, and they're always willing to work on ya even when you may not have the cash to cover the entire costs.

They've just opened their new sleep study lab, and we're looking forward to taking advantage of that opportunity close to home (and considerably more affordable).

We owe this hospital much gratitude, and I'm thankful they're there to service our rural community!

...but the picture with this listing is definitely not Lake Martin Community Hospital.

name: Leigh Haffner
text:
This is a very small rural hospital, with a very small medical staff and very limited resources. The Doctor who I saw was very informative, thorough and knowledgable. I felt like I was in good hands! I only waited for 2 hours as opposed to the 6+ hours I would have waited at EAMC! That is the shortest wait I have EVER had at ANY emergency room, and I have lived in 3 different states, many cities/towns and I have visited several ER's in my lifetime for various reasons! I felt my wait-time at LMCH was reasonable considering there was only one RN and one Doctor treating 3 different patients and one of those patients  had to be life flighted to Birmingham (without hesitation)!  Yes...they have a helicopter landing pad for major medical emergencies! Their genuine concern is doing the best they can do for their patients, with the limited resources that they have! I was very impressed and I left feeling better than when I first got there...I mean, after all, that is the reason for going to the ER to begin with, right?

The avatar (photo of the hospital) that someone decided to use is "stock" imagery and is not a photograph of the hospital...in fact, it's not a photo at all, it's a drawing! That photo never concerned me! I don't feel the image was used to "lure people in" deceptively! It is just a generic photograph used as an avatar...nothing more, nothing less! I took a photograph of the hospital, that I decided to share, for those who want to see what the hospital looks like!

NOTE: There is a pharmacy located in front of the hospital, though I do not recall the name of the pharmacy or the hours of operation?

name: Brandy Price
text: I live in dadeville. And this hospital picture is a LIE the the real hospital located in dadeville. And I don't know with picture they are using but it sure isn't lake Martin community hostipal.

text: Good hospital for where it is

text: Fortunately, I had time to research several ERs (through online reviews) before I went. NYU Langone had the best reviews by far and I am happy to say that after going to the ER I couldn't agree more.  I went around 6am so I was seen right away (no waiting) and everyone was very caring and extremely thorough. The facility was extremely clean as well. Thank you to everyone who make this ER the place it is - well done!

text:
I went to the Tuscaloosa VAMC after returning from the Iraq invasion in 2004. As I approached the main facility, I was heartened to see the surrounding grounds to be manicured, in the exact fashion of the Army I knew in the 1970's. The fine, old building has been very well cared for, and that, only happens in the presence of deep respect. When I went inside the building, it was exactly the same, with very close attention to every detail, and I fully expected to see the hospital's Command Sergeant Major to be personally monitoring the conduct of each person I encountered, for any hint of policy, or AR-670-1 infraction. When a command is this sharp in every place you look, It's a good bet that the command is that sharp in the other places as well.

Well Done, Tuscaloosa.

name: Amy Walker
text: This place has some of the most fascinating history in all of southern Alabama. I’ve been trying for 10+ years to find a “legal” way into this place, preferably before a lot of renovations are done, mostly for the sake of documenting the ACTUAL history of it, no matter how dirty and gritty it may be. I do understand there are structural issues with many of the buildings making them unsafe to go into...but that doesn’t mean I couldn’t be allowed to explore the OUTSIDE of the buildings and photo-document them before they collapse or are razed.  There are some buildings that just peeking in through doors and windows would be enough for me to capture the essence of this place. I’m ESPECIALLY interested in finding the cemetery and identifying exactly how many graves there ARE, and where. I know of one woman who used to work there who had preserved records (the only ones I know of) that included the burials on the grounds-but she died years ago and I have no idea what happened to her research. 😞  I have spoken extensively with the director of the Alabama cemetery board to try to obtain access at least to these graves...as Alabama law states that graves cannot be privately owned, even though the land around them can be, thereby making it difficult to obtain access many times if landowners are not agreeable to this. From the inquiries I’ve made over the years, the Alabama Department of Mental Health, which currently owns the entire complex, is not allowing ANYONE (except reporters and “historians”) inside the complex. HOWEVER....I’m still not giving up!! At some point soon when I have time, I will get back on the case and try again to plead my case!! (Will definitely add my photos here to Google Maps if I’m ever that lucky!!)

name: David Fillmann
text: 10/10 bando, but sad to see the buildings crumbling from neglect. Walking along the front wall of the old armory building will take you back in time over 160 years. Hopefully some of these old historic buildings can be restored someday.

I asked several times for pain medicine to subside my pain, and they wouldn't give it to me. Instead, they made me sit and cry in pain, and told me I needed to provide a urine sample to see if I qualify for pain meds. They were very rude and judgmental. They make you feel unwanted and like a drug addict when all you are waiting is something to ease your pain, and I would've even been okay with ibuprofen, but they wouldn't even give me that.

They have no care, the staff talk among each other  about other members of the staff instead of assisting patients. They plan their weekends talk about lost animals and put you last. They treat you like a total stranger instead of someone who is sick. I absolutely hate this place and if I would have been aware of where i was being taken to in my condition I would have suggested somewhere else immediately..

name: Wendy Burgess
text: I was recently admitted to this hospital and I had nothing but an awesome experience all the way around. From the housekeeper's, dietary, lab techs, and cna's to the nurses and doctors. Even anesthesia during my unexpected surgery and the recovery nurses were wonderful. They were all very attentive to my needs and checked on me regularly and made me feel like they cared. The nurses would come in at the beginning of their shifts and introduce themselves and were there for me all through each shift, no matter what I needed. And the doctors were like clockwork rounding early.  I never had to wonder when the dr was going to come see me because they were there every morning to see me at the same time and let me know what was going on with my care, test results, etc. I couldn't have chosen a better hospital to have to be in for 4 full days. I can not thank the staff enough for the quality of care they provided. I would definitely recommend anyone to go there.

text: I have been Hospitalized here twice in the last couple of months and have had 2 visits to the ER, each experience was great, from the Drs. on call Dr. Macbeth and Dr. Jon Yoder, both went above and beyond trying to get to the bottom of my problem and they did! The whole ER staff was very caring and concerned and I have no complaints at all! The entire Hospital staff was very accommodating and showed true concern from the Lab employees to the ICU staff! name: C D
text:
Worst hospital experience ever!
Like another person wrote, you walk in with an ailment, but will be treated for something completely different.
In my case I was seriously bruised up from an accident. Dr. Elizabeth Bataglia came back a couple of minutes after a urine sample was taken and told me that I didn't have any injuries from the accident but that they would treat me for an STD instead, right in front of my fiancé!

We went to a different health care provider a few days later, who also took urine samples from the both of us.
They said they would send it off to a lab to get a correct result.
It came back negative!

We have been together for years, so how could I have an STD according to Dr. Bataglia but not according to the lab?!?!
Obviously someone (the staff, nurses or doctor) made a serious mistake in giving me an incorrect diagnosis, and simply being diagnosed with an STD is an embarrassment in itself!

This hospital and their personnel should be ashamed of themselves for not taking patients nor their health seriously!

That was the last time we went to this hospital. Ever!
They don't have to worry about us coming back.
We will be going to a different health care provider from now on!

Unless you want an incorrect diagnosis, Stay Away from Atmore Community Hospital!

text:
Took my fiancee to the ER a few days after being released from a better hospital due to kidney failure from a severe infection. The staff is rude, unprofessional, and they do not seem to care if they help you it all. Seems like they just want to get you out instead of taking time to actually investigate and treat your ailment. I walked outside to make a phone call to my fiancee's family to inform them that she was sick again, and when I came back in the lady at the front desk rolled her eyes and very rudely stated I was not allowed to see her per hospital rules. So if you have a loved one dying don't expect to be able to say goodbye in the emergency room at this hospital.

All in all a very negative experience and she didn't receive any treatment at all. In my opinion you are better off taking your loved one or yourself down to Mobile or Pensacola if you have an emergency and the time to get there.

text: I was very impressed with our visit yesterday.everyone in the office were very nice and helpful..the thing that impressed me the most was instead of hearing uh-huh ..uh-huh and being handed a prescription for anti biotics and steroids for my children they listened,asked questions,and explained everything needed..

text: Went here feeling awfully sick a while back. Ended up testing negative for Covid after they gave me the rapid test. After a couple of shots and some medication I was feeling like a million bucks. Pleased with the treatment I received here.

name: Haleigh Anderson
text: I would absolutely recommend this facility to ANYONE! They have turned my father's vision from being almost completely blind back to 100% vision and he is feeling like a new man. We have just had one successful cataract surgery and now awaiting the 2nd one. We're so blessed to have had the professionalism from the entire staff. They were wonderful with their customer service,and his doctor's,nurses,and all staff made us all feel very comfortable before they took him back for surgery. UAB Callahan Eye Hospital is one of the absolute BEST around!

name: D Hardy
text: Came in to the center as a referral. Navigating through the parking garage was a confusing mess as they are working on the elevator service. Arriving to the eye specialist, new patients have to type and scan in their personal information. Arriving at my appointment with the Doctor, they had know idea why I was there. Unprepared staff and office pieced together my referral from my Doctor that I called three different times to confirm the appointment on both ends. 160 mile trip one way. Mostly a complete waste of time. Also with the parking voucher, only pay 5 dollers instead of the normal 20 dollers...Never again.

text: Dr Rosenstiel and her staff function like a well-oiled machine--very efficient. They are friendly and seem to genuinely care.

They assured us that everything would be fine. 3 doctors examined her thoroughly. They really cared and took the time to identify the problem. Highly Recommended.

name: Susan Crawley
text: This concerns my husband, he started going to Dr. John Mason, when he started having problems with his right eye, to find out later when he was sent to Dr. Mason, he had a Retina vein ocullison in his eye, also better know as a stroke in his eye!  They have done several treatments to his eye especially this last September he had to have surgery when his eye started bleeding behind the eye, they repaired it through this surgery, he did lose partial sight in his eye when the stroke occurred but they have helped him so much to have a balance in his eye to and his other eye to secure that his sight will remain good! He goes for regular check ups about every four months! I would highly recommend these doctors to anyone that has eye issues beyond your regular eye doctor that you see yearly! I imagine you probably need a referral since they are specialist! Be sure and check with your insurance provider!

name: Julie Lance
text: When to Eye Foundation ER today, on website states open 24/7.  My husband got piece of wood in his eye.  We waited an hour and told no physician was there.  I asked why would they not be physical/ resident to cover ER, they said he was somewhere else and a Resident would be here 20 minutes.  How can run an emergency ER with no physician.  We left untreated.

text: Had an amazing experience from the second we walked into the door to the very end as they helped her into the car. The staff was amazingly sweet and very helpful. Definitely the most positive and amazing doctor appointment I have ever experienced since moving back to Alabama.

text: I have had to bring my mother-in-law to the eye center a fee times. They always make me feel welcome as well. The rooms are very comfortable. Their food is great. I am surprised by the food every time.

name: Barbara Wilson
text: Dr was great, explained everything. Staff polite.  Time spent in ER, 11 hrs. Needs improving. Only 1 person in waiting room when I arrived.

name: Will Slappey
text: The other day my 16 month old son needed to be seen here. The nurses gave him a stuffed monkey and were so sweet. The doctor that saw William was thorough and communicated well. This was our third experience here in the last three years, and all of our visits have gone well.

name: Mary Ladner
text:
I just left the emergency room and going in I was skeptical, mainly because I had read the other reviews.  I am so glad I didn't feed into the negativity and decided to judge for myself. Dawn was my nurse and so pleasant and patient with me.  I also was seen by Dr Juan? spelling may be incorrect but also very nice. I learned what my mother had already taught me, never assume you know based on the opinions of others, judge for yourself. Great advice momma R.I.P and thank you. I am still listening :)

Also the Dr. can really rock a handlebar mustache!

name: George Guilford
text:
First impressions are everything in repeat business! I am very disappointed in my "very short" visit with Dr. Rosenstiel and staff. (Well I didn't even meet Dr. Rosenstiel???!) Being that I live in Montgomery, I have to request a day off for ALL my eye appointment visits.  I am not new to UAB Callahan Eye Hospital as I've had multiple surgeries within the last three years there. As a matter of fact I just had an appointment there two weeks ago with the incredible Dr. Priscilla Fowler and staff.   I've been diagnosed with Kerataconus and Dr. Priscilla Fowler is my primary eye doctor.  Dr. Fowler and staff are some of the nicest people I've met in the eye care industry. Earlier this year and this past month I received the Cross-Linking  procedure.  I spent over $6000 within the last three years at Callahan eye.  Dr. Fowler and staff treat me with respect on EVERY visit,  yet on December 10 with Dr. Rosenstiel and staff I felt the lesser of.  This visit was scheduled to replace my old sclera lenses with new.  You would think before my arrival they would've did their research on my condition.  Upon my arrival in the room, Dr. Rosenstiel's nurse asked if I ever had sclera lenses?? (I'VE HAD SCLERA CONTACTS FOR THE LAST 6 YEARS??) From there, he goes straight into and I quote, "before we even see you, you have to pay X amount of dollars!?. Furthermore, he adds, "The Lenses will be an additional $XXXX.XX amount of dollars to get them?   Now at this point I was feeling as though they did not want to help me as Dr. Fowler and staff did you for the last couple of years.?  Now do mind you I've already spent thousands of dollars to get my eyes corrected.  The money is not an option, but I felt inferior to his demands.  I also wondered have they even looked in my charts from previous visits.? "Have they even checked my insurance" I thought to myself?  At that point I asked him a series of questions in terms of verifying my insurances and deductibles. To no avail he says nothing will be covered. Now as I mentioned money would not be a concern as I've spent a lot of money to fix my Eye disease. ( As well as the removal of an tumor in my eyelid two years prior ).  More questions came to mind in this parlay with Dr. Rosenstiel's nurse.  At this point I felt that the nurse is trying to rush me so he leaves then comes back with a business card and prices on it. He then states, " if you have any questions please call Melissa" on the business card. I agreed and proceeded to leave. Upon leaving, I felt very embarrassed to even be there. I rushed out and got in my car. I kept thinking to myself "have they even check my insurance". So I called my wife, and she confirmed we do have Eye insurance.  I decided I needed to call them back to confirm and verify with them that I have insurance, the same insurance I've used last three years. Two calls later and one left message, I still have not heard from Melissa, Dr. Rosenstiel , or the male nurse that was talking to me. I never even got to meet Dr. Rosenstiel??? I will still come up to visit Dr. Fowler but I will do my business elsewhere in finding new Sclera lenses!
Very disappointing!!

name: John McDole
text: Whether visiting the Emergency Room or scheduled surgery this is the place to be for anything eye related. Over the years we have never had a problem or bad experience or even an unpleasant encounter. Everyone is very professional. The doctors offices being within the complex make it convenient and the parking deck connects to the complex.

text:
I took the day off from work to drive 2.5 hours to take my son here. Apparently the optometrist had to take the day off the day before so she was seeing yesterday's patients as well as todays. Which is fine.
What is not fine is the complete lack of foresight or common courtesy to call today's patients to inform them they may have to wait longer we have been waiting for 2 hours and are looking at atleast another hour wait before our son is seen. text:

name: Chris Mahan
text: It is very concentrated on helping people live better, and the medical staff is excellent.

name: Miss Un-PC
text:
My mom and I were rear ended severely a while back by a young boy more interested in his cell phone than his driving.
At first, I didn't notice anything wrong. Later that night, my right eye had a shadow-like film over it. I didn't think anything about it at first. Later that week, I notice my vision was decreasing. I was half blind in my right eye. I went to my eye doctor. After a check-up, he said my retina was partially detached. And, had I waited a week or so longer, I would've have gone permanently blind in that eye. I got an appointment at the Callahan Eye Foundation.
The doctors, nurses and receptionist were very nice. The surgeon did a fantastic job reattaching my retina. The only thing that was a bit frustrating was that gas bubble. But, it kept pressure on my retina. Now, my vision in the right eye was like it was before the accident.
If you have a problem with your eyes that a regular eye doctor can't treat, then I highly recommend the Callahan Eye Foundation.

name: Jay J
text: I wish I could give a minus star. I stopped by here with a rash on my skin near my eye after hours. I was afraid that it might swell up and cause me further issue. They sent me to the ER. I asked could I see someone not in the ER so I would not have to pay so much, but they said no. So I saw a doc in the ER. He looked at my eye and said it was a common rash and said he would give me some antibiotics. He stepped out with the door open and talked to the nurse. I caught them laughing and looking back at me because I came in for a skin rash near my eye.  I believe I was in there for almost 2 hours and I did not see another patient. The lady at the front desk was rude, the staff was rude and even with insurance I still had to pay over $300 .

name: Bert Bloomston
text:
I was extremely pleased with the  personal care and attention provided me when I arrived at CEH. I arrived a few minutes prior to the appointed time and waited just a short time prior to be taken to a bed where I was prepped for my cataract surgery. I honestly did not have the feeling that I was in a medical facility, but a facility designed  for the extreme care and concern for a person. All of us, I believe, have anxiety prior to a surgical procedure, however the staff made me feel comfortable and relaxed. I took special note that Mr. Sprayberry was on the floor chatting with the patients and the staff. That is certainly a rarity in today's world of medicine and certainly could not be found in many or any facility today. Also, I learned that there was patient advocate on the floor.
Congratulations to all and to Dr. Sara Mullins for the outstanding treatment and personal attention. Your hospital is way above just first class.
Thank you again and I told many of my friends about your outstanding service and personal care.

name: 2k tips
text: So sitting in the waiting room of St. Vincent’s Blount waiting on my appointment. All of a sudden the receptionist, patients and staff are running screaming at me to run down the hall. They scream over the intercom code silver. I get up and start going down the hall. The first waiting room I came to was x-ray. The staff inside locks the door and I’m tapping on the window to find out what’s going on. Just so happens I know one of the woman working there. A gentleman asks her if she knows me and she replies yes. They slip me a note through the door telling me to call them in 15 minutes. I hear a woman inside say get forceful and tell him to leave. I turn to look down the hall and every soul is gone except for me and the man who stole a gun out of a car in the parking lot. I had no idea where he was. No one would help me or tell me what was going on. I was locked out in the hallway that is at least 80 yards long by myself with no means to defend myself. The man was obviously sick and out of his mind. I saw him when I pulled up and he gave me an uneasy feeling. I was not scared for me but thought to myself what if an elderly/young woman or a child walked in the door behind him what would they do. The only thing I could think to use to defend my self was a chair that was sitting in the radiology waiting area. I said to myself he will probably shoot me but hopefully I can beat him enough with the chair that he couldn’t hurt anyone else. I was starring down the hall waiting for him to walk/run towards me and I was going to do my best to stop him with a chair. Another thought I had was if I had my gun on me I would at least be in a better position to defend myself. Luckily the police got there and disarmed the man. I was so mad at the hospital staff for telling me to run down the hall and then locking me out of EVERYTHING. I was nothing more than a target at that point. I could understand their policy a little better if I hadn’t been waiting for 45 minutes in the same chair they ask me to flee from while rushing other patients into offices to protect them from a possibility bad outcome. I asked the Administrator what was the big plan for me. Wait till he shoots me then scurry on over to the E.R. All he said was this is not supposed to happen here. Needless to say I am extremely, extremely disappointed in the way St. Vincent’s Blount handled things today!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Complete negligence for patient care!

name: Kandi Warnock
text: I have had a bad experience with Dr Little every time I have been seen by him. He has horrible bedside manner , seems like he does not want to be there and you are wasting his time. I was sent by home health  care for fluids due to dehydration from Dysautonomia, he proceed to say here drink Gatorade , I politely told him I am allergic and he still insisted it was what I needed. I have Dysautonomia and require IV fluids , if Gatorade and water worked I would not be coming to the ER. It is a well  known fact that in the area,  he is a horrible doctor, most call friends to see if he is on call and avoid to go if he is there. I can say being an Army for many years , seen dozens of doctor’s he is the absolute worse I ever encountered. You have a 50 percent chance of getting a good nurse.

text: Family member admitted for extended stay for rehabilitation due to repair of broken hip. I spend 5 days here helping care for her. I am so impressed with the kindness, compassion and all around professionalism of the staff. The sweet folks that cleaned the room did excellent work. The dietary staff staff were so quick to bring a different item if we asked for it. The meals provided were well prepared and delivered with a smile. The RNs were precious: Madison, Haley, & Hazel showed pure loving care and were so patience even when we seems to be pressing that “call button” every 5 minutes. The case manager went above and beyond to keeps us informed about what needs we might have in the future. There is an obvious Godly spirit guiding the workers and medical staff here at St. Vincent’s Blount. I will never forget the kindness and love shown to my family. And they have free wi-fi.

resp.text: Hello Lynn Wray Dillard. Our hospital aims to deliver the highest quality patient care. We love to hear about these positive experiences. Thanks for sharing this feedback with us!

name: tiffany self
text: Told me I had a stomach bug on Friday but turns out had to go to a different hospital Saturday because I felt 10 times worse come to find out I had covid the whole time.

name: Angela Jackson
text: Long story but I should of never went.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Could you please contact us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so that we may have someone follow up? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Michael Hammett
text: Ok I made it through

resp.text: Feedback is important to help us improve. Please contact us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) at your convenience so we may discuss your review. We appreciate your time and hope to hear from you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Emily Harris
text: Do not go to the Emergency Room. Intake nurses act like they hate their job and don't want to be there and Dr. Little has seen me have seizures several times and sends me away even when I am in status epilepticus, bc he thinks that anyone not acting "normal" is on drugs. Told the staff at SVE I was coming there and I was a drug addict. They took his word without so much as a drug test and nearly killed me. He refuses to give me medication when I have a bad migraine that lasts 9 days bc he thinks I am a drug seeker. Quick too judge and not quick to help. He needs to be fired.

resp.text: We are always looking for ways to improve. If you're willing to discuss this in more detail, please reach out to us at 205-930-2372 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm). Thank you. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Tammie Lynn Anne Ceja
text: Prompt, emphatic, professional and fast care. In other places it's not unheard of to wait hours.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! We will be sure to pass it along to our team! -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Mr.bones
text: I went there because my knee was fractured and they said because I can move it there's nothing wrong and then they x-ray my wrist

resp.text: We work hard to provide high quality of care. We would like the opportunity to work with you directly regarding this review. Could you please reach out to us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) at your earliest convenience? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

name: Johnna Battles
text: I absolutely love this hospital. They are always quick to respond to you and you or your family member is made to feel comfortable. The staff are always polite and friendly. The only time I have ever seen them be rude to anyone is when the patient demands medication for pain and tries to tell the staff how to do their jobs. Great Doctors and short wait time.

resp.text: Johnna Battles, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at St. Vincent's Blount.

name: Allison Dickinson
text: I received 10 star care in the ER recently while getting care for food poisoning.  They got me back quickly, awesome Rn got IV on first try (and I was dehydrated). Everyone who entered my room was very helpful! Even the lady who took my insurance info brought me warm blankets! Thank you for making an awful night a little more tolerable!

name: Genie Biondini
text: I have relied on this hospital for 12 yrs. This is a super place. Down home place, and everyone that works there has a heart. This entire county+ replies on it. I recommend it to my Mom, she loves it.

resp.text: Genie Biondini, thank you for sharing your observations with us. Feedback helps us know what we’re doing right or where we need to improve.

name: Amber Allen
text: I would not suggest this hospice company to anyone who cares about the terminally ill patient. Our nurse hasn’t answered our phone calls on the first call yet. Thankfully my father was only on hospice 5 days before passing on. The morning he passed, we couldn’t even get someone to answer the “emergency” number. I got in touch with an operator and she transferred me to another extension, who  didn’t answer either. My father passed at 9:30am on a Thursday, so anyone who has a loved one pass at an odd time of day my heart breaks for you because you will be looking at your deceased loved one for an extended amount of time. Once my father passed (at a rather young age) naturally my mom wanted the hospice bed out of her living room. On day two after his passing, we called frequently throughout the day about the equipment being picked up, after being assured it would be. At 6:30pm on day two, my husband called again to ask when the equipment would be gone and the lady said not today and hung up on my husband after he explained to her the equipment would now be outside for them. This is not the kind of experience you want when losing your father.

name: Laura T
text: Wish I could give 0 stars. The staff is very rude and quick to judge. They screwed up on me multiple times where I nearly lost my life and family members as well that have been there. If you want your life saved DO NOT go here. They deserve to be shut down. Maybe that will happen one day.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Pandi Bear. Please email us HospitalReviews@Ascension.org so we can address your concerns.

name: Meme Jones
text: The service has been great for my mom. Rated a three for the quality of the food in cafeteria and how expensive it is for food. Having to pay full price for three meals a day gets expensive. Wished they had at least a discount card for sitters that stay with loved ones while they are in hospital. We help out a lot in caring for loved ones to make it easier on you guys. We should be able to afford to eat here while we stay. Disappointed.

name: Brandi Underwood
text:
If I could give no stars, I would!
I went to the emergency room there yesterday burning up with a fever, chills, sore throat, body aches, ALL FLU SIGNS. I was aching so bad I was in TEARS. They didn’t run a flu test, they pretty much laughed at me and told me to take some ibuprofen and sent me home. So I knew I had the flu and decided to go to boaz Er where what do you know, I was burning up and I have the flu.

I’d seriously hate for anyone deathly sick to have to go to Oneonta emergency room because they would just laugh at you and send you home to die.

Sorry but if you can’t thoroughly check out your patients and give them correct treatment you do NOT need to be a nurse or doctor. I wish I knew how to call and properly complain on them.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Brandi Underwood. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Lee Hardin
text:
The wait time in the ER wasn't too awfully bad.
The staff was very nice to my mother and my family.
My only real complaint is the hospital looks and feels unclean.
The place generally just feels and smells nasty.

People friendly for the most part.

resp.text: Lee Hardin, thanks for taking the time to leave your rating. We'd like to learn more about your experience. Would you mind sending us an email to HospitalReviews@Ascension.org with your contact information?

name: Shannon Trammel
text:
The place smells dirty and always has leaks.
Some of the staff in different areas are genuinely nice while the others are very rude.

I don't see that it is managed very well but it never has from what I understand from older family members.

When I have to come for anything, I feel like a cow being herded.
It's disappointing having to go to Birmingham because we live here.
Sad

resp.text: If there is feedback you'd like to share, feel free to reach us at (205) 939-7264 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm). We're always open to feedback as it helps us improve. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Brandon Barkley
text: Legit one of the worst hospitals out there. They would sooner let you die than actually treat you. Avoid this hospital if possible

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case. Please call us at (205) 939-7264 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm) so we can address your concerns. -St. Vincent's Health System Community Manager

name: Polly Nix
text: Unless you are about to drop dead, you would be better off driving on to Birmingham. They are soooo slow! I take my elderly mother here for care and we always have to wait. Most of the doctors come up from Birmingham anyway. I don't think any of them ever look back at their records, we have to fill out the same forms and have had the same test run numerous times. Just try not to get sick in Blount co.

name: The Stuart Yeager
text: Bad experience in admissions  dont belive they even attempted to file with insurance company was billed excessively for labs that insurance should have covered. Do not go here and get ripped off. Lady in the lab was great. Would not recommend go somewhere else that's interested in you not how much they can shake you down for.

resp.text: The Stuart Yeager, we'd like to look into your experience. Would it be possible for you to email us your name, details and date of visit? You can email us at HospitalReviews@Ascension.org. Thank you!   St. Vincent's Blount Community Manager

name: Avery Nichols
text:
Some of the staff in E.R. and Med Surg are very rude. They are definitely not attentive.

Place always feels nasty to me, smells unclean, public bathrooms are messy, and patients rooms do not get cleaned like they should.

resp.text: We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case, Avery. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns.

name: Chris Mahan
text: They gave me great service at a reasonable price. The staff and doctors are caring people who put the patients needs first.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about your experience, Chris Mahan. Listening to our patients is important to us.

name: Dalton Wester
text:
I had two  heart tests scheduled with the Birmingham Heart Clinic at St. Vincent's Blount as well as a stress test to be done at St. Vincent's Blount on April 29th.
I reported to BHC for the two heart tests and was told the tech who did the tests was not available that day for some reason.  I came back to the hospital later that morning for my stress test.  Heidi did the stress test.  She learned that I had been unable to complete the other tests by the BHC tech that morning.  She said that the hospital had had a cancellation that day and asked me if I wanted the hospital tech to do my tests to save me another trip.  I agree and she called and set up the other tests for me and they were completed in a timely manner.  I wish to commend Heidi for the  way that she handled my stress test and also for going the extra mile to get my other tests handled the same day.

resp.text: Dalton Wester, thank you for sharing your observations with us. Feedback helps us know what we’re doing right or where we need to improve.

name: Janet Holloway
text: They need to ask for the visitors information when patient goes in the back room

name: Shannon Nappier Reynolds
text: My son went in with a very itchy rash that kept spreading. He was sent home with prescriptions for three different diagnosis. He visited the health department with a friend and was diagnosed with scabies. Recently a close friend has had several abdominal pain, she was told she needed to loose weight after waiting 8 hours to be seen. I rushed my son to the ER for sizures he's started having with his diabetes he could barely walk. I was told had I called an ambulance they could have got him straight back sooner for us to take a seat. Thirty minutes went by and I had to show myself to get the nurse to come to the waiting room. The nurse flipped out when his sugars were so low that the readings didn't register. The lady at the desk just acted as if she just hates her job.

name: Chy Goodwin
text: Would give 5 if nurses came around to check up on patients a little more often!  Usually don't see anyone (unless i call, that i don't like doing for everything little thing) sometimes 3 hours.   Great, friendly, and caring staff!!

name: kimberlina68
text: Been here twice for outpatient services Radiology and Lab. Love it.  ***Edited because ER Dr Little is horrible, he does not even do any appropriate testing. He is so concerned about not Admitting anyone, under any circumstances. Then BILLING is making huge errors, BALANCE BILLING which is Insurance FRAUD!!

name: James C
text: St. Vincent's Blount can now change the name to The Place You Go To Die just like the old hospital. They let another person die in the emergency room. My Friend would still be here if we could have gotten him to another hospital. You get a 1star because that's the only way I can post. Also I took my wife there about a year and a half ago we sat in the waiting room for 6 1/2 hrs only to be billed by the Dr. for treatment we never received. We are planning to report the Dr. To both Medicare and Medicaid and BC/BS for false charge's because the Dr. Refuses to fix the Bill.

name: Jairren Siffles
text: Anytime I've had to go they have been great and I'm there for an hour at the most

name: Pat Pate
text: LONG wait to get into ER . When finally in Dr Thomas was rude, unprofessional, uncaring after 6 hours we got to go home. Not even sure if her diagnosis was correct. Definitely won't go back if she is on call.Everyone else was kind no complaints against any nurses or aides.

name: Alicia Mena
text:
Came in about 1am, empty ER. Taken back immediately for my five year old.

Nurses were curteous and nice. However, Dr. Scott 'I'm an arrogant prick' Davidson seemed, very unconcerned about my daughter.

Ordered Blood and urine analysis and CT, milk what you can from Medicaid, I guess.

It's currently 4am, and still no type of diagnosis or input from the doctor.

It's reasons like this people avoid hospitals🏥.

name: Kyle Willis
text: Last time I was there I was there to be treated for severe burns due to a trash fire explosion, came in and admission took forever and was told to wait in the lobby until I could be seen. I had to keep a cold towel on my burns for what seemed like an eternity. Should be shut down

resp.text: Hello, Kyle. Please call (205) 939-7264 so we can address your concerns. We try very hard to meet expectations and we regret that we have not done so in this case.

name: Amber Woodard
text: Horrible place. Took my 5 month old daughter to the er last night for screaming and running a fever. Also mentioned she's had ring worm for 2 months now and her pediatrician won't prescribe her anything else. Doctor told me to change laundry detergent because that's how it spreads.😂😂 will never go there again.

resp.text: Hi, Amber. Thank you for taking the time to share this information. I have forwarded this comment to our leadership. Please feel free to send your contact information and any additional details to feedbackAL@ascension.org.

name: Susan Spiker
text: I have brought my sons to this ER multiple times for stitches, broken bones, and a concussion over the past few years.  We have always been treated nicely and have been in and out in a timely manner especially since this is an  ER and often someone with something more serious comes in while you are there.

name: Tony K
text: Old lady at the ER check in needs to be educated on dealing with customer / patient asking questions before checking into ER !!! Just kept insisting that my wife sign in, sign in, sign in WITHOUT ANSWERING MY DAMNED QUESTION !!! Asked if they had an Catscan or MRI. She didn't know but really wanted us to check in to generate a bill for my insurance. Bad Old Lady 😈!!!

name: Dolly Munster
text: There needs to be a negative rating. Long waits. Rude staff. Incredibly noncaring doctors. Dirty facilities. People deserve better than this.

name: Donna Segers
text: I have been sitting in the ER for 3 & a half hours waiting to get my foot x-rayed.  Dr came out in the waiting room an hour ago and said they were going to get it x-rayed soon so I could have results if I ever do get in a room...still nothing. No triage no x-ray nothing going on 4 hours!!

resp.text: Hi, Donna. Thank you for taking the time to share this information. I have forwarded this comment to our leadership. Please feel free to send your contact information and any additional details to feedbackAL@ascension.org.

name: Timothy Hacney
text: have not been able to stay awake for days and nights, high temp, unable to eat. i am a diabetic. my sugar levels  have been 121 or lower for months. the first thing Dr Thomas asked was if i was diabetic. I said yes, she then replied " Therein lies the problem" . I have never known my sugar to cause me to run a fever of over 102 degrees. This ER is a JOKE and been for as long as I can remember. he Dr came back and said my sugar was fine that I needed to schedule a appointment with my PCP.  needless yo say I left saying a few choice words that the whole er could hear.

name: Melissa Graves
text: My mother has COPD and it has been acting up and she has been coughing severely. I took her in yesterday to the er and all they did was give her a breathing treatment, prescribe her a steroid, and send her home. The only reason i took her there was it is the only one in the county. NEVER going back.

name: Brittany Schaffer
text: Horrible ER! Do not waste your time coming here. Waited for over 5 hours in the waiting room while my husband had chest pains. By pass this hospital and go to East or Downtown!!!!

name: Debbie Bellamy
text: Physician and Nursing care excellent, friendly staff.

name: Jaida Johnson
text: The biggest joke of a hospital that I have ever seen. Don't waste your time here.

resp.text: Hi Jaida Johnson, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. If you are willing to give us another chance, please contact us at HospitalReviews@Ascension.org so we can understand your situation better in order to try and turn your experience around.

name: Eric Hunter
text: One hr an forty-five minutes after arrival, that's how long it took before they took my wife's vitals. After that, we were sent back into the waiting room for another long wait.

name: Candy Donovan
text: I will die at home before I go back to this place. This hospital is a joke.

name: HeatherL
text: I did wait for 3 hours for the whole process to get in, get treated and on my way out. But I also had Netflix to occupy me.

name: Joshua Jackson
text: My girlfriend sat there for three hours and all they gave her was instructions on seeing a primary care physician. Throughout the night her coughing and sneezing got worse and her throat hurts even more, she has almost completely lost her voice. She is clearly sick and they didn’t do anything for her. We will not be back.

name: Zachary Bennett
text: Broke 6 bones in my foot/ankle and the doctor refused to see me a second time, but charged me $640 to wrap it in an ace bandage. Very horrible people

name: Raymond Kenna Jr
text:
Had an appointment for 3:50 pm , signed in at 2:20pm.
Finally got called back to exam room at 4:20pm.
Doctor came in exam room at 5:06,
saw his patient for a total of 5 minutes

name: Crazy Gamer
text: I wish that I could give a negative rating we have been waiting on the doctor for 1 hr 45 minutes in the room and the doctor has been sitting at his desk not moving at that time

name: Britnie Owens
text: Rude staff members!!!

name: Paula Valdez
text:
(Translated by Google) They take a long time, and that
That it is an emergency, one dies there

(Original)
Tardan mucho, y eso
Que es emergencia, uno se muere ahi

name: Carol Roberts
text: My husband has been a patient here on several occasions. I know people generally talk badly about the VA, but we found the medical center to be clean, prompt and we'll organized. The wait for appointments and procedures can be long, and they never seem to be able to get our paperwork from other VA branches, but the care is fine.

name: A. Fabian Portela
text: I've dealt with the VA prior in El paso and they were great.I requested the community care and I received it.I got a primary doctor through the community care and shortly thereafter, I was able to see specialists for different ailments that I have. Central Alabama VA does not care about veterans. They are very lazy, incompetent and dreadful. I moved here in August, I requested to see a primary doctor in September. I waited and I waited and I waited. I filed two complaints and then finally I get a primary doctor in January. Yes you read that right January. I see my primary doctor, and I request to see a specialty doctor. He puts in the console and I'm waiting and waiting to to no aveil. I called up Community Care (you have to call them as soon as they open,or else you'll never get a chance to talk to anybody.) I told them it's been a long time since my doctor put in the referrals. Why hasn't anything happen? They said it was kicksd back because of an error. I asked him why didn't they inform me or the doctor?they said it was because it was a doctor's fault. Which I know it was totally their fault. That's another thing they don't take responsibility for nothing. I almost forgot to mention prior to that, when I was trying to get my primary doctor they couldn't even do the most simplest things like send the referral to the doctors. They told me that they did it but in actuality they didn't. They are so full of themselves and they're very unapologetic. They just don't care, and nothing ever happens to them. They never get in trouble. They're telling me that I need to check up to see if I get my referrals. That is absurd, I've never called community Care in El Paso once to see when my referrals have been approved and I was waiting on it the doctor. In El Paso I dealt with TriWest. I don't even know what we deal with here. By next week if I don't hear anything, I'm calling to make a complaint once again

name: T Potts
text: Wait times here seen long. Much prefer the Tuskegee campus. Adding some pics from the Chapel on 3rd floor

name: David Whitehead
text: First time visit this year.  AWESOME.  Wasn't familiar with facility so asked a Staff member in the parking lot for directions.  They were on their way to lunch but took time to walk me all the way to my appointment.  Along the route all the Staff we saw were very friendly and greeted us.  I only had to wait a very short period for my appointment.  Dr. Thompson, audiology, was extremely helpful and knowledgeable.  Had gone for a hearing test a couple months prior to a civilian practice.  The results were the same and Dr. Thompson was more than willing to explain things and answer any questions I had.  Very enjoyable experience.  Thank you all.

name: Edward Spaulding
text:
This was the best experience, I ever had at a VA Medical Center!! The ER Doctor and nursing staff were awesome!! They did not make feel like a number. They were compassion and concern for me.
Kudos to the Montgomery VA ER Department!!!

name: Christopher Stitcher
text: Man I could write a book from the past 4 years I've attended this place for medical care. Coming from a veteran who does not complain about much this place is horrible from the staff to the doctors. I have met a single hand full of people that are helpful here IN 4 YEARS, only 5 people I can think of. I have tried getting a new PCM, with no luck. Tried reaching out to the Mental Health Dept. to get assistance with PTSD and anxiety and was told the next appointment was 3 months away, which was today. After waiting for 30 minutes for the Psychiatrist to call me, since we are doing Covid procedures it's a phone call instead of face to face, little to my surprise there is no phone call. AFTER WAITING 3 MONTHS FOR HELP... If I could give less than 1 star I would. I've used the Perry Hill location and Chantilly with the same results.

name: Barb
text:
Greatly appreciated the care and immediate attention! Night & day shift were very polite and ensured I was & felt properly cared. They treated sudden acute pain and wrote a note for work. Treatment plan is currently working. I had a bad experience many years ago and it took extreme pain for me to go back. I'm glad I did! Highly recommend night shift! We shall see about day shift as I hope to transition back to VA from private practice I've been paying $$ to see.

Follow up: still doing great!

name: Jimmie Landers
text: This VA really sucks.... They drag ass to get to people. They would rather be talking all on their phones and talking and walking around rather than getting to their patients. If you are a vet and need to go to the emergency room I believe I would go to a regular hospital than going to this place. You will be seen a lot quicker there than having to wait 3 or 4 hours to be seen at this VA. And I wouldn't give them a whole star but that's the lowest I can give them...

name: Pandora Pearl
text: This Five-Star review is specifically for the Patient Adovate, Mr. Jeff Flowers. If you need help, this man is the best. He truly cares about Veterans and their care! God bless 🇺🇸

name: Walter
text: Horrible experience in a week of inpatient care.  Nurses joking around loudly all night, not allowing you to sleep.  Doctors are rarely available.  However, some nurses are really good.  It's a shame they keep the bad ones.

name: dc “dcwolt” wolt
text: Appointment was on time, respectful and treated well.

name: Christopher Cordell
text: Went to the er just to have the Dr tell me I needed blue cross so I didn't have to deal with the va. They need to just close it down. I'd rather go to a real hospital

name: Chris Lucier
text: By far the worst VA system I've had the displeasure of dealing with. Including Chantily Clinic and Tuskegee. Need to vet those who don't want to do the job and put those in who do. Shame on you CAVHCS... You need to model yourself after successful VA systems.... Or just close it down and let us go private sector....

name: Tamika Ashford
text: It's sad that there is only a hand count of people that work here that actually wants to help you. The rest of them are rude and unprofessional.  They half ass diagnose you and you have to make them correct their mess. Alabama VA system is horribly operated.

name: Michael Neal
text: Checked in and was seen within 20 minutes. Had a professional screening for increase in benefits and was sent to x-ray room and was seen there within 20 minutes. The staff attitudes were nice and the facilities seemed clean for the age of the place. As usual bring your own paperwork though, as I loaded mine into Ebenfits months ago and the lady still couldn't acess them and had to lok at mine.

name: DCM7734
text:
Horrible service.
I've come to the ER 3 times in less than 2 months for the same issue, and each time there I'm told that there is nothing they can do because they don't do MRIs from the ER. They don't care that I'm screaming in pain, that I can't sit still because I have severe nerve damage.
And I'm too scared that if I go to a Civilian WR to get fixed, that the VA will choose npt to cover the bill, since I can't afford Civilian Health Care.

Avoid this place at all cost.

name: Patricia Price
text: Excellent doctors and staff, clean environment, wonderful experience,.

name: Cecil Dewey
text: My doctor is a nurse practice. She is not caring at all. I would rate her at a minius 3.

name: Luis Ojeda
text: I'm not sure why I had to wait 4 hours to be seen with only 3 people there. I was in agony.

name: Kimberly Shaffer
text: Needs a lot of improvement for our veterans!!!

name: Tony Dinkins
text: Very helpful! !!

name: Tiffany Handy
text: There was no one in the waiting room so I got a room in no time. I had a great nurse, doctor and x-ray tech. What  I'm not pleased with is the staff responsible for the paperwork and billing. I have insurance that covers hospital expense but yet I received a bill for $1400, pretty much the entire cost of my unfortunate visit to the ER. So somewhere someone was slacking on the job!

resp.text: Hello, we would like the opportunity to address this. Please reach out to us at contactus@floyd.org. Thank you.

name: Patricia Brown
text: I wouldn't take my dead dog to this hospital. Went in having severe side effects to my medication and was told that it wasn't possible. Well why do my legs not work right AFTER I began taking this medicine? This place is a joke! I'll never go back there again!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We would like to work with you directly, so could you please contact us at contactus@floyd.org? Thank you.

name: Heidi Mason
text: Went for volunteering job and Krista was so sweet and good to me. She told me what was expected of me and how to do it.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review! We appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback!

name: judy jud
text: I went to er 7/5_2021 chest pains and stomach pains they xray my chest l had bad pains the Dr send me pain medians it took 1 hr to get they said I had blood on lungs they want to send to Rome ga they tried to drew blood they tried 8 time then want to send me to Rome ga by amlance I refused I drove my self in car  Rome Floyd check me out I didn't have no blood on lungs they said I got gallstones I came back home going to Gadsden al  I will not go Floyd again they tried 14 time drew blood I said it enough

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We would like to work with you directly, so could you please contact us at contactus@floyd.org? Thank you.

name: Honesty Abernathy
text: Rude phone service. Had “workers” mouthing off in the back ground while I was asking a question.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We would like to work with you directly, so could you please contact us at contactus@floyd.org? Thank you.

name: Wendy Guzman
text: The expertise and friendliness of Dr. Liu was very appreciated in our time of need. My husband’s nurse Edna was amazing and compassionate. Their knowledge and care for my husband showed.  It helped ease our minds knowing he was under their care. We are thankful for the care we received at Floyd.  Highly recommend to others

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Justin Canada
text: I went in 7 days ago with chest pains I had for 3-4 days straight, doubled vision, and congested. The 3-4 hours that I was there (only one there), I had an xray and they covid tested me and told me I would receive results in 2-3 days and to quarantine until I did. I finally had to call them 7 days later to find something out and no further concerns as to why my chest pains are there. Anyways, look for this hospital to change names to Canada Medical if anything is medically wrong with my heart bc I will sue them for every penny they're worth, which isnt much. The care was pitiful. They were rude and slow, possibly due to me telling them I was an ex-addict and not to write me anything narcotic, which they did anyways and told me to just not fill them then.

text: A nice environment  and caring staff but lack the Specialist sometimes needed. But they will transfer you to a facility that does have one.

name: Linda Mitchell
text: A moderately small cut on my 8-year-olds chin required us to end up at the CMC Emergency Room around 5 in the evening on a Wed. (We tried both Urgent Care Centers but they said we should go to the ER.)  The emergency room wasn't busy at all - maybe 4 patients.   Three hours later a doctor and nurse finally came in to apply skin glue to the cut.  They didn't really seem to know what they were doing and just plastered the glue all over the wound like a 3-year-old with a glue stick and then sent us home.  Having had skin glue used before, I knew this did not look right and you could immediately tell the glue had not sealed the wound because you see fluids building up under it.  Sure enough, by the middle of the next morning the glue had fallen off and the wound was open again.  I decided to just deal with it at home.  I can't believe that I wasted 3 hours and a huge co-pay for this level of incompetence and lack of effective treatment.  I highly recommend driving to anywhere to avoid going here and keep skin glue in your home kit. You can't do any worse.

resp.text:
We're sorry to hear that your experience was not what you had hoped for. We always welcome the opportunity to hear from our patients about how we can continue to improve our service.

Our Service Excellence team is available to speak with you and listen to your concerns. They can be reached by calling 706-509-5195.
