name: carl meyer
text: This review relates to the Endoscopy center of Baptist East.  Be aware that while Baptist Endoscopy Center and your gastroenterologist doctor may be in-network for insurance purposes when you do your due diligence and check on network status prior to a procedure, the Endoscopy Center uses out-of-network anesthesiologists who will balance bill the patient resulting in those dreaded surprise high medical bills.  Premier Anesthesia of Montgomery will get hundreds more than the hospital and more than 4 times what the doctor receives for a routine endoscopy that takes about an hour.  Shame on Baptist for not requiring the anesthesiologists to accept network rates.  Update.  After the Baptist response I contacted the patient advocate who told me this was a provider billing issue not involving Baptist.  That is exactly my point.  Baptist has its head in the sand when the out-of-network/ non-participating NURSE anesthetist that Baptist provides can demand $1080 for a 10 minute endoscopy procedure where the network DOCTOR performing the procedure gets $253.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out, Carl. We would value the opportunity to connect further with you at your convenience. As you are comfortable doing so, please call (334) 747-8558 and ask to speak with our Patient Advocate.

None of the staff seemed to have any idea what was going on and they contradicted each other multiple times throughout the night. I saw the doctor once for all of one minute. Half of which was spent explaining what was wrong with my kid for the 5th time that night.

Seriously livid I had to put my kid through that massive waste of time just for them to not help at all. Don't trust your family's health with these people.

name: pamela froese
text:
I will never step foot in Baptist East ever again. I went to the emergency room this past weekend because I was coughing so hard I was vomiting, and I was also suffering some neurological symptoms from an allergic reaction to medication earlier in the week. Of course, they wouldn't let my husband go in with me, which is reasonable because of COVID, but still stressful to be in the ER alone. They quickly got me into a room and said they were going to give me IV fluids. They placed a line in my hand (my veins are impossible), took blood, did a chest x-ray and did a urine screen.

An hour and a half went by and I didn't see any doctors or nurses. During that time, I became dizzy and lost consciousness, but no medical personnel knew because they hadn't looked in on me at all. Shortly after I woke up, a nurse named Chelsea came in my room. We spoke briefly, and I told her my mouth was dry, so she brought me lemon flavored q-tip. That was the only "medication" I was given the entire visit. After she left, I had a panic attack. I will have a panic attack at the ER on a good day, but this was particulary stressful, as I was alone and suffering from frightening neurological symptoms.

I hit the call button, said I was having a panic attack and could they give me some medication or could my husband bring my prescription from home. They said he could not, but they would take care of it. 45 minutes went by, and I was finally able to self-soothe enough that I was at least able to take a few breaths. I left my room to use the restroom next door, and saw three or four people sitting around a cluster of desks in the center casually chatting. I immediately gathered my things and asked them where the exit is. They nonchalantly directed me, until they saw the IV in my hand and said I absolutely could not leave. I asked why, since they weren't treating me and no one had seen me in hours.

The charge nurse asked to speak to me privately in my room, and laid blame on radiology being slow, explaining thats why no one had been taking care of me. I completely understand that the emergency department can't rush the radiology department, but I explained to her that no one had even bothered to peek in on me, when I was having neurological symptoms and losing consciousness, that I had been denied water and given a cotton ball, was told I would be given fluids but wasn't, but they had placed an IV port in the back of my hand anyway. I explained to her that I had a panic attack, that I had notified the nursing staff, they said they would take care of me, and not only did they not give me any medication, they didn't even come in the room to see how I was doing. I said I needed to leave and go to another ER since they refused to treat me.

She said my test results were coming back, and wouldn't I like to wait since I'd have to start all over at another ER. I said she had ten minutes to give me information or treat me. Everything came back normal. I left still suffering significant neurological issues and was still gasping for air and vomiting from my severe cough. This was the most dehumanizing experience of my life.

resp.text: Pamela, we take your concerns very seriously and would value the opportunity to connect further with you at your convenience. As you are comfortable doing so, please call (334) 747-8558 and ask to speak with our Patient Advocate. Your feedback is very important to us.

name: BYRDIE Yeah
text:
The staff in the ER was most helpful for me.
They identified what my problem was and immediately admitted me into the hospital as a patient. All of the doctors were amazing who worked with me and deserve a badge of honor. And the nursing staff on day shift on the first floor was even more spectacular! The only thing that I can say that I would have to complain about is the overnight shift nursing staff on the first floor wasn't very friendly or compassionate.
When it came down to the patient's it was like they were just there to get paid and could really care less
About the person as a human being but yet they were constantly playing these sweet lullabies over the intercom and if you would look deeper into the name BAPTIST you would discover that BAPTIST EQUALS CHRISTIAN CHURCH,  pictures of crosses are on the hospitals socks but yet the overnight nursing staff seems to need some serious interventions because they act like everything but Christian. I mean they were loudly laughing and talking in the halls throughout the middle of the night when sick people were trying to get their rest. A PCT was dancing around when she should have been doing her job and being professional. A night shift RN refused me a small cup of juice when I requested for a drink.
But I found it funny how when the morning shift took over the morning shift had no problem whatsoever getting the juice I requested. Day shift fulfilled each and every single one of my requests with no problems whatsoever at all. Another overnight PCT came into my room with this horrible frown on her face as if I'm the person whose
Responsibile for her having to work there and get paid for what she signed up for. Her face expression alone terrified me and had me feeling in fear of going to sleep once nightfall came. Personally I love the DOCTOR'S AND ALL OF THE DAY SHIFT NURSING STAFF. but to be honest baptist east could seriously consider moving forward without such inconsiderate
Overnight nursing staff. I mean it's like their saying: IM IN CHARGE, I WORK HERE YOU DONT, IM THE BOSS OF YOU, AND I TREAT YOU HOWEVER I PLEASE OR SOMETHING! When in fact PATIENT'S ARE ANY HOSPITAL'S  MOST PRIMARY FOCUS
Because the money that comes from the patient and/or their insurance company IS WHAT PAYS THESE PEOPLE'S SALARY. I mean, just think about it: WITH NO PATIENT'S THEN WHAT HOSPITAL WILL THERE BE AND WHAT JOBS WILL THEY HAVE? please do an intervention on the overnight nursing staff...PLEASE....thanks

text: Last night I had not fully recovered from pneumonia  and with fever I decided to go to the Baptist East emergency room. Please note that this may have been the worst decision of my life. No one checked , give us an update or how much longer we had to wait. My husband was checking on our status and was met with hostility, rudeness- almost unbelievably unprofessional behavior and went out of her belligerent way to make it by clear she could not have cared less. We have never experienced this in a hospital before. They literally go out of their way to make you you understand that you are NOT to bother them. I realize they can’t be fired or reprimanded but maybe they should be giving a course on very sick people and how to treat them. Explain words like compassion. I won’t ever be back to Baptist East (unless by ambulances). I will reiterate again that this was one of the worst experiences of my like life when I really need help. If you can struggle through the night- go to you own doctor in in the morning where you you have a MUCH better survival rate. I will also post this on Social  media , and every other venue to prevent people from from this horrific and dangerous experience.

text: I have delivered several children at this hospital and have never had a bad experience. This delivery was the most difficult, as well as recovery. The staff from intake all the way through to the nurses and patient techs I encountered in recovery were absolutely phenomenal. I was there for 5 days as opposed to 3 and I never felt as if I was a burden taking up a room.  I don’t know how this hospital has consistently caring staff throughout all areas, including housekeeping and nutrition. I can’t speak for everyone’s experience but I would recommend this hospital to everyone delivering children.

name: Curtis Acton
text: This hospital makes you feel like a criminal with your own newborn. Like they really think they can tell you what you can and cannot do with your newborn.

name: Kelly Slezak
text: I took my husband to this ER for more than a 10/10 back pain. He saw a physicians assistant. He couldn’t stand, sit, lay down or hardly even walk, as well as vomiting to the amount of pain he was in. His blood pressure was through the roof because of the pain. They didn’t seem to care. They gave him a shot of Diladid, which did not help the pain, an X-ray, and then discharged him. His pain continued, and he went to another ER because of this intense pain. He now has had to have back surgery to fix the problem, they didn’t care to diagnose. Because of them not taking the time to see what was causing this pain, he has permanent nerve damage that could have been avoided. We are now getting an ER bill, because the hospital billed it as a non-emergency and insurance will not pay. If I could rate this hospital a 0/10, I would.

name: Leona Williamson
text: I was very disappointed with the nursing staff. Very rude and unfriendly. Each time my sister-in-law asked for her meds. The nurse would say she never got the message. It would take 45 minutes to an hour to get them. She had to ask for her pain meds instead of them giving them to her every 4 hours. The didn't explain what they was giving her. It was very confusing. On the day she got released. We had to wait over 2 hours for the nurse to come and take out her IV. They didn't give her all the scripts she needed so we had to ask for one more. The doctor would say one thing and the nurse would act like she didn't know anything about it. I would never go back to this hospital.

name: latonya woods
text: This emergency room waiting area is Nasty 🤢 food all over the floor this is suppose to be one of the cleanest areas of the hospital and it’s Terrible if I could give zero stars I would. Disgusting

name: Dorisetta Moore
text:
I would like to thank and express what a wonderful experience I had at Baptist East on Tuesday, January 28th. I had surgery that morning and from the time
I walked through the  out patient doors everyone  was Surperb  and I thank you. You all were warm and caring. A special thanks to the nurse Mista that cared for me the night after surgery you were wonderful an asset to your profession.  My Anesthesiologist  great job with the pain thank you.  To my Dr. Dent Williams  you are God sent thank you. To the Nurse Manager thanks for coming by and too my Nurse on discharge day thank you so much God Bless you. The techs that fed me and took my vitals thank you. Baptist East I will always be greatful to you. Thanks

resp.text: Hi, Dorisetta. Thank you for the excellent feedback. We are honored to provide compassionate care to the patients of Central Alabama.

name: Summer Cooley
text: I have recently had a stroke of bad luck and been in and out of the Emergency room the past 6 months each time I am greeted by the sweetest doctor she really is the best and I was saddened to hear she had left last night while another visit. Y’all lost a good one I wished I knew were she went I would of followed her anywhere.

name: Daniel heeger
text: This hospital has been nothing short of incredible. My wife was discharged from another hospital that we had an awful experience with. This hospital was polar opposite. Incredible staff, amazing doctors. Everyone has been so kind and compassionate for us. I would recommend this hospital to anyone.

name: Ashley Fox
text: Pleased with the cleanliness and the friendly, caring attitude of all hospital doctors and nurses. The emergency department waiting room is a bit unruly, however I feel the quality of care and personable staff and doctors make up for it in spades! Doctors are thorough here, and have good bedside manner. Kudos!

name: Cayla McDaniel
text:
My experience with this hospital has been nothing but pleasant. The staff is so incredibly nice, supportive, and helpful. My doctor was amazing.
I came from a different hospital to this one and it was like night and day. Very, very positive experience at Babtist Medical Center East. I do not have one bad thing to day about this facility.

name: crystal rushing
text: This is the slowest and most dysfunctional out of order place ive ever been ....this is awful!!!!!

resp.text: Crystal, we would value the chance to speak with you further. At your convenience, please contact our Patient Advocate at (334) 747-8558. Your insight is important to us.

name: Brandy Kinard
text: Never go there for an emergency. The ER is horrible.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share this review. Your insight is valuable to our team and your experience matters to us. If our Patient Advocate can be of further assistance, please call (334) 747-8558.

name: Tina Jackson
text: This was the easiest hospital to get in and out of. My mother had a procedure and the whole stay there was very comfortable and pleasant. I highly recommend this hospital

name: BrinK
text: Multiple bad experiences here at this hospital. I would recommend going somewhere else outside of this City. City people are just rude and incompetent. I gave them a chance once, twice, three times.  Just go to a better hospital.

name: Monica Lopez
text:
I've been here a couple of times, 2 of those I delivered my two beautiful children I loved the staff they were kind and generous.
Other times we been to the emergency department also very kind staff. Another occasion we were in the kids koner amazing just amazing staff very very generous and kind all of them🤗

name: T B
text: I had a wonderful experience here for the birth of my baby! They had someone for everything! All smiles,very helpful, and the food was pretty good.Around the clock care without attitudes and positive vibes.Thanks for a great first visit!

name: Vaishali Patel
text:
I was getting someone else bill. I called the billing department millions of time so they can change a name and send those bill to correct person. After calling them for about 2-3 month. Finally it got clear.
Now after 2-3 month I am getting another bill of the same person getting admitted to this hospital under my name and my SSN.
Once again I call and call and try to make them to correct it again.
Now when I am looking at my credit report. It drained down.
What they did instead of correcting, they kept sending to the credit bureau, now I lost all my credit. Thank you very much. Never going back to this hospital.
Hold on ,.....you are not going there,.....,still you will have to pay for it....👿👿👿👿👿

name: David Chasteen
text: I go to East because they don't perform back surgery; injections and evaluation only. Baptist south quick to cut since surgeons on staff. Would give East 4 stars (day nurses and some of  the doctors are caring and qualified) but billing set up and payment is difficult to understand and getting through to a real person has been impossible. Waited on phone for 15 minutes to speak to a "representative" only to get a voicemail which is  horrible service but to make it worse never got response and now collection agencies are sending multiple bills for different amounts and still can't get anyone to answer questions. Don't know if the collection letters are legitimate and don't know what has already been paid (bcbs letter warned about fraudulent collection request) calling the collection agencies isn't option and  East doesn't answer phone. Re-reading my review realize upset at time... BUT if my back goes out I'd tell ambulance "take me to East". Def better  than avg,  when you get a good nurse remember their name and get them vested to your med needs.

name: Dominique Lee
text: I had my daughter at this hospital. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The NICU team was great and understanding. They made my time there great.

name: Torri Jenks
text: The next time this hospital tells a family they've done all they can do...I hope they've made their peace with God. I'm sick with the idea that without insurance or money there is no hope for a dying loved one. Don't say you're for the ppl when the money speaks louder. 😒

name: Emaszhai Henry
text: The ER service is like Chick fil A drive through fast thorough and efficient. Always here less than 4 hours always. Always good quality practitioners and respiratory therapist.

name: Becky Crum
text: I don't know how the "hospital stay" part of it is, I was not admitted. But...I had a CT scan done, paid my co-pay & still owed approximately $75. I sent them $20/month, and received a phone call the end of January asking about my account & when it would be paid. I told the lady that I would pay it on February 1 when I got paid. Balance of $35. The same day that I made arrangements to pay it, they sent it to a collection agency. My account was paid in full on February 2. They ended up having to pay more to hire the collection agency than what they actually got off of the account.

name: storms and weather
text: absolutely the worst er I’ve ever been to I’ve been in and out over the past 3 months first time I went I had an abscess near my tail bone the dr and nurses told me they didn’t see anything later that night I had to be rushed to Jackson they found out I had sepsis and admitted me and I had surgery two days later and I was on Iv antibiotics the next time I went back for chest pain and a high heart rate a white nurse with black long hair and eyeliner told me I should have went to my dr which it was 1 in the morning absolutely terrible place and nurses are even worse I highly recommend going to Jackson or south

name: Laura Thompson
text: This has been the most miserable experience ever. I requested a transfer this morning at 7 am and these morons cant pull it off. Incompetent, and rude. Will never come back.

name: Krunal Patel
text: Thats one of the place where you do not want to go. We came here for my dad and they did not even ask for food or water. When I ask them they said that the lunch time is over. Seriously!

name: Patti Burgener
text:
I was at the ER for about 7 hours on 2/27.  I was so impressed with my care.  My nurse, Amanda, was amazing and deserves recognition for her concern for her patients.  Even though the ER was very busy, she was extremely attentive to my needs.  I went in very nauseated, and within minutes I was getting something for that.  She also checked on me frequently because she knew I really did not feel well and was in a lot of pain.  She explained all of the tests that they had to run, and made sure I understood what was going on.  I am a very hard person to start and IV in, but she got it on the first try and I honestly felt no pain.  I can go on and on about her care, but the one thing that really impressed me as going above and beyond....she knew my husband had to leave work to take me to the ER.  She also knew this was a concern.  When she brought my check-out papers, she brought him a work excuse.  We did not even have to ask.

I wish I could name everyone who cared for me, but I can't remember all of their names.  The x-ray technician, the CT scan technician, the lab technician, the Nurse Practitioner, and even the triage nurses were all extremely nice, and gentle.  Another nurse that came by to check on me was Allie.  She was also very, very sweet and took care of my needs.  I was also very impressed when the pharmacist came to see me to make sure he was giving me the proper medicine.  I have never had that happen before.

If I could give you all a grade for this visit, I would definitely give you an A+.  Thank you for taking such good care of me.  God bless you all!!

name: Virginia Reeder
text: I've had two grandsons born here... and I got the best care a person could ask for... And the baby came down with type 1 diabetes a they treated us phenomenal... We were respected treated with kind words and kind hearts

name: June Baker
text: If i could give 0 stars i would .This hospital is awful. I recommend all go to baptist south. I was having an asthma attack and the ER doctor didn’t even give me a breathing treatment just told me to take an Advil and medicine that wasn’t working which is why i came in. And go to my primary doctor. The wait if ridiculous i had to wait 3 hours before even being seen when i clearly said i was having chest pains. Thank God i wasn’t having any serious heart issues not that they’d be worried. I will never go to this hospital again. If you see a female blonde doctor who is tall and slender she will not do anything for you. Just leave .

name: Gerald Strand
text: I recently had to have an unpleasant scheduled exam done for my health at the Endoscopy Center.  With that being said, one can say everything will be viewed with details over the stress of the process to come.  I would like to take a moment and say "Thank You!"  Especially to some of the staff who took part in my process, Kelly, Kelly, Claire and Carmon.  I know there are more, but I was conscious when I met these wonderful people.  I am not saying everyone should have this process done, but in the event where time dictates otherwise, you will at least have some great people who will take the time to take care of you as best as possible.  Thank you again:)

name: Protaja Yelling
text: Just have to take that ride to UAB in Birmingham because this wait time is ridiculous

name: Randall F
text:
The waiting room was literally SRO. Had it not been for the privacy of the more than 20-plus patients and equal number of family members required to wait, I would have taken photos.

Speaking of privacy, there is an absolute travesty when it comes to that with respect to the HIPPA. Baptist East clearly does NOT care about patient privacy, from the broken sliding door, to the intake personnel's preference to not close the door, to the huge transom over the sign-in desk. All of these allow for each and every patients personal information and health profile to be heard by the people waiting in the overcrowded waiting room. Why this dump of a doctor's office has not been the subject of a class action suit for it's gross HIPPA violations is beyond me. (And yes, I'm certainly considering just such action.)

There is also a numbering system. One gets a card with a four-digit number. Why? Who knows? I tried to ask the zombie behind the glass, but he couldn't tell me anything.

Seriously, this place is what keeps Montgomery being the butt of the country's jokes. Yeah, I said it, and sadly, it's too true.

UPDATE: After waiting two hours, I decided to take a photo to help illustrate how ridiculously crowded the waiting room remains. Also, the numbering system is broken, and there continues to be the release of patients' private information owing to the architecture of this lously place.

name: Julia Camp
text: Just be warned...when your doctor is done with you and the hospital bills you, and the insurance doesn't pay it all and you have to make payments to the hospital, they will make an agreement to accept payment and then immediately send you to a collection agency regardless of the fact that you've paid the amount you agreed to send every month and have even been early. Pretty sucky policy if you ask me.

name: supreme. zii
text: They took very good care of my great grandmother...but now she’s in heaven R.I.P😿😭😢

name: Rob Mattson
text: Waited 3 hrs to be seen, only to watch 3 other people get called before me. I never was seen I left after the fourth person was called after me. With no explanation from anyone as to why!!!!

name: Penny Sergent
text: They let my mama suffer with Pnumonia for weeks and never offered to put her on the vent which south did after she was there 30 minutes.  She got better immediately.  Then elderly neighbor was in there.  She was unable to feed herself, she was so sick.  They would drop her food off and leave her looking at it get cold.  No volunteers or anybody came to help.  I caught them.  They said somebody from her family had to help her.  She had none.

name: Cedric Russell
text: Takes forever

resp.text: Cedric, we would value the opportunity to connect further with you at your convenience. As you are comfortable doing so, please call (334) 747-8558 and ask to speak with our Patient Advocate.

name: Sarah Blakey
text: The doctors and service staff are great.  However the nursing staff leaves much to be desired.  They were slow to respond when we needed help and acted as if my Mom was unimportant.

name: Jason Cole
text: Had a good Doc in the er Dr Richards she took good care of my paw paw would recommend anyone to see her and she got good side bed manners

name: Shelly Lewis
text: The food is horrible!!! Served cold, unidentifiable,  and tasteless.  Army rations taste better. Doctors and nurses are wonderful.

name: Libby Streetman
text: Absolutely ridiculous wait times.... there is no reason I should have to wait 2 hours after my scheduled appointment time. Very displeased

name: R. Vaughn Poppell
text: Extremely friendly and caring staff. Wish they were in my hometown.

name: Mia Clarkson
text: Best hospital around. Helped me get my caregiver for my parents. We now use Home Care Assistance of Montgomery.

name: Slade The Original
text: Dr. Wang female doctor in ER proceeded to immediately lecture about health procedures and explain their hospital process instead of asking patient questions about health and the issue at hand. Barely speaks English, very argumentative and condescending.

name: Ashlyn Williams
text:
I wouldn’t give this a one star if I could 🤦🏻‍♀️

I was told I needed to have a Csection because my son would be huge. I said I didn’t want one and she said I had to have it. He was only 7 lbs 4 oz.

She did a swipe on me and I didn’t want one. They broke my water and I didn’t want it.

She said she wouldn’t cut the cord and did immediately. They did the k shot and eye ointment while my husband was there to decline.

My nurse told me I couldn’t sleep with him. I did anyways. They fed him a bottle before ever giving him to me. Even as I marked and claimed breastfed.

My nurse said I’d kill my baby if I didn’t get UTD on my shots. Then proceeded to tell my dad I was declining shots for myself and baby. Violation of privacy 🤷🏻‍♀️

My doctor said I could be dismissed and my nurse said she’d decide if I went home or not.

I’d never recommend that place to anyone. Thank goodness for midwives and home births in GA.

name: Kalia Melton
text: i recently took my child due to an head injury .. They were rude. The doctor yelled at me because he misunderstood what i was telling him. then at one point a nurse just removed my child from the room without telling me where or why he was being moved. a nurse made a very rude commemt about me &d it was just awful cause i just wanted to know what was going on with my son. It's sad too cause i bypassed baptist south thinking east offered better care .. boy was i ever wrong. i will NEVER go back to that hospital.

name: Tami Torres
text: Very friendly staff, no wait time and very thorough with my husbands care. From checking to discharge everyone was phenomenal!

name: steve ray
text:
Day shift is great, night shift is awfull. I will do anything to care for my mother, did not think I would have to spend 12 hours a day to make sure she was being attended to.

The only thing I can think of is to set up shifts to make sure my mother is being taken care of.

Why do I need to spend sleepless nights in the hospital to assure my mother has the care you guarantee?

name: Teddonna Luker
text: Information desk was extremely helpful, nurse was very attentive to my daughter's needs after surgery.

name: Betty Roberts
text: Worst experience ever at a hospital. My 90 year old aunt who was admitted April 15 was not bathed until the 18th when her sitters with Answer Prayers bathed her. The monitors would go off but they would not check on her until we called them even though at one time the pulse reading was zero. They never checked her diapers. I got a attitude from several employees if I questioned her care including the charge nurse. A bandage on her heal for a compression sore was never changed, making it worse. It might be OK if you only need a band aid but not for anyone needing serious medical care.

name: Matthew Riley
text: Horrible service from the records departments, completely unprofessional in all aspects and untrained staff.

name: Jamie Copeland
text: Prompt medical attention! Very friendly ER Dr and staff the nurse was very pleasant and attentive to my husbands needs!!!

name: Amber Till
text: Just has great and friendly staff

name: Lillie Mooney
text: Baptist East is a very good hospital and the nurses and the doctor is very wonderful thank you

name: Kids' Videos
text:
The worst staff ever. The nurse who took my blood tied the rubber band on my arm and left it then she went to prepare the other things; dude my veins wanted to burst with pain. Then, the other nurse who did the IV for me stuck the needle wrong and I noticed that the solution is not moving and felt pain in my arm.
The other thing was that I was freezing, and the nurses didn't bother themselves even giving me a third extra blanket; they thought two are very enough.
The first and last thing was that I waited almost 3 hours to get inside the ER room and more one hour for the physician to see me.

name: Jane Mayes
text: I cut my hand open and the initial intake nurse was very short and condescending. Also, my nurse made mention of how she was suppose to clock out at 10. I felt that was kind of unprofessional, you're in a field to help people, I'm sorry if you had to stay an hour longer :/

name: Alicia Dale
text: If I could give zero stars I would, awful hospital that do whatever they see fit with your baby. For having baptist in their name they sure do act very ungodly. Do not have your baby here.

name: Ashley Taylor
text: Worst hospital experience ever, had to wait 2 hours to get a shoulder x-ray in the emergency department, the nurse didn't know what she was doing, I had to go to the unit desk to ask to get my xray done.... And then I had to wait two hours to be discharged after my xrays. All they were doing the entire time was sitting down on the computer probably on social media. There were barely any patients there at 4am.

name: Albert dyess
text: Doctors and nurses here both have great bedside Manner and take very good care of you and are considerate and concerned about your condition very clean rooms are very nice I would recommend this hospital to anyone

name: john lorken
text: They were good many years ago. Not any longer

name: Donna Ennis
text: From ER to ICU step down I was treated promptly and with dignity and respect.

name: Jeremiah 29:11
text: Baptist east is by far the best hospital in this area. Other hospitals just guessed at what was going on with me and guessed wrong. My situation had gotten so bad that when I made it to baptist east they had to keep me there 5 days. They took great care of me and I'll never forget it! If you or your loved one is having medical problems dont waste your time or risk your health with the other hospitals because they are a joke. Do it right the first time and just go on to baptist east. You might have to wait longer in the er but its worth it. I thought about leaving because it was taking so long (they were super busy) but I thought maybe thats a good sign that they are thorough and I'm so glad I stayed. I could have gotten worse and possibly died but baptist health took care of me! I hope God continues to bless that hospital and everyone that works there!

name: Millissa Luster
text: I was just there Thursday, August 11, 2016. Although I had a great experience with the interactions with the Dr., Nurse's, Radiologist, Respiratory Therapist, and Phlebotomist. The Phlebotomist put my Blood Pressure Cuff on top of where my I.V. was which caused me a huge Hematoma and blown vein. I have been in constant pain in that arm since then.

name: Rashid Swanson
text: I wouldn't recommend anybody with sickle cell to go to this hospital, they have no idea how to treat a crisis. Went there the other night with my girlfriend while she was having a crisis and they just left her sitting in a bed for two hours while she just got worst, we eventually had to go to Baptist south to get proper treatment.

name: Ashley Graham
text: I would give 0 stars if I could. Extreme lack of professionalism, poor bedside manner and even more rude over the phone. Go to Jackson!!

name: Thomas Frazer
text: Surgery went well, when I woke up in ICU the nurse let me sit shivering for 3hrs in a wet bloody gown until the shift change. The nurse that evening, Jayce, was kind and helpful, but the ICU desk was so loud at 3:00am that not only could I not sleep, but I had to sit up and crank the volume up to 100% in order to drown out the senseless and disrespectful noise at that hour. The nurses that came in the next morning were satisfied doing the bare minimum and gave attitude when asked for assistance or information, I was expected to use the restroom on a chair into a bedpan infront of the helpdesk with the door and the curtain wide open open. Sorry but I was raised with manners. I was then passed onto the next awful nurse with two request: "I aked if I could shower and not have an I've in the crook of my right arm. 35hrs later no shower and a bleeding iv in the right arm. Both request to shower and have this Iv moved have been denied and passed on to the next incompetent" . Worth is the most worthless nurse I have ever met! Coming out of ICU my vitals were never checked, I was made to fill out a fall risk form and confined to my bed without access to use the restroom and forced to wait 45min to an hr before I was helped. The worst of all was that I went 6hrs after major mascular surgey without any pain medication due to Worths incompetence. She spent more time making excuses and trying to get around her work instead of spending that time finding a solution. She did not hook up the medication correctly and it ran out of the pump onto the floor, when confronted she was unwilling to accept responsibility for her actions, even after she was called out infront of the Dr., her reply was: "Well...what happened was". She had told him a completely different version outside the room not thinking I would bring it up with the Dr in the room. My next nurse was Jonothan🙈Also refusing a shower and to move my iv that shuts off due to placement every 6hrs that my antibiotics are hooked up, creating three extra trips for one 30min treatment, not to mention the countless times I have made these requests for my personal comfort during my stay. I was told by Jonothan that was being given an opiated based paIn killer "Valium". I asked: "isn't Valium a benzodiazapam used for anxiety and muscle spasmsam". Of course I was wrong until Google provided the nurse, Jonothan, with an acceptable answer. I have requested an antacid for extreme heartburn, ulsers, and hiatal hernia in my esophageal tube, of course that agin was too demanding of a request. I am truly and utterly disappointed in my visit to Baptist East Medical Center. This place used to be nice, not sure why there is such widespread incompetence throughout the staff here. Thanks Baptist Eastfor the WORST hospital visit of my life! I am appalled at the quality of your health care. I will not be returning, I would rather be treated in the waiting room at Jackson Hospital! Think about your loved ones before you choose Baptist East, not worth risking their health and happiness.

name: Sean Sullins
text: I would recommend this hospital to anyone great service great people.....

name: J Borne
text: I was very pleased with staff in ER.

name: Kelvin Mallory
text: Amazing fantastic staff 'cause this is where my little girl was delivered through c-section by Dr. Winston McCain ashurst plus their services are A+ I would strongly recomend anyone having kids for the first time or about to have their second & beyond go there you'll be glad you did

name: En Gu
text: I'm 22 weeks pregnant was in a car accident and came in complaining of abdominal pain. They asked me to bypass the electronic check in put other and I've been sitting here for over 30 minutes with no one checking on me. Standard is over 20 weeks with abdominal pain after a car accident to be immediately checked. I guess unless you come in under ambulance they don't care. Horrible already not sure I'm willing to deliver here.

name: Sam Ferguson
text: In the ER now.  Going on 3 hours waiting.  Other people have gone back even though they got here after I did.

name: Melinda Kent
text: Had the worst experience at an er ever, doctor could careless. Will come back and give complete details later.

name: DeAnna Hardy
text: This place sucks! It's terrible! All these nurses and doctors are just sitting around like this isn't a hospital. Doctor came In nearly 3 hours ago and hasn't been back yet. If you're on the verge of dying do not come here

name: amanda jurls
text: My mother is in the ED right now. We’ve been her 3 hours. Her BP is STILL 200/100 and they haven’t even placed an IV. I’m a nurse and this is abhorrent care. I’m disgusted.

name: Shaun Dennis
text: We been here since 12:00am no one is at the front desk of the emergency room! My son has hives we have signed in and still no one here except the people that check you out!!!!!!!!!

name: Krispy Carnie
text: The delivery floor nurses are astounding

name: Natalie Wise
text: Rude.slow.sarcastic even when I'm in severe pain they think it's funny when your in pain and they're not its like I'm not a priority to them at all.they let children run around be loud and watch loud movies no staff or parents do anything about it.i got here despite my extreme migraine and vomiting on the lobby floor they won't administer any medicine to help my advice if your seek go-to a g.p or just go to Walgreens

name: Garry McCoy
text: Great place - my home away from home

name: Nick Whitaker
text: Night shift is terrible. If you come in at night expect a 3 hr wait at least

name: Mike Smith
text: Wonderful place.  Wonderful.

name: crusty
text: The hospital is okay but i think people should go to another church .

name: Priaynk Patel
text: I love USA and God bless USA

name: Steven Waite
text: Terrible wait times and very unhelpful staff

name: Wanda Cleveland
text: Here now bad experience.

name: CCC CCC
text: Terrible.

name: The Fantastic Scott’s
text: Rude ass racist nurses who works in the ambulance entrance department !!!!!!!!

name: Taqundra Gipson
text: great experience

name: Zettie Ingram
text: Rehab Associates

name: Ryan Earl
text: Ass

name: Amber Miller
text: Went to ER for urgent care for daughter. Chronic issues with IBS and nausea. They refused to take any imaging of stomach area. No blood work or urine requested. Even after I asked for more to be done we Basically sat almost 5 hrs to have them take vitals, press around on her stomach area and give her prune juice with senna. No help with referrals either. Was hoping for more help. Honestly a waste of time and almost 200$. We had to go to Children's 2 nights later for a blockage.

name: Carla Emmons
text: I really appreciated the fast and efficient care I received today at bibb medical urgent care.  I loved the professional and friendly front desk young lady, the sweet and knowledgeable nurse who took my vitals and the doctor who carefully but quickly diagnosed me! 🤗🤗

name: Terri Best
text: So far so good. Just had a mamogram but now have to go back for ultrasound. Staff was helpful and very friendly . Speed of being seen was only about 5 mins. Excellent.

name: Amy
text: Dr. Hollis has always been wonderful, but honestly everyone I’ve had the pleasure of meeting there is kind and professional. They are fast, thorough & efficient. Thankful that Bibb Co. & surrounding areas have Bibb Medical!

name: Allison Sanders
text: This is the WORST experience ever! They can’t show you Anything about your baby, they can only tell you what’s going on. I can’t even talk to the nurse that I dealt with while I was there. I had to deal with a very rude “nurse”.  This place is nothing more than a joke.

name: Laci Silas
text: Unprofessional. Rude. Dr Richardson needs to go back to school. Or just quit being a doctor all together. Will never go back here. EVER.

name: Brittany Scott
text: Told me I didnt have any co pay that my insurance covered everything and then they send me a bill and cant even spell name right and I had to sit the waiting room for hours before I was seen. Dont recommend this place at all

name: Mckenna Tucker
text: I only like one doc in there  the rest act like they don't care just want to kick u out the door

name: gerald mcmillanjr
text: I went to this emergency room on or around the week of the 19th of dec. 2018. Even though the Dr that seen me ordered no kind of test of any kind. I was told it was a muscle spasm and was sent home to deal with...I have since then had many tests and it was determined that I have cancer not a muscle spasm.

name: Melanie Wallace
text: Best Doctors, quick response time, would recommend to anyone, any time.

name: Ash Marie
text:
I must say the nurses and staff at the emergency room the majority of them are rude and careless. I not only experienced this but many others...
Only one nurse I know of that works there is nice she is very caring indeed.

name: S CB
text: if I could give no stars I would I went in tonight and I sat there almost 4 hours not to mention there was only a few people there I will not be back there was some Indian Arab looking guy there that I've never seen before I heard people coming out and complaining about him and mad they didn't want to see him I didn't pay it no mind some people are just like that NOPE there right he IS THE worst doctor I've ever seen in my life there was a older male and there was a shorter female there amazing but this guy talk with a accent just plain rude and awful he even tried to make out like I was lying about my pregnancy lol until he did my blood work 😂😂😂 yeah I'm going to come in your re and lie about a pregnancy crazy people in top that they FORGOT I WAS IN THE ROOM THOUGHT I LEFT anyways he need to leave he ruined that whole office I will be calling and making a verbal complaint and making everything public online cause I'm sure there's plenty more people with a issue with him once I post his name online 😊😊😊😊

name: Sherry Thompson
text: It's a place for those that need 24 hr attention.

name: Ryan Hebert
text: ONE OF THE WORST MEDICAL EXPERIENCES EVER!!!! I took my fiance here because she was very ill. She had a swollen throat with large puss pockets all over it along with every other sign and symptom of strep... The nurses and doctors treated us like we were nothing but a burden on them. When we did get in to see the doctor, they had not tested her for strep or flu, which are both floating around in high volumes at the time. The doctor glanced at her for less than a minute and determined that there was "nothing wrong but some sinus drainage causing her throat to hurt" and he stated that he would "not give her ANY antibiotics unless she is still sick in 10 to 14 days because there is no need." She is still VERY sick a week later so we decided to visit a different doctor at a different location. This time she was tested for strep but they said it was definitely strep long before the test came back and that it was obvious that she had had it for well over a week!!!! DO NOT GO TO BIBB COUNTY MEDICAL CENTER!!!!!

name: Raven Penton
text: Be advised that you use the ER at Bibb Medical Associates and the doctor you see, thinks that what you went for is not an emergency issue, your claim will be charged as a clinical visit and not and ER visit. Under certain insurances in order for them to pay for a clinical visit you will need a refferal from your Primary Care Doctor, in other words, insurance will not pay for the visit but you will out of pocket.

name: Cheyanne Childress
text: Super slow sat in the waiting room for and an hour and then got in the back and sat for over and hour and then left because they didnt know when they could see me and there is only 4 patients here its ridiculous

name: Stephen Headrick
text: Had a hernia surgery this morning performed by Dr Figh. I wish I had taken note of names so that I could thank everyone of them individually. But suffice it to say the entire staff was excellent, professional, and very friendly.  I have had many IVs over the past few months due to cancer treatment which makes vein identification and establishment of a painless IV often difficult. Although it took two punctures (something very common for me) the nurse  was very good. She told me to prepare for a big stick, ha, I barely felt it and it was quickly set up. The in room staff was extremely attentive and the operating room staff was great. They kept me informed of everything happening before anything was done. Well at least as long as I was awake. They made a difficult event very pleasurable. Like most people I don’t enjoy getting older and experiencing an exponential increase in doctor visits and associated surgeries. However this trip was about as enjoyable as a surgery could be made. Thank you Decatur Morgan for making my rainy day pleasurable.

name: Maureen Feld
text: I think the staff and everyone there were very nice to me and everyone. There were quite a few people there but is was well organized. I was there on March 17th. I was impressed with everyone, even the people who were coming in like me! Thank you! We are all there for a reason and very lucky to have the opportunity to even have so many medical people helping us! I feel very fortunate to have gotten my first vaccine so I can feel so much safer.  Thank you all for your services..

resp.text: Ms. Feld thank you so very much for the encouraging words and the wonderful compliments, will make sure to share them with the staff at the Vaccine Clinic.  We appreciate you taking the time to give us a 5 star rating and for sharing your experience.  We are grateful to provide this service to you and to the community. Thank you again!

name: Heath Mayes
text: Very nasty er not worried about patients. I'll die before I come back here.

resp.text: Mr. Mayes so sorry to hear about your experience in our Emergency Room, we would like to have one of our Hospital Representative contact you to discuss your situation further.  If you would like to send us your contact phone number and the  best time for us to contact you. Thank you - send to decaturmorganhospital@gmail.com

name: Emily Brock
text: These people are so unorganized. I had to convince them to look for the lab work. They finally listened when I said it had been sent to the lab and they called the lab and lo and behold yep it was there just like I said it was. My child is a trooper when it comes to having blood drawn so when there was a complaint about how tight the tourniquet was, I knew it was serious. And then I could tell there was pain when the needle was being pulled out. Like I said my child doesn't complain about that.. so that was a pretty big deal to me.

name: Sandra Cooper
text: I went to hospital on 5/22/21 @ 9 pm. I had blood pressure pike up, face, upper arms,chest, and back turn bright red with heat. I feel like I was going to pass out. I told them I had a very bad headache but never offered anything for pain, to drink anything either. Dr shiver acted like I was wasting his time. The did a AEG and blood work. Then he came in and said he was not giving anything to lower BP or to help my head from hurting. I got out of their about 2 am with bp 190/98 and my head about to blow. It was a waste of my time and leaving me upset 😡  and disappointed in the medical care I received. The quality of care was bar to none. That dr needs to retire for he does not care enough to give quality care. I will no longer go there for care again.

resp.text: Ms. Cooper so sorry to hear about your bad experience at our Parkway Campus Emergency Department.  We would like to have one of Hospital Representative contact your to discuss further.  If you would please send us your contact phone number and the best time for us to contact you.  Please send to decaturmorganhospital@gmail.com  Thank you!

name: Wilbert VanDuynhoven
text: We arrived at the ER shortly before 10:00AM to be checked after a fall from a ladder. Filled out paperwork, got vitals checked and then back to the waiting room.  At 12:40 (over 2.5 hours) we decided to leave and try somewhere else. There is no telling how long we would have sat there and no one gave us any idea how long it would be. I recommend going to Parkway by ambulance, they have special doors and no waiting.  Hopefully my issues will go away with time ☹️

name: Dana Walizer
text: My friend took her 8 month old there last night with a 105 fever 5 hours they were there and then sent him home with 103 temperature now poor thing is in Birmingham  Childers hospital God be with him

resp.text: Ms. Walizer so very sorry to hear about your experience here at Decatur Morgan Hospital.  We would love to have one of our Hospital Patient Representatives contact you to discuss your experience further.  If you would please send us your contact phone number and the best time for us to contact you.  Send to decaturmorganhospital@gmail.com  - look forward to hearing back from you. Thank you

name: Tasha Ballard
text:
I was just in the emergency room earlier this morning
with excruciating pain in my left side which happen to be kidney stones. I was very impressed with how fast I was in and out. I did not have to wait and the nurses and doctor were so caring and kind. They started me with an IV and pain medicine and blood work which was very quickly. I got great care

name: Tammy Bollhoefer
text: My father has spent 6 days in the ICU and has received good care. The ICU nursing staff has been attentive and professional. The night nurse, Paige is one of the best nurses I have ever witnessed. He is efficient, knowledgeable and works with confidence and compassion. I  am grateful for his ability during my father's illness.

name: Rodney Stewart
text: The majority of nurses are very rude, uncaring, and act in a hateful manner. They make patient's wait for help up to an hour after being called to room. They sit at the nurses desk laughing and joking. They make patient's feel as if they are a bother. Unprofessional and should be unacceptable....

name: Cory Woods
text: I would put no stars but the staff is very unprofessional and a worker told me there is no one that works there that can give medical records what kind of place is this

name: Barbara Weinbaum
text: I have been to the emergency room three times since June. Each time I was helped quickly and efficiently.  The last time I was there I was admitted and treated for pneumonia and sepsis.  I was under their care for two days. The medical staff was wonderful! They were very attentive and answered requests quickly.

name: Will Wright
text: Doing xrays in the Er waiting room. Been here over a hour and a half with no one taken back. Disgustion for a hospital

name: Tracey Erklenz
text: Was admitted by the E.R. Doctor and ended up staying in the hospital for 4 days. I couldn't have asked to be treated any better! They were all Amazing!

name: Javier Kmasho
text:
TAKE THIS PLACE LIKE THE LAST CHOICE TO COME OR BRING FAMILY OR FRIENDS
Well  is really hard to do this  but I will try my best...
Staff  are really good  nurses  but my only concern is my wife is in here from yesterday around afternoon time...  by emergency services  she get room around 6 pm then  the doctor  show up around  7 pm
Today 11:50  am  nurses have no idea when doctor is going to come ...
My point is simple  "after

name: Jonalee Kittrell
text: Took my boyfriend here because he has all the signs of the flu. Took a flu test and took an xray. He had been sleeping for 2 days. Severe headache, body hurting and sleeping. Test result came back not the flu. They told him he didnt have anything wrong but brought him back in and then said he has a virus. Seriously, how would they know if they didn't draw blood? A doctor never even saw him. They didn't check to see if he was dehydrated.. Worst place ever! oh and they were all rude!!

name: Buffy Watson
text:
I had food poisoning and with hourly violent vomiting and diarrhea. We went there at about two in the morning several months ago. We were sent to the private ER room after about 5 minutes (not much going on). I was treated and taken care of very quickly. They gave me meds that completely stopped the vomiting and nausea (which was awful). The doctor and the nurses were all compassionate and helpful. After a round of glucose they let me go home. I am very grateful for the service that they provide.

Also, my husband's blood pressure spiked one day and we took him, they saw him very, very quickly and did a lot of tests to make sure he didn't have a heart attack. He was fine and we are thankful that they were so thorough.

Some towns aren't lucky enough to have hospitals in them, we have two. We are blessed.

name: SPICE Bro
text: My wife went in for delivery for my daughter. It seemed like no one cared. Also I have stage four cancer, the guy at the door of the emergency room was very rude to me. Staring and had an ill demeanor asking me was wrong with you. But not in the caring way. Also I whole time my wife was in the hospital non of the staff or nurses would help my wife and when that did you could feel like they just wanted out of there. Even a cup of ice. I would have to go get everything she needed or annoy someone for them to do there job.

name: Christopher Schaffer (BeardedMrPotatoHead)
text: If I could rate lower I would. You could be dying and they would still take their sweet time getting a doctor to see you. I spent 6 hours waiting to see a doctor and ended up leaving because they told me they didn’t know how much longer it would be. Now I’m headed to Huntsville because they actually care about their patients.

name: Felicia Easterling
text:
Majority of staff are extremely rude and uncaring. Another ER visit here but only due to Ambulance insisting because it's the closes hospital, and I use that term very loosely.  I would like to have a decent hospital in the area. Not sure what Huntsville hospital system needs to do other than literally clean house. When staff tells you they are going to beat your A*#, speaking of the lady at the desk in the ER... I think there's a problem. Administration.
Then there's the call button and no one ever responds to the call until hours later.
The 1 star does go to the RN who was polite, would sit down and talk to me, and the 2 women who offered me a hug and just stayed with me. AND FOR HEAVENS SAKE... DONT TELL SOMEONE YOU UNDERSTAND WHEN YOU HAVE NO IDEA WHAT THEY ARE DEALING WITH!!! ER DESK LADY!!!!

name: Jennifer Cobb
text: Parkway has the best staff. Everyone is so friendly and helpful

name: QD.
text:
They will lie to you so you will stay in the ER. They do not provide sick slips for work unless something is broken or your dying. "Got back pain? Go back to work you lazy bum. -Doctor"
I have an injury. Put me on light duty or give me an off day. Don't lie to me and say you can then tell me you can't.
This is why you can't trust anything they say, they will do anything for money.
If your not dying. Don't go to this place.

name: Dg Elovely
text: I was here for 3 days and had the best medical treatment, sweetest staff, and comfortable rooms.

name: Michael Hamilton
text: It's supposed to be a hospital with an active ER. If you have insurance or if there's a major problem you are treated somewhat professionally. But if you don't have insurance you have to see a PA. Some of them have an attitude and they do not treat you with respect. Dr. Putman  is a good veterinarian if you don't like your animals. There are some good Dr and nurses here, but they are few and far between, every since Huntsville hospital took over the quality of care has declined. This is just one man's opinion!

name: Jessica Johnson
text: I went in to the parkway campus er. I have had a headache since yesterday so bad I can’t eat and it hurts to move and I am very weak. I told them I was 22 weeks pregnant and I was miserable. They put me in a room and came in later and said I can’t do anything for you because your pregnant. I said you can’t do bloodwork or see if I am dehydrated and he said we can give you fluids if u want us to but that’s all we can do and sent me home! I will not be back this is ridiculous.

name: Frank Mitchell
text: Horrible Place! My wife and I had a tragedy during the summer she had a to have a still born birth. The nurses were very rude to me. I went to get food for everyone in the room when I came back they did not buzz me thru the door for at least an hour later ( no reason behind it). One of the nurses told my wife she had a false positive STD which to Doctor had to smooth over because that was not true (potential lawsuit). Then on the birth and death certificate the staff for some reason did not want my name on it. Horrible prenatal care from beginning to end!

name: Twyla Prince
text:
My friend that is having severe cramping and bleeding. She is 8 weeks pregnant and wants to know if there is anything wrong. She has been waiting for 2 hours in the ER waiting room.

A family comes in with a 10 year old that has her arm sprained and they take her back first after my friend has been waiting for an hour already.

This hospital is worried about a sprained arm more than the life of a baby??
Yet you guys be screaming at abortion clinics about SAVING A CHILD'S LIFE???????? But this shows how much this hospital doesn't care about babies.

name: Michelle BossChic
text: I came to ER on a Friday with my BP 220/166 n the worse Headache ever.....The BP cuff was pumping on my arm so much that it popped off by itself and when the Nurse came back in she was so rude ... She informed me if I'm not gonna do the treatment and take the meds then they would just discharge me... I inform her that it did it on it's on and it was hurting causing a bruise on my arm...She continued to repeat herself so I got rude back and asked her was she even listening to me...She had no remorse to the fact that the cup was bout to cut my arm off..... I have asked to be discharged so I could go somewhere else but they won't...I'm ready to walk out with this IV in my arm

name: Elizabeth Eubanks
text: I came here 6 weeks after I had my son via c section. My incision had busted open and was oozing green. They were not friendly at all. They came in and checked my blood and after making sure that it was all clear they were going to just send me out the door without cleaning my wound or putting a bandage on it or anything. I wasn't going to leave a bad review, but here we are a year later and my husband had a chest X-ray done at parkway and the dr nor a nurse ever come in to even discuss his X-ray. Someone came in to discharge him and never even offered an explaination for his symptoms or anything. They were trying to rush him out the door the same way they did me!! Not one medical professional discussed his X-rays or referred him anywhere else. He is having trouble breathing and having chest pains!! Parkway is a JOKE!!!

name: Marcus Hoeft
text: They have the worst wait times ever they rather see people with "pain" than people with actual problems. Been in this waiting room for almost 3 hours and only got vitals done. My daughter has a head injury and cant remember when it how she got it. Do not take anyone here.

name: mitzi quick
text: Went in to ER with kidney stone. Every staff member  I encountered was caring and helpful.

name: Heather Strickland
text: Awful ER doctor. I went because I had what I thought was seizure's. Had an episode in the room with the nurse. Doctor comes in ignoring the episode, wouldn't let my husband speak (I couldn't form words) and kept asking me why my eyes were dilated. I don't know, thats what I was there for. Doctor kept looking at my tattoo's and immediately wanted a urine sample and blood work done. Treated me as a drug addict. Everything came back normal. But the doctor not once asked about the symptoms I experienced, didn't ask about any of that. Just looked into my eyes, listened to my chest and said it was a headache. He wouldn't ask anything other than what is the level of headache do you have. Not once asked about my possible seizure, not once talked to my husband who experienced me having one. The nurse never mentioned to us or the doctor about the episode I had in the actual room with her. Nothing was done but blood work and urine sample. I went in for possible seizures and left without anything but a diagnosis of a headache. What a bunch of crap. I've had another episode yesterday but I will not go back to this place.

name: Chelsea Lynn
text: Rude ass front desk check-in workers who act like they don't care about your health and when you finally get back to be seen the staff is still extremely rude, act like you're not important when you don't have a physical injury. MENTALLY ILL PEOPLE NEED HELP TO. I SERIOUSLY HATE THIS HOSPITAL AND CANT WAIT TO MOVE TO BE NEAR A BETTER ONE.

name: Hallie Podhora
text: Worst hospital I've ever been to we set there for almost 3 hrs before my 11yr old son was even seen with a HORRIBLE EAR INFECTION!!!! I WILL NEVER AGAIN GO BACK TO THIS HOSPITAL. The worst part is, it wasn't even busy all the nurses and doctors were at the front talking laughing and cutting up while my son sits in a cold room crying his eyes out....

name: Susannah
text: Won't go back. Will drive to Madison, Athens or Huntsville for care...basically anywhere but here. My father-in-law passed away in this ER. Doctors should have asked for transport to Huntsville as soon as he came in, but he passed away during transport hours later. As for my own experience, I was there 6 hours one time just to get rehydrated from a stomach bug. The doctor was slow as Christmas and he thought he was being funny/smart and he wasn't. Another time, I came in and the doctor on call never said a word to me about my condition and then it was shift change and another doctor came in and didn't tell me anything either. The nurses filled me in. Ridiculous. The two doctors I did see looked as if they came out of retirement to work as they both appeared to be in their late 60's-70's and totally out of touch. This hospital was ranked #23 in the 50 most expensive hospitals in Alabama in 2015. I can believe it as they nickel and dime everything and yet they aren't ranked as one of the better hospitals in Alabama so they have no valid excuse for their price increases. If you want quality care with doctors that will take their time and explain things, go to Madison Hospital or Crestwood.

name: Samantha betts
text: I also work in healthcare and this is by far the worst hospital I've ever seen. Yes. I have high standards. The hospital I work for is a 2 time winner of the Malcolm Baldrige award so I know quality. This is 3rd world care at best and I won't allow another family member back to this facility.

name: Chrina Serrant
text: Absolutely, the worst staff an emergency department can ever have. I went in for a very bad sore throat an couldnt talk or swallow. I went through triage an i had to ask what was my blood pressure an my temp. Once taken to a room i waited 45 minutes before anyone an i mean anyone to come into my room. Very bad bedside manners. Now, when you come in with a sore throat an cant swallow with a low grade temp test should have been drawn. But Dr. Simmons came in with the worst attitude an ask why was i there, looked in my mouth an said oh well you have laryngitis.... now, they swabbed my throat.... an never mentioned what my results were. Then asked if i was allergic to antibiotics. About 40 mins after a nurse came in with discharge papers an a cup of liquid... now remind you i said i couldnt swallow anything an my throat was on fire. I told the nurse that i cant swallow anything, she was very rude an snotty an said ill go see if he will give you an antibiotic shot... well that would make more since, i mean for gods sake my throat is red an swollen. I had to wait another 35 mins before she came in an said very rudely he aint going to give you a shot. Soooooo, why would you treat patients like that. This isnt the first time he has treated me or any body else like this but im not about to hush about it this time. He is very rude, unprofessional, an it shows on his face that he dosent like his job an that he is only there for the money. He could have given me an antibiotic shot i wasnt asking for any pain meds just give me a shot to open up my throat. But he treated me very rudely. I dont understand why still have him there or anywhere. Everyone i talk to always say that he has a i dont like people attitude. Parkway is a total joke. If you want rude unprofessional staff that dosent take their job seriously then be my guess. As of now, because he didnt care enough to treat me i have an infection in my chest an my throat is worst. Ill drive to huntsville cause he be at decatur general as well. He will let you get worst before he puts his degree to use. Stay away.

name: Leann Ore
text: Went in for a painful and swollen leg. Wait was short, staff very friendly.

name: G G
text: At first I was split. I came here 3 years ago and had great service. Now I've been here 4 plus hours with no service.

name: 1 Vic
text: Worse hospital I’ve ever been to. By far. Stay away. You would be better off driving to Huntsville bleeding out before they would even worry about seeing you here. Stay almost 4 hours for the stupid “dr” to say there’s nothing we can do for you here. Screw that place

name: PATRICIA
text:
My Brother almost died in this ER.  By the Grace of God he was shipped out after sitting in the ER for over 24 hours.  Yes.. 24 hours sitting on stretcher for 24 hours after having a stroke and spiking fevers of 104°. Found out he had MRSA of the blood stream!
Way to go Parkway !!
ONLY reason you get one star is because I had to put a star before I could Start writing!

name: Courtney Haggermaker
text:
I was pregnant and went to see the OBGYN staff. I was considered high risk considering I had a previous preterm delivery. Not only did they refuse an ultrasound that I had requested, they also never even let me see an actual OBGYN. The staff knew my hcg level numbers and they did not do further investigation on them. They did not put forth any effort to make me feel positive I was having a healthy pregnancy. I personally had to call and ask and investigate my numbers on my own. I went on to Madison emergency room because as a mother, and just my gut feeling, I knew something was wrong. Also, I had told them i had been bleeding, not that they were concerned. I went to the ER and found out I had miscarried. Parkway did not offer to do any preterm/miscarriage prevention for me. I am not blaming them for losing my unborn baby, but I am blaming them for the lack of medical treatment and compassion. I will never EVER step foot in parkway again besides the follow up appointment I have to go to. Only because it is now solely for my health, and not for my baby and I. This place will forever be at the bottom of my list. Please .. if you are pregnant and want the best care for you and your unborn, do not consider this one of the places, if at all optional.

I think they need more educated and caring staff at this facility.

name: Crazy Girl
text: The nurses were great except on smart ass nurse. She said well the xray shows bones and it's not broken. Well I just got a call from another nurse saying the radiologist looked over the xray again and my son does have a break in his finger. Also the MD Christopher Simmons is a joke as a doctor. I went in with my foot hurting pretty bad and he treated me as if I was addicted to pain meds and I didn't even want pain meds. He said he was gonna put me in a boot and give me meds for neuropathy pain which is not a narcotic and it helps alot. Then the nurse the smart ass comes in and discharged us and we ask about the boot and meds and Christopher Simmons denys saying anything about helping me. This ER is a complete joke. And he should be fired he doesnt care about his patients at all. Oh and it was four days ago when I took my son. Just so y'all know. He has had a broken bone for 4 days.

name: Dan Mitchell
text: Arrived 1:35am severe headache and vomiting. Walked out after waiting til 3:45am right before name was called. Should direct patients to another hospital with a potential wait like this.

name: Suzanne Johnson
text: Nursing care is ridiculously poor. Patients wait hours to receive medication. Nurses leave their notes on patients laying around in rooms calling patients names. Horrible

name: Allison Mitchell
text:
I have a lung disease and I have to have infusions weekly. It causes debilitating migraine. Staff treats u like a drug addict.
Makes me sick

name: John White
text: Hospital staff friendly but in the ER my first physician was my only physician and a professional. However , upon discharge a shift change occurred and an unknown physician ( at the time ) discharged me using a disease she picked from thin air and was never tested for ( no tests whatsoever ) and then billed me along with the first doctor , which was also illegal. The Pegasus ER group supporting this doctor has illegally billed me for this doctors crime and its damaged my credit. To allow such criminal activity shows the hospital has no standard practices setup to keep this from happening. I'm inclined to find others she has committed crimes against and file a class action suit against Pegasus. This is a large black female doctor working in the emergency department. Please , avoid this so called physician at all costs.

name: Lauren Matthews
text: Y'ALL PLEASE READ THE REVIEWS ON HERE BEFORE YOU GO. THIS PLACE IS RIDICULOUS!!! I went to the emergency room because I was having chest pains. Waited almost an hour before being called back, then I was in a room almost 4 hours because they ran test after test. What took even longer was THEY HAD MY TEST RESULTS BUT THEY WERE ALL OUTSIDE LAUGHING AND GOSSIPING AMONGST EACH OTHER instead of coming in to tell me my results! My mom had go get them and ask them what's the hold up and all they said was "we we're just about to come in" AFTER HOURS OF LAYING ON THE BED! Then they MISDIAGNOSED me saying I had an enlarged lymph node in my chest and when I went to my doctor for an CT scan there was nothing there! These reviews are TRUE that hospital WILL NOT take care of you!! Worst care ever! if you care about yourself or family members DO NOT bring them there!!

name: Amanda Muse
text: I don’t understand how this place is still in business. By far the worst experience in my life.

name: Mindy Guffey
text: Excellent Group of Dr's, Nurse's, NURSE PRACTIONERS, and Staff at the OBGYN AN ASSOCIATES! They are Caring, Kind Hearted, Compassionate, and When I call  to talk to a Health Care Professional it doesn't take long for them to call me back! I also used them to deliver my 4 children, which is Young Adults and I WILL Always Highly Recommend These Groups of Dr's! I Greatly Appreciate What You Did For Me as a Young Mother an Now what Ya'll Do for My Children! THANK YA'LL AN GOD BLESS EVERYONE!

name: Burls Lynn
text: I am in health care. I know all about being busy. I sprained my entire foot, or that is what I was told. I never got to see the x-rays. RED FLAG...!!! Doctor told me, verbatim , " we will give you something for pain, a boot for your foot, and crutches." I had to beg for something for pain. I had to beg for crutches, and the nurse was very rude and non compassionate at all. My foot is bruised and swollen all over.. I never got the boot and was give Tylenol...WHAT!!! I went to the hospital bc elevating, wrapping, ice and Tylenol was what I did at home. Why would anyone waist of time and go through all that nonsense, to be told and given the same thing I was doing at home. And had to sit there elevating my foot by actually holding it. Was never given a pillow to help with elevation. NOTHING!!! It is confusing and just unreasonable for the whole entire stress of going to er, waiting and waiting. Hurting beyond words. I have a leasing on my liver that was just detected. And Tylenol is what my real Dr told me I definaltly did not need to take. The doctor was arrogant no sympathy at all. And the nurse could have helped get my point across and try and talk to him. But no.. it actually made me feel shamed.. I am no drug seeker. But when I  hurt, I'm not playing. And all I want is not not be in throbbing continual excruceiating pain.. idk know what's  the problem with that. Seems pretty reasonable to me. I understand the ones that only want pills and all that, but EVERYONE is put under the same umbrella. That is just wrong. And when you take the time to go to the hospital, when your doing more for yourself at home, and nothing works and you end up with less and unprofessional help at the hospital? This is just wrong, in every way possible. I am extremely unbelievably disappointed and makes my trust in the entire health care system, something no one can really depend on when it is there so the ones that are hurt can trust and believe in, that they will completely help and depend on. Things have changed for the worse, and makes no one trust they will get the care we as human beings deserve and pay for.  Maybe this review will help, I doubt it bc the way I feel parkway feels about a human being, and the way I was completely uncared for today is double noted and received..  IT IS JUST A SHAME!!!!!!!       Kim Mitchell

name: Maggie Holder
text: I went to the ER with agonizing pain in my right side. I sat in a wheelchair in a room with no need for over an hour. Then I was moved to a room with a bed. The nurse came in and asked what was wrong. The Dr only came in 1 time never touched me. He told me I had a severe kidney infection based on blood/urine. He had already ordered a shot for pain/nausea meds but no IV. Do after he came in he asked do you want another shot. I said please I'm really hurting. He ordered the shot along with writing me some rx's one for pain and the other for antibiotic. The ignorant nurse came in to discharge me and gabby given me the shot yet. So she went back out and 30mins later came back with shot. Then she said you have to stay for 10mins. I understood cauz I don't think they wanted me to react but it was the same shot as before. Then 30mins later my husband went and asked if I could go home. The nurse said I was just coming to get her. She let me lay there almost long enough for my pain shot to wear off. I saw Dr Reddy and he was excellent. My previous experiences with Dr Putnam were horrendous. If they could get some good nurses I think they'd be better cauz I don't think Putnam is there anymore.

name: Kimberly Hogan
text: I wish I would've read the reviews before taking my husband there, but since I didn't, I'll do a public service and let EVERYONE know that this hospital is horrible. He has a history of neck issues including bulging discs which cause him severe pain. Today, his neck popped and he was in such severe pain, like none I'd ever seen him in. He's not one to put on a show, and he cried for 4 hours or more. The doctor, Dr. Putman, did not even come in and see, nor did a nurse practioner. He was given one muscle relaxer at the hospital and we were sent home with a prescription for the muscle relaxer and prescription Aleve. There was more they could've done for him, including giving him an injection of tramidol, also a steroid shot. I know this because I am a healthcare professional. I WOULD NOT EVEN TAKE MY DOG TO PARKWAY MEDICAL CENTER!!!! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE IF YOU WANT DECENT CARE!

text: Again, this place is really cool. Part of alabama history. Totally abandoned. Be mindful of the stairs going up or down as vandals have taken hammers to the concrete and made going up or down all the stairwells dangerous. I suggest going during the day so you can see any pit falls or danger areas as well as if you go up on third level and out the back there are a few holes to look out for where a leg can easily fall through. Once you get passed the creepy feel of everything, its actually a very cool place at night to watch the stars with friends as well as college kids go there at night to party. text: I've given birth to 2 of my 3 children and both times was told to be quiet during my labors. Also had a nurse from labor and delivery come into my room after giving birth and having my surgery to get my tubes tied just to yell at me and tell me I was a selfish and ignorant person for making choices I had made. The nurses were very nice the 1st time I gave birth here but then 3 years later when I had my 2nd experience, the nurses were incredibly rude, hateful and unprofessional. Just glad I got fixed so I never have to go back to the maternity ward.

name: Charles Forsythe
text: Athens-Limestone Hospital participates in Caravan Health ACO, LLC.  This is a group of doctors and hospitals that work with Medicare to reduce the money they spend on patient care by avoiding "unnecessary tests, procedures and office visits."  ACOs earn a financial bonus if they limit your treatment options.  The doctor or hospital shares in this bonus. This is a type of healthcare "rationing," disguised as something which somehow benefits the patient.  It saves the patient nothing but incentivizes the doctor or hospital to withhold expensive treatment or tests to earn a financial bonus.   Limit treatment = earn a bonus.

name: Scott Wolter
text: Worst hospital I have ever been to. They are good at telling you what you don't have but cant seem to tell you what you do have. The Drs are a joke. I wouldn't go back even if I was dieing. Get better care at a walk in clinic. Not to mention they over charge.
