name: AJ Taylor
text: After many trips I've made to the ER, it's definitely not the worst place you could go. Slow sometimes. Staff attitude is hit and miss but the majority are lovely people. Lab work and tests are always prompt and as pleasant as possible. Last visit required traveling to a different because the doctor was completely incompetent, he also sent another patient away without examination who went into emergency surgery a few hours later.

name: Paula Newton
text: Took my mother to Athens Limestone Hospital for pharmacological stress test. Ms. Elaine Ball was the RN who took care of my mom during the test.  She was awesome. She made my 82 year old mother feel at ease and mom just loved her.  I was so impressed by the friendliness and professionalism of all of the people who work there, from admitting until the end.

name: Ken Hines
text:
People die in hospitals.  They suffer pain, discomfort and embarrassment, and must try to rest and recuperate in a strange environment.  They share their caretakers with other patients and can never get the continuous, personal attention that they receive from their families at home.  All hospitals, including Athens-Limestone, begin with that against them.

That having been said, my family and I have used Athens-Limestone Hospital on many occasions, for life-threatening conditions, routine tests and minor emergencies.  We have been treated respectfully and cordially on every occasion.  We have never left the hospital disappointed in the diagnoses or the treatments that we received, and I credit them with life-saving actions on at least two occasions.  I do not doubt that some people have had bad experiences with the hospital, but we have not.

Thanks to the administrators, doctors, and staff.  It is comforting to know that you are serving our community.

name: Deejay Tiktok
text: The Staff in 3 East were some of the nicest people I have ever met in my life. Thank you all!! The service was excellent, the food was great and there is a cafeteria available as well.

name: That Girl
text: Great staff and great doctors! Have been several times and have never had a poor experience. Gave birth there and then had to bring my daughter back for emergency NICU treatment and they were so accommodating for us! It was much better than friends have had in similar situations in bigger hospitals. Only down fall is that I've been referred to many specialist through them and they are typically further away in Madison or Huntsville. Could be my insurance though.

name: Chris Hicks
text: Stay away from here at all costs! This is where you go to die! I will never go here or anywhere associated with Huntsville Hospital again! The staff isn’t the problem, it’s the doctors! The majority have no clue and just want to treat you like a lab rat until they send you home, and they usually still do not know what is wrong at that point! You might as well go to an urgent care facility!

name: Richard Powell
text: They are slow. Went in the er at 5 in the evening . did not get seen till 8:30 and stayed till 11:30. if. you are bad off it is a good chance tou will DIE there.

name: Maria S. (Anarchic)
text: Minimal care, attention, and explanation of symptoms/condition. I am 32 years old and suffer from CPTSD. I went in last week after binge drinking (I was suicidal) with symptoms of alcohol poisoning, had been throwing up, dry heaving, and hyperventilating for 12 hrs. I had not been able to keep any food or fluids down in that time. They used a child's blood pressure band on me and it was way too tight and squeezed my arm to where I cried out. Told me nothing about my blood pressure reading and said to keep the band on bc they would use it again in exam room. Waiting room was not that busy; 1 hr later I was feeling much better, finally got seen after waiting 1.5 hrs. One nurse removed the blood pressure band and said it was not appropriate for me and got me a different band which fit better. I saw about 4 nurses and 1 dr; one nurse did not come back after she received my urine sample. Another nurse came in 10 mins later and asked what had been done for me; I said almost nothing but there was my urine ready for them. Every nurse and the Dr. I saw knew nothing about my condition and obviously had not even glanced at my chart. A sick person should not have to do all the work at a hospital. I was told my urine sample wasn't great for them to determine a UTI and something about white blood cell counts were high. No one checked my vitals until I mentioned a chronic respiratory issue and asked if it had anything to do with the white blood cell counts. Dr checked my breathing and offered an x-ray, but I said we would get it done elsewhere as that would be cheaper. I have no insurance and my Dad paid out of pocket for me to be 'seen'. At least the charge wasn't so high, so that was the best part of my experience there. Never got a pregnancy test result yea or nay. I asked the Dr. And two nurses for a copy of my urinalysis and was ignored. Finally someone told me the research lab would be open the following day (this was Sunday) and I could get a paper copy then if I wanted. I was also told about the patient portal. We paid on the way out and I asked about my labs. The receptionist asked for my email address and said she would send me a link to the portal where I could see my report. I gave it to her and she said 'done'. I never got the email. Monday, I called the hospital and was transferred to a different department where I left a message. It is now Friday and I've yet to receive my email or official results stating what was on my urinalysis. I never go to the hospital and this made me never want to go again. I finally got fluids and Zofran and a GI cocktail, then discharged after 45 mins of IV fluids. I had to beg for a glass of water bc I was still dehydrated and thirsty. By then, I was ready to go.

name: Hannah Hancock
text: The ER is a joke. Two of the doctors that I've had to deal with here are arrogant, ignore your concerns, and insult your intelligence. The quality of care from the doctors is laughable. I  wouldn't take my dog to Athens Limestone Hospital ER. Do yourself a favor and drive about 20 minutes down the road to Madison Hospital.

name: Whitney Dugger
text: We had a very unfortunate experience at ALH and will not be going back.

name: Andy McCormick
text: Very little concern, minimal assessment and NO active listening or problem solving. Staff doesn’t care, they just go through the motions.

name: Lisa Guyton
text: My daughter had been sick for 4 days without transportation to get medical attention.  I drove from Nashville after work one night and took her to their ER.  She was septic and very sick.  The ER staff were awesome with everything they did for her!!  She spent the first 36 hours in ICU and the ICU staff were not friendly (except for one AA male nurse which was very nice) and they were rude and loud and she couldn't get any rest at all.  Then they moved her to 2 EAST.  I want to give a HUGE shout out to her 7p-7a nurse TRENTON and her PCA MATTHEW who were more than AMAZING..!!  Her fever spiked to 103.7 one night and she about had a panic attack thinking they were going to move her back to ICU..!!  Trenton and Matthew stayed her caregivers though and she had a good visit the remaining time.  I wish ALL nursing staff were like TRENTON AND MATTHEW..!!

name: Brittany Ayres
text: They were awesome. Anyone who has a complaint about their speed or anything else is welcome to move to Birmingham where I'm from and sit in the emergency room for 8 hours before getting a room. I'd take this place 100 times over before that.

name: Jennifer Frazier
text: I have been to this hospital several times. I keep telling myself I will not go back. But then something happens. EVERY time I have went I ended up going to a different hospital after I left to get proper treatment. Nurses are VERY rude. Doctors never want to check you. And they seriously will leave you in pain. The town of Athens everyone says " don't go there , they will let you die" . I thought it was a joke. Nope, its for real. I was having severe shoulder pain. They gave me a steriod shot in the hip and sent me home. As the day went on my back, right side , and chest swelled up so bad I could barely move OR breath in. So I went to another hospital. They right away gave me something threw my IV to take the swelling down. Then a muscle relaxer. I swear I felt brand new again. These people cared. Athens DID NOT.

name: Honest Product Reviews
text: My mom was in Athens, then her condition turned for the worst because the dialysis pumped air into her neck and she died as a result. Also, a friend of mine, his mom went in last year for something simple, she also died. They think they gave her a med she was allergic to even though they told them not to give her certain meds. Then, since 2015 my dad has been going in with issues with his pancreas. They kept sending him home for years. Then this year when they sent him home saying they didn't see any stones or anything, he went to Huntsville and his stones were so bad they were going into his pancreas. They said he was not long from dying. They did emergency surgery to get clean the stones from his pancreas and took out his gall bladder. What are the chances only the people I know have had these experiences from athens? I wouldn't trust them with my loved ones or my life. They have killed and almost killed too many people. In January 2019 my dad did end up dying. Them letting his pancreas get destroyed by the stones caused him cancer in his pancreas which spread and after a few years if fighting it, he lost his battle. 😔

name: Michelle Traylor
text: One of the slowest  ER I have ever seen u have to wait  almost  2 hours just to be seen by a Doctor  is  bad  and there was only 3 people  in waiting  room  .

Your message will be shared with ER manager. If you would like to speak with someone about your concerns, we encourage you to call the ER Manager at 256-233-9504.

name: Erin Booker
text: I came to Athens hospital because I had been having shortness of breath, they never checked my breathing and put me in a room , remind you I was the only person in the ER when I came in , I know there are other patients there but they put me in a room and no one came to check on me ever and after 3 hrs past I walked out because I wasn’t being helped , when I walked out all the nurses were just standing around talking and laughing with each other not thinking about their patients! I walked past and they nurse that put me in that room just looked at me walk out and never said anything! Now thats the worse experience I have had at any hospital, that’s just ridiculous honestly! My situation wasn’t like oh I’m about to die but if ot was anyone else and it was worse than mine just imagine what could happen!

name: Tori McGill
text:
I really don't think they took me seriously. I went in with a bite, the doctor only glanced at it before deciding it was staph - another woman had come out while I was in the waiting room talking about how turns out she almost had staph it was good she came in when she did so staph seemed to be the diagnosis of the night - and I had to push him to get him to tell me what he was going to do about the nausea and tightness in my chest and he said lab work. I got blood drawn then was told that I was clean and nothing was wrong. They didn't give me anything there I left in the same condition I went it, actually worse since the 'staph' was getting worse.  they kept asking me if I had a fever even though they were the ones that took my temperature and I honestly had no idea. One of the nurses wouldn't stop yelling. The doctor hardly spoke and definitely didn't examine me, oh and the nurse just shrugged when I told her that the doctor said staph even though she was talking about it being a bite and just said oh, well they're treated the same way.
Stay FAR FAR AWAY from there.

name: Jamie landon
text: Went in becauae ive had a 4 week period.. Overwhelming pain in my stomach and history of ovarian rupture and uterine rupture. The took lab work and refused to do any ultrasounds whatsoever. I asked for help and provided me with nothing. Im still in pain. I was released with no papers on what i could do if the pain worsens or what. No tips on how to ease the pain. They were rude and wasted my time. I recommend going to a different hospital if you need to seek treatment and i will be pressing charges.

name: Beck Norm
text: They have their ups and downs but each time ive needed them, they've followed through. Saving my life once that I know for sure. They kept me until they stabilized me and it ended up being near 2 weeks. They've been thorough most of the time when ive been there. Keeping me overnight for observation a few times due to blood work that came back bad. They really showed their greatness a little over a week ago.  A very close family member of mine went in with a fever of 105.6. They instantly had him in a room and there were about 7 or more working on him. He ended up having a servers case of the flu. It was very scary for me and they could tell that i was panickibg. They were also very nice and helped me through it. They kept my family member overnight up until late into the next evening to make sure that he would be able to breath ok. While we were there his O2 kept dropping below 80 and that was with O2 On.  They have their good Drs/nurses like every other place but each time that it has mattered, they've stepped up while we have used them. I've had 4 surgeries there and I've had nothing but fine experiences with them. The nurses & everyone involved have been on top of their jobs.  I have had more good experiences than bad.  They've esp stepped their act in the last few years. They do have a few people who work there that could work on their attitudes. My thoughts are, if you're going to work in that field you know youre going to be around sick people. Sometimes it can get gross. If you can't handle it don't get in that line of work. Also, if a person already feels bad or has terrible anxiety, the worst thing you can do is be rude and dismissive of them. I guess everyone is human. But to be in this line of work you need to have a little compassion and heart.

name: Tiffany Gill
text: Nurses being smart playing around dont check on patients

name: John Toelaer
text:
Do not take anyone you love and care about here.
My wife has a history of ruptured ovarian cysts, 3 days ago, it happens again. we go to Athens hospital ER because we just moved here and thought stabilizing treatment should be simple.

Registration and admission are typical - med lists, allergies etc. Lortab is a known allergy- as with many people nowadays it induces vomiting.  WE get seen by a doctor that walks in without looking at the chart just starts off the cuff trying to figure things out. Doc never check for cyst rupture, and offer ONLY 1 LORTAB. We alert her to the allergy, Doc doesn't care, says that" Lortab is all they have".

We advise her that we were treated at Huntsville hospital for this last year, and Dilaudid was given (commonplace practice) as lortab is simply not strong enough for this type of pain. Doctor laughs at us and says there should be no need for something THAT STRONG. We ask her to just look at the Huntsville Hospital records. Doctor informs us that they don't have access to HH records. Not sure if this is a lie, or truth, but either way its unacceptable.

This was from a female doctor mind you- getting no sympathy for one of the worst female pains there is- was unsettling.  At that point we tell the doctor we want to go home- no real tests were run, we're done.  Doc says she's concerned about patient's appendix. We humor her in the interest of compliance. They run a CT scan w/o contrast and decide she has appendicitis. Knowing full well this is an ovarian cyst and wanting a second opinion, we  left against medical advice.

We then go to our main doctor at Vanderbilt and they try to contact Athens Hospital and they have lost the CT image less than 24 hours later. They do fax over a paper saying my wife has appendicitis. We then have spent the last 48 hours carefully monitoring and testing for appendicitis(complicated by blood loss from ruptured ovarian cyst and resulting renal insufficiency) . Results negative.  This is not even third world medicine here, this is real country bumpkin medicine practice.

I am burdened now to tell everyone I know to avoid this place at all costs.

name: Antonio Jacobs
text: they little slow but that can be understandable at times.But ive had heard bad reports for awhile but from me personally they have help me in alot ways..Im thankful for that and may God bless them to get better.But ive had more good then bad personally speaking.To those that got bad results i pray God mend your heart and they get better to help us special ones that live here and grew up here like myself.We should always be top care cause we from the same little home city..Hope i was helpful but to say this i lost my financee in UAB and people say they better.I wouldve brought my baby here if i could've..Trust i know how loosing someone is hurtful..To share that and im still fighting health problems and healing emtionally.Hope i was helpful God bless..

name: Renee Hardy
text: I have been to this Hospital numerous times id much rather go here where you are treated like somebody rather then a number. I have never had a problem or issue at this hospital

name: Christina Crutcher
text:
Hmmm where to begin, I was there last week I had a partial hysterectomy done, and it was my 1st and LAST experience at Athens hospital. After my surgery, I came out of recovery in agonizing pain and the nurses and another lady (I don't know who she was or why she was even in my room) was very mean and rude to me because I was crying because I was in so much pain, they told me to stop entertaining people and showing out there was no way I was in that much pain, well come to find out my morphine pump was not working which means I just had major surgery and NO pain meds in my system!!!! So finally a guy (not a nurse) came in and figured that out. So you think it would get better from there... WRONG! The same nurse took 30 - 45 mins to get in my room when I would push the button, at the time the only reason I was pushing the button is because the machine went off over and over again, so I did not receive any rest. The 3rd shift nurse was amazing she was my only saving grace during this whole experience. So around 1 am they check my vitals and my BP was bottoming out due to the Morphine, so they took me off the morphine pump, at 7ish am I was starting to have constant pain again and I asked for some more meds (mind you this is 6 hours after they take me off morphine) I did not know this was shift change and another new RUDE nurse comes in and says she has to read her "reports" before she can do anything 2 hrs later and now in horrible pain again she brings me pain meds, They finally get me ready for discharge (THANK GOD!!) and told my husband to go down stairs and they would wheel me down, I wait 30 mins and no one has came back to get me, so I get up and start to walk and try to find the elevator because this is my 1st time in this hospital, the PCA lady see's me and says you can't be walking out and took me back to my room and about 5 mins later a elderly and I mean ELDERLY man comes in with a wheelchair and takes me to my husband and he could not keep up with the wheel chair and let it go and my husband had to catch it before I hit the car!
While all this sounds incredibly strange and outrageous this ALL happened to me at this hospital, I've never experienced such horrible treatment from horrible staff in my life!! I will never return to Athens hospital EVER! From now on I will drive to Madison for my medical needs.

name: Renea Moulton
text: I want to take a moment to say thank you, to everyone at Medical Center Enterprise, who took such great care of me during one of the scariest times of my life. I was a patient in the ER, and admitted to fourth floor for observation. When I came into the ER, the nurses wasted no time. I was having excruciating chest pain, and I was scared, which doesn't happen very often. Kayla, Michelle, and Samantha were amazing. Samantha never left my room until my pain had eased. Michelle notified my husband, so I didn't have to be alone. When I was admitted to the floor, I was taken up by the tech, Jessica, and she was so kind.Taylor was my nurse on the fourth floor and she sat with me and took the time to ask questions and never made me feel like she was in a hurry. At shift change, Ashley became my nurse, and she was phenomenal. She was so kind, and has the sweetest demeanor and bedside manner. She kept a close eye on me all night and made sure every need was anticipated, so I never had to ask for anything. Dr Chisholm and Dr Baxter kept me informed every step of the way. I am so thankful for our cummunity hospital, and cannot say enough to express my gratitude for the care I received.

name: Dylan Senn
text: I was sent to MCE ER from a urgent care facility, because urgent care was not capable of running tests for the symptoms im having. After getting to the back I informed them that I had no insurance and discussed the symptoms. They wanted a sample of something i couldnt provide at the time, so i asked, "can we run other test until i can provide you with a sample". They would not do blood work or anything. I am 28 years old, and i have never had blood work done. The last physical i got was in high school for football, but that is nothing compared to what i need done. Diabetes runs on both sides of my family along with other conditions. I guess if you dont have insurance they dont care much about you. I provided the same for testimg and had to wait a week just for the testto come back negative, but clearly somethimg is wrong with me. Why not conduct other test like i asked and see everything that is wrong with me? Even on the test results sheet is says that they didnt test for three different possibilities that could be causing my sumptoms.now it will cost me a.whole lot of money and the prolem still persists.

name: Lexi Covel
text:
The black receptionists were so unprofessional and classless for body shaming Lizzo. Save that for the streets.
Also, I was actually dehydrated but they diagnosed me with having a stomach bug. I thought stomach bugs were contagious, and no one that was around me got sick. I also felt immediately better after receiving IV fluids. I thought stomach bugs lasted for much longer than that. Why am I surprised by any of this? This is Medical Center Enterprise. They messed up on my grandmother’s feeding tube and they sent my grandfather home when he was clearly on the brink of death. If he had not went to Flowers Hospital, he would’ve died. I’ve also dealt with fat-shaming at this “hospital” in the past. The Emergency department is the worst department in MCE. The department that’s involved with childbirth is the best. I’m still giving this place one star.

name: Lena Terrell
text: This hospital is not even worth the one star. I went to this hospital's ER yesterday because I had a sore throat and stiff neck with a fever (also because the nurse advice line told me to go to the ER asap). It all started at the registration counter, they somehow got my birthday wrong when I gave them my ID twice and told them multiple times it was the wrong year. Then I was shown to a room that was full of chairs and other medical equipment but that's not what annoyed me the most. I was not given any fluids for my dehydration cause by having a hard time swollen, but I was barely checked on it was like they had forgotten about me. What bothered me the most was that the nurse did not even check my neck which was one of my main complaints. They sent me home with antibiotics which is barely working because I can still barely eat or drink anything and I keep having these fevers. I've been to many hospitals and I have never been treated so poorly or felt like my illness does not matter.  So, if you don't feel well, I suggest going to Flowers hospital or an urgent care, you'll most likely be in better hands.

resp.text: We're disappointed to hear of these experiences. We appreciate your feedback, as we are always looking for ways to improve.

name: London Hughes
text:
I came in complaining of spotting with clots and cramping. I asked them to check my cervix several times as I was 16w5 days pregnant and have had 6 losses in one year. They told me to wait for my appointment the following day. I told them that I wasn’t going to be able to make that appointment because of no one to watch my son. They just said “Well you will have to.” Checked fetal heart tones which I told them I did already and sent me on my way... the next day I went into early labor. I lost my daughter 3/19/2021 at 3:38am because no one took me seriously or listened to me. I do want to say the two nurses who were with me when my water broke were amazing. My labor and delivery nurses were absolutely amazing. One of the Er drs told me that atleast i have one child alive.

I cannot wait to leave this place, and never return. If only they listened to me maybe my daughter would still be here. That was the second time I had came in with spotting and blood clots and I was not heard.

text: Medical Center Enterprise is THE BEST place in the entire Wiregrass area to have a baby. I began going to the gyno there when I was fourteen years old and Dr. Banach was my first doctor. I just had my second&last baby last week, am about to turn forty-one and have now had babies delivered by both Dr. Heim and Dr. Pollard. They are both superior, as well as their staff and the Enterprise Medical Center staff. A mother or future mother could never go wrong choosing to be a patient at Enterprise Women's Medical Center and delivering their baby at Enterprise Medical Center. Enterprise Women's Medical Center is also the best place to go for all your female needs even if you are not a mother and do not plan on being one. I give everyone listed 5++++ stars and I literally NEVER give reviews to anyone or for anyone almost anytime. For me to write a review everything about a place has to be either exceptional or horrible. Enterprise Medical Center and Women's Center are beyond exceptional.

text: Fast and amazing service through the ER. Was initially seen for vitals within 15 mins and in a room in 30. Visit ended in needing a procedure and the operating team was no less informal, friendly and thorough.  A very calming experience as it's never been an enjoyable experience visiting ERs in the past.

name: Amanda Patrick
text: My husband has been fighting an account with this hospital for over a year. He was told it had been handled, to only check up on his credit report and find a collection, from this hospital. He NEVER received any notices or statements, but yet can't get anyone on the phone to try to refile the claims. Insurance states they need to file CORRECTLY, but yet can't get anyone at the hospital to do THEIR job. If they can't treat patients with anymore respect than to BILL CORRECTLY, and notify them in a timely manner, then I WILL NOT BE GIVING THEM ANYMORE OF OUR CARE. We shouldn't have to fight for a bill we don't owe in the amount they claim, simply due to carelessness and laziness on the billing departments side of things. We will gladly pay what we owe, but not a bill that hasn't been filed to insurance correctly, you shouldn't have to pay for insurance monthly, to only have hospital bill you for a stay that they refuse to file with insurance correctly. Simply do your job, and do what you say you are going to do do, instead of telling your patients it has been taken care of, and then they only get blind sided when they go into checking things on their own. We have requested  call backs, to which we never get, we have sent in letters asking to fix account that go ignored, JUST DO YOUR JOB, I would GIVE ZERO STAR'S, BUT IT WON'T LET ME

resp.text: We're disappointed to hear of these experiences. I would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to me directly at (334) 393-8704 when you have a chance. Thank you, and I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Amanda Bickham
text: I absolutley love my doctor, so I chose to have my surgery at MCE despite the poor reviews.  The nurses were mostly kind, but they dropped the ball several times.  When I came out of surgery the nurses left the IPC device unplugged until I woke up from my morphine induced sleep 6 hours later.  It was good that I educated myself beforehand so that I knew that they needed to turn it on.  The next problem was their lack of food options.  I eat a very clean diet, so the heavily processed and salty food just destroyed my stomach. I decided to go without food instead of making myself sick with their food.  On the night of June 16th, my nurse had a trainee and neither one of them offered to help me walk the halls.  I explained that I was in extreme pain and suffering from nausea and dizziness.  I made it to the restroom on my own 3 times and asked them to please review the cup and dispose of it.  The night nurses did not check on me, so I was left to care for it in my own.  When i finally fell asleep, I was woken around midnight by the loud crackling of the 2 nurses.  In the morning I explained that the meds weren't helping with my pain, nausea, or dizziness.  The nurse told me that I needed to take more meds or showering would be unbearable.  She was very abrassive and kept trying to push me take more meds.  Never once did she offer to help me to walk in order to relieve some of the pressure.  I was listed as a fall risk (due to anemia), and the nurses instructed me to shower on my own.  I barely made it back to the bed before passing out.  I clicked the nurse help button and the new nurse on duty came in to help me get back in bed.  The lab tech that drew my blood (the second time) was not any more considerate of my pain.  She immediately rammed her cart into my bed and blamed it on her supervisor not getting her a cart with brakes. She then inserted the needle wrong and had to restick me.  It looks like the hospital needs to up their training in compassion for the majority of their nurses.  The one nurse that was like an angel was Beatrice.  I think the younger nurses should watch and follow her lead.  Thankfully I was released soon after.  I'm able to walk with the help of my husband and he regularly reminds me to do my breathing exercise to avoid post op pneumonia. It seems easy enough to take care of yourself after a surgery, but I spent most of the time sleeping or in pain.  Thr nurses told me that I needed to walk the halls 3x/day and not a single one of them offered to help me despite the fact that I was a fall risk.  I needed the nurses to remind me and help me to take care of myself, and they failed at that several times.

resp.text: We're disappointed to hear of these experiences. We appreciate your feedback, as we are always looking for ways to improve.

name: Cherelle Davis
text: This is a ridiculously pathetic hospital i have ever been to ,for the second time. Speaking on the behalf of My wife . Her first visit two months ago, it was terrible. I went to the hospital to sit with my wife . As i went through the emergency room to see exactly how to find her . An African American lady rudely described how to get to the “fast track “ room . I followed directions and it was an empty floor with dimes lights on one end of the hall and light on the other end of the hall . Let’s not forget i am not from Alabama. I am from Illinois. There was no nurse to be found . I stumbled across a worker who was janitor and asked did he see any nurses . He stated he doesn’t know . I called the emergency room off of my phone for directions to find the fast track room . Her voice grew as i was confused on finding the room . And as she got frustrated she said i can come back downstairs because my wife was discharged. As the janitor continues to work i ask him how do i get back downstairs , he politely gave me directions to the elevator. As i pass the empty dark patient rooms on the second floor , i stumbled past the fast track room . As i begin to knock i hear nurses laughing uncontrollably and loud . The nurse answer the door and asked what is it that i need as if i was interrupting as she chew her sandwich in her mouth and sandwich in her hand . I told her i was looking for my wife and why isn’t there a nurse on the floor as i walked around for an half hour looking for help as you nurses have the door closed . She showed me to my wife. I ask the nurse why did the emergency room associate who sign people in tell me that my wife was being discharged . She stated that she doesn’t know . I sat with my wife and asked how was she she said that the service is terrible and believe the nurses has no idea what they are doing . Blood was on the wall i asked why she said the nurse caused that from the needle she put into her and another nurse was making the previous nurse clean it up but she didn’t finish . As i stayed i complained about the hospitality of the workers there . The nurses didn’t state what they were doing every move they made on her . And i wanted to ask just to see if they were going to say something. And they didn’t as they finished up with her we hurry up and left . Yesterday we went to the same enterprise hospital because my wife was in pain . We were the only two in the emergency room at 4 am . They er clerk said the doctors were situating a person that came in through ambulance. Which made me question exactly how many doctors and nurses are there . The nurses were better this time but the shadow girl never stated who she was . The doctor came in and said they couldn’t find exactly what was causing her pain as they lazy butt barely tried to find out . They gave her medicine AT the hospital and said that’s all they are going to give her for her pain in the stomach . We went home and she woke back up with pain just a few hours later . We went to flowers hospital and the hospitality was amazing it was faster and more professional and caring than enterprise hospital and they asked why did the nurse do this but not that . We didn’t know but we knew enterprise hospital was a bad hospital not to mention they weight machine did not work at all . Crazy right?!? Despite the drive . It was worth it because Flowers found the underlying problem enterprise hospital failed to figure out . With something that only took an x ray to find out . And was seen by two different doctors with in the same hour . It’s sad. I would never recommend anybody go to enterprise hospital even if they were dying . I hope it gets better for the community and those who depend on this hospital. On the other hand thanks to flowers for everything.

name: Julie Burkes
text: Visited this hospital recently with my small child.  I'm not from the area and wished I had time to research area hospitals more prior to this visit.  The hospital really really really needs to hire housekeepers.  In the emergency waiting room the chairs were full of uneaten food and crumbs. The floor was covered with old food crumbs as well.  I looked over at the side table and there was a used mask and glove. Gross! It appeared the room has not been cleaned for months. If I had a serious illness or open wound it would be safer to treat at home than risk infection. On the brightside the nurse practitioner and staff were friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Julie Burkes, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience and will use this as an opportunity to improve. Your feedback helps us improve, so thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did.

name: Aa Ron
text:
Submitted my bill for collections even after I paid immediately through Health Savings Account Direct.  They lost the first payment and I had to call multiple people. ( get hung up on a lot through their phone system). Eventually I resent the payment but instead of sending me a bill showing paid they submitted to a TN collection agency. Will follow up with legal action since I have written / electronic proof of all the above statements.

They do not return calls or better business bureau complaints.  I was billed 700 dollars for a take home sleep apnea montior ( little plastic SD Device). Initially they wanted to charge insurance 5000 dollars or so for hospital overnight stay but the take home test over 700 dollars is a bit abusive.

This code was billed to HSA "Oral phangeal airway " no i did not get a JTUBE. (take home sleep test ). Insurance Billing Fraud at its finest. My problem is I have to constantly check on this, make phone calls and do their job for them to fix the issues.

Notice there is no response (that what happens when your guilty )

resp.text: A Ron, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience and will use this as an opportunity to improve. Your feedback helps us improve, so thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did.

name: Hasina Dukes
text: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL. This hospital was so careless. I had gotten into a very bad accident and was 14 weeks pregnant and they didn't send anyone into my room until 40 minutes after arriving via ambulance. The nurse (who seemed to not even know how to use a fetal Doppler) found no heartbeat so they sent in the ultrasound tech who told me she couldn't give me any information on the baby and I would have to wait for the doctor to come in and talk to me. A doctor never came and informed me about my baby. I waited 2.5 hours and then they discharged me. When they discharged me they sent in someone to remove an IV I was apparently suppose to get but never did. I was 11.5 hours away from home so getting into my Ob the next day wasn't possible. This hospital did not seem to care about anyone. My husband, 1 year old daughter and I were all stranded in this small town and when asked for help on taxis and rental car places we were ignored. Police officers were no help as well, just handed a phone book and walked away. Worse possible place to get into a car accident.

name: Katherine white
text: I am so upset with the emergency room staff.. a football player was rushed to emergency due to a possible head injury. After the game some of us parents and players came to check on the 7th grade kid. We were very respectful. Yes we were standing around but we were no loud at all. No kids were running around. Just waiting for word on how he was. The lady checking people in called security on us and was very rude. There was absolutely no reason for security to come or for us to be treated so bad. I have always been behind our hospital and praised them. No more!!!! Very disappointed in this hospital staff.

name: Judy Hammock
text: Outstanding staff from doctors to nurses. We felt very secure in their care.

resp.text: Judy Hammock, we are so pleased you had a good visit to Medical Center Enterprise! We're glad to hear we delivered a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Jaws
text: So called doctor Stephanie Lewis should have her license taken away. Very unprofessional and misdiagnosed my wife when what was wrong was on the chart. This was validated by the 2nd doctor we saw a day and a half later. After Lewis spent less than a minute with us trying to joke with my sick wife, she walked out to the nurses’ desk and started texting. The second doctor said that what my wife had could have been treated the first time. He said since it wasn’t it got worse.

resp.text: Hi Jaws, we appreciate your review. We set a high standard for ourselves, so we are disappointed to hear that yours didn't meet those standards. Here at Medical Center Enterprise, we strive for excellence, and are disappointed to hear that you did not have a positive experience.

name: Angelica Fekula
text: I was experiencing severely distressing symptoms. I went to the Emergency room and waited less than 20 minutes.  The doctors worked quickly. One of them even gave me a hug. Everyone was very pleasant and the facility is very clean. Overall, it was a good experience.

name: Brandy Catrett
text: Rude

resp.text: We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at (334) 393-8704 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Margaret Esplin
text: I had a nightmare experience here! I went in because my contractions were 5 min apart and at first no one there believed me and they were about to tell me to go home, but lucky for me my water decided to break so they believed me that something was ACTUALLY happening. I was treated like such an inconvenience! The nurses hooked me to an IV and then left me, the only person that paid attention to me was my husband. I guess my labor was WAY too slow for the medical staff so they tried to "speed" things up and I got these horrible 7 minute contractions!! I can't believe how much pain I was in! It didn't hurt that bad before I came in and had these morons mess with my body. Also the anesthesiologist is completely incompetent! She numbed HALF of my body(I found out later the same thing happened to a neighbor of mine who gave birth here). 26 hours of having these idiots mess with me and me being in so much pain, I really was crap at standing up for myself, my doctor showed up at about 25 hours of me being at the hospital and decided that I needed a C-section! I hate these people so much, there are no words! Woman have been giving birth for thousands of years, this place does not treat birth like a natural process, they treat it like a medical problem. DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE WITH YOUR CARE

name: Jennifer Moseley
text: My review is not based on the experience we had with the medical personnel. They were all outstanding.  The support personnel need to be taught how to deal with patients in difficult situations and not come across as accusatory when they encounter payment issues.  I worked in this capacity with a large medical practice for years and I always tried to deal with my patients fairly and if a situation came up we discussed it privately.

name: Lorie Young
text: Need a  updated hospital....

resp.text: Here at Medical Center Enterprise, we are always looking for ways to improve; we appreciate your input. If you would be willing, we would like to have you contact us at (334) 393-8704 to discuss ways we can better serve you in the future.

name: Ashley Fulton
text: The labor and delivery staff we excellent. The staff was friendly and took care of my son and myself. We even had to be readmitted due to his Bilirubin levels eing high. I wasn't happy to be away from my other two children, but the staff definitely helped a little by being friendly and pleasant! And I don't know why people complain about hospital food, I thought it was delicious!

name: Ashley Pitts
text: I went to emc Saturday night June 22,2019. I had my tubes tied 4 years ago. My OB put me on birth control. I hadn't had a period since Apirl 24,2019. I had two positive pregnancy test. I started bleeding saturday so I went to the er. I got there at 9:12p.m I didn't leave till 3:10am. They done blood work and a ultrasound and didn't tell me anything about any of it. The staff didn't know what they where doing. Doctor roller sucks. I should have went to flowers. They don't need a star but I had to give one to leave this

resp.text: Ashley Pitts, we regret to hear that you had this experience. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention.

name: Linda Howell
text: Excellent care and have a great staff.

resp.text: Linda Howell, thank you so much for the positive review! Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to share your positive experience. Have a great day!

name: Chip Sahoy
text:
Needed a wheelchair to take non-ambulatory patient in for pre op evaluation.  No wheelchair for general use provided.  Had to go to Emergency Room to ask for chair.  ER receptionist attempted to phone for assistance and eventually had to go and get a chair on her own.

Wheelchairs, both regular and large sizes need to be available at the hospital entrance.

name: Kyarra Scott
text:
Ive had one bad experience here in august2016 with labor and delivery.  The nurses were rude and inattentive and just didn't seem to care.

I've had a great experience this past February 2019 with labor and delivery one nurse in particular get name was june.  I had my normal obgyn in dothan . Thought I was in labor but didn't wanna go all the way to dothan for a false alarm so I went there and they checked me and hooked me to the baby heartbeat machine and contraction machine and all and confirmed I was in labor mrs june was very attentive and caring and was just so sweet  I got to sign out (had to sign one of those papers since I was in labor but we went to dothan and had my son.  But I will not forget Ms june she was the sweetest lady.  If I ever go into labor and cant make it to dothan I hope to have someone as kind as her or her herself to help deliver

resp.text: Hello Kyarra Scott, we appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback. Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out!

name: Willi Mylum
text: My first doctor left for an eye appointment. The "practitioner" came way later n said the opposite of wht the first one said. Then left 2 hours later a nurse came in and asked me what I thought they should do. And now I'm sitting here still waiting while they are at desk talking about some girls wedding party! ! By far my worse experience ever I will never come here again! !

name: Lonewalker Causey
text: Had late night accident at home. Went to ER here. Service was excellent from the admission lady to nurses doctor and xray man. I was very satisfied and while i hope i dont need to go again i would certainly use this hospital again.

name: Amanda Rose
text: This Hospital is a joke. It's a fact that they are a bunch of rude people. Evil people are rude. If I could zero stars I would.

resp.text: Amanda Rose, we regret to hear that you had this experience. It is disappointing to learn of your experience with us. Your feedback helps us improve and we would like to learn more about how we can make this better.

name: Wayne Lamb
text: I received excellent care.

resp.text: Wayne Lamb, we are so pleased you had a good visit to Medical Center Enterprise! We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

name: Christopher P
text: The service is pretty awful.  This is the 3rd time I've been here and all my experiences were the same. I went here for a low priority health issue and there were only 3 people in the waiting room.  It took 2+ hours to be seen.  They had 10 or so nurses in the ER room, none of whom seemed very busy at all.  They were friendly, but had absolutely no sense of urgency.  I would recommend the one of many urgent care centers around Enterprise, the wait was significantly less ( 20 min or less in my experience).

name: Sara Mitchell
text: This staff does not care about their patients. There is absolutely no sense of urgency whatsoever! I have been here in a room with my 8 year old son with a possible concussion for 40 minutes and NO ONE has even been in here to ask the first question. I'd hate for something to be seriously wrong with him. You'd probably die before they even asked you what happened! Step it up Enterprise Emergency Room! You can do better than this!

name: JaloniiMonroè
text: They took forever they did not have time for everybody else and over there talking doing whatever

resp.text: Supanatural, we regret to hear that you had this experience.

name: Mark Jones (Blackfin)
text: Don't get get sick and go here. Even if you make regular monthly payments on your bill, they send it to collections and ruin your credit. Had MRI done in July 2016. Established a payment agreement before the MRI. Never got a bill, until a collections notice was received in Sept, 2016. Sent some money to the agency. Then got a bill from MCE in Oct. So I sent MCE a payment and kept sending them through the month of January. Found by doing a routine credit report review that on Feb 2, 2017. The collection agency had put a collection account on my credit report and reduced my score buy 58 points. They acknowledged all my payments through Jan, 2017. So why then  if I have been making payments regularly   to the hospital, does this dirty debit collector have to be involved and ruin my credit? Avoid this hospital at all costs.

name: Shianne Raye
text: I brought my son to the emergency room, they took their sweet time to see him and when it was time to be discharged I had to wait another hour.  So I went out to see what the hold up was and everyone is just sitting around, talking.

name: john rhoden
text: Awesome service daughter had her adenoids removed here. Nurses and doctors communicated well and everyone was very nice and kind awesome.

name: Aja Daughtry
text: This place has to be a complete and utter joke! These people have got to be some of the most rude and condescending ones I have ever met! You go in and heaven forbid you be seen in a timely matter! Thank goodness I didn’t go in complaining of a heart attack, I may have gone into Cardiac Arrest before even being seen! They stick you in some of the dungy run down rooms ever, and the staff again is just rude! Occasionally you might find the one that actually has some sense of humanity that will treat you like the human you are, but it’s rare! Don’t expect to go I there and be treated any better than road kill, because you won’t! I get they see may people all day, they work long shifts and they even see a little bit of everything too from the somewhat normal to the down right nasty.....however, it shouldn’t matter how I come in there looking (mind you I’m well dressed and appearance is kept up) or not, I should, along with anyone else in that hospital that walks in at any given time be treated as if I’m family! That surely won’t happen here!

name: The Ginger Root Tales
text: THE EMERGENCY ROOM STAFF: HORRIBLE!!! BE AWARE OF THE WORD "PROVIDER" HE IS NOT A DOCTOR! My son went there to receive treatment and the "provider" there did nothing for him in the end. No antibiotics were given despite the fact he DID IN FACT have a sinus infection. Also, the bedside manner was horrible. He wanted to actually "get angry" in front of myself and my family. Not to mention, they wanted to do a cath on my toddler and all they had to do was start the fluids in the IV FIRST!!! I did reject the cath and they instead did what I suggested and it worked. Had to complain to two administration staff. They do not know the "ORDER" and proper treatment of a patient. WILL  NOT GO BACK!!!! The only reason why I give it even 2 stars is because of a few nice nurses.

name: Ashok Patel
text: This two star is just only for done if the staff otherwise I don't like to give a single star because it is just a waste of your time whenever you comes here. They takes so long for just a lab work and exray. I am waiting here since long journey st for EKG.  I AM TIRED.

name: Tracy Viana
text: We had an excellent experience! My father's emergency infection was handled quickly, professionally, and in a very kindly way! It was a scary situation which could have been MUCH worse!

name: Kiki Hall
text: They don't call Enterprise Medical Center the "slaughter house" for nothing. They killed my grandmother and my cousin all within a three year period, Enterprise Medical Center is no hospital, in fact it is a business ran by heartless, greedy people who cares more about how much money you have than the actual patient. How do you go in with gastrointestinal problems and then the next day you are in ICU and then two days later you are on life support!! and 48 hours after that you are pronounced Dead!!! That's what happened to my cousin this past week in that order! And similar incident happened to my grandmother three years back, my family begged Enterprise to send her to Dothan, but their response was " we have to wait until she gets better " before we move her! I wouldn't go to them if I had a common cold. Most check in..Most don't check out

name: Yo Yo
text: These people not only cannot do their jobs, it seems they just do not care. My mother has bad acid reflux and it was in her chart in several places. She takes meds for it. Just before they closed the kitchen they sent her a plate of Mexican food for supper. So she lived on pudding and Ensure until morning. Go somewhere else. I know my family will.

name: Yasmine Dean FutureRN
text: Awful. Awful service. The nurses were rude. Looks like they were just ready to go home. Hey can do a lot better with being sympathetic with  patients or at least a bit concerned. They certainly chose the wrong profession.

name: Bill Richards
text: My wife has been in a room 4 hours waiting to go to surgery.She hasn't had anything to eat or drink since 10 p.m. last night it's now 10:30 a.m.... ridiculous

name: Cassi Abston
text: Horrible! I stayed a week and they didn't know what was wrong with me..I went to the rucker hospital and they told me it was mono...the enterprise clinic didn't test for that? Idk spent a week and they had no clue what was wrong.They tried to send my father in law home claiming Obama care..he had pneumonia and could have died if he didn't go to the flowers hospital.

name: Jonathan Bradford
text: Very fast. In and out the emergency room in less than an hour.

name: Jennifer Ward
text: They had my husband arrive at 8:30 and its now 11:30 and they still do not know how long its going to be. He cant eat or drink anything and they wouldnt give him ice chips. This is the WORST hospital. I would rather drive an hour to Dothan then come back here. Wish i could give it half a star.

name: Andrea Z
text: My mom, Ines Vallejo, unfortunately had a horrible experience at the Medical Center Enterprise.  On day one, she did receive great care with nurse Justin and Page.  It progressively got worse however with the new nursing staff refusing to help her with bathing and showering until her doctor made his rounds. Well, the doctor didn't make rounds until 4 PM on day three which meant all day without caring for her hygiene. What makes it worse is that she had n/v and diarrhea. She had a heart monitor and IV so couldn't do it on her own. Unacceptable! The room was left with dirty linen piled high on the bathroom floor and trash full to the rim for two days in the a row. Each day at around 6 PM when she gave up hope for her room to be cleaned, she had to call to get the room refreshed. Gross! When her liquid diet got changed to bland, she was sent a dish with ground beef.  She's never eaten ground beef in her life.  If she would have had an opportunity to talk to dietician or fill out a form, he/she would have known this fact. Most of the staff were cold and made her feel like she was a burden. Did they forget why they get a paycheck?! My mom did not want to complain but when I saw her holding back tears, I called Chad McCullough, CEU of the hospital.  He was very nice and apologetic. He agreed that the care she received was unacceptable. After talking to Chad, the floor manager and charge nurse suddenly came to identify themselves on day four. My mom was a nurse at Flowers Hospital for several years and never witnessed this lack of care and disrespect. She will never return despite Chad promising the poor care will improve.

name: Ed-Rab
text:
I was scheduled for a test requiring I stay overnight.  The hospital secured my BCBS insurance information, in advance - and the hospital is a preferred provider in the BCBS network - yet when I showed up for my test they demanded almost $300 as a deductible despite me telling them there was not one due.  I paid, BCBS later paid the hospital 100%, and almost 3 weeks later I still had not received a refund of the money the hospital demanded I pay.  After my complaint, it was almost another 4 weeks before the money was finally returned to me.

As a network provider, they should have known BCBS would pay 100%; perhaps, they were hoping I would be too lazy to demand my refund.  The burden fell on me to get my refund.  If you require medical care at this facility, I recommend you ensure beforehand what you will be required to pay in advance, and check that against your insurance benefits if you may be financially burdened by an arbitrary charge similar to what I incurred.

name: Skylar G
text: TERRIBLE EXCUSE FOR A HOSPITAL. I debated posting this for a long time, and am finally doing so because I believe it is necessary. I delivered here and am sad to say I had way better expectations. I was sent home in labor, first time mother, on her due date. It was only a couple of hours later, we were rushing to the hospital so i didn't have to deliver on the side of the road. Not to mention, I was gbs positive and never received an antibiotic(since I was sent home, in tears, having contractions). I'm thankful that my child and I are okay. But would NEVER recommend this hospital to anyone. After hearing my FULL story, not just what i've mentioned in this review, i've actually convinced anywhere from 10-15 people to NOT deliver there. Not to mention, my trash piled up for 2 days straight, and anyone that has had a child will know... that is NOT sanitary. It looked like  Dr. Pollard is an amazing doctor, honestly he deserves a medal. He is the only reason I am giving more than 1 star.

name: Keisha Reid
text: Waited over two hours while my son cried in pain from an earache. Ask the nurse Noel did they forget about us "no" she raids and I wait an additional hour with no one even looking at his ears. They don't need to be open.

name: Bobby
text: The care I received twice at MCE was good. However, there business department is mediocre at best. First I received  a colonoscopy and the billing department billed it as six different procedures instead of cancer screening. They then threatened  me with a collection agency and to keep the collection agency at bay, I made several payments totalling several hundred dollars as I was trying to straighten this whole thing out. My insurance company said it was supposed to filed as "routine cancer screening" and they billed it incorrectly. I went to the business office in person and they argued that the billing submitted was correct. Meanwhile I contacted the insurance company again and they "audited" the bill. In September last year they said they would refund monies paid in and I'm yet to see this. (July 2016) I made contact telephonically with the business office again and now they claim their holding the funds due to a recent bill submitted for routine blood work (lab), that Enterprise Express Care (affiliated with MCE) sent them, instead of sending it to a regular lab that charges a normal amount. The hospital billed my insurance Co $4333.70 for 3 vials of blood, consisting of 7 tests!!!! Ludicrous, to say the least. Very disappointed and I'm waiting for the business office to get back with me, however I believe an Attorney is going to end up making some money, since I'm tired of blood-thirsty leaches!

name: LAURA FREEMAN
text:
So its now 1:18 AM.
My trip to the enterprise medical center (enterprise , al hospital)
PLEASE GO TO DOTHAN THIS HOSPITAL SUCKS!
My 11 month old daughter had a 104.2 fever. I was terrified . When we arrived around 7:30(ish) her temp ran 102.9. At this point her last dose of motrin was at 6:30.
By time I got back to the room it was 11. I told the nurses she needed medicine for her fever. Almost 1 1/2 hours later they come back with the medicine and strep and flu test. I ask for the nurse to check her ears, she says she will and just WALKS out the room! Zia was burning up and miserable. I continued to wait . the "Doctor" comes back roughly 30  minutes later and tells me both test were negative . Im wondering if she was a nurse instead of a doctor)
She looked at her ears after I asked her personally twice after I explained she has been tugging at her ears. She glanced in , I'm not sure if she even looked well enough to tell if an ear infection could be bothering her.
Now here's the part that got me .

I asked her to take a blood sample from zia to check her white blood count . Her unexpected response was.
"No , I'm not gonna take her blood" I had a confused look on my face.
She proceed to say "ohhh viruses are known for high fevers, like 102,103,104"
False. Bacterial infections are known for being accompanied by high fever.
She also told me "a 104 temp is nothing to worry about in a baby"
Oh yeah nothing to worry about besides ya know febrile seizures and brain damage if it went just 2 degrees higher -eye roll -

It went quiet for probably about 30 seconds and she buts in "even if we were to take her blood and it come back with a high white blood count (meaning infection) I wouldn't prescribe antibiotics because I AM NOT attempting to figure out what's wrong with her tonight, its more than likely viral just follow up with her pediatrician just in case our test came back false," then walked out.

At this point the nurse walks in to retake my daughters temp. Its only down to 101.9 and she gave me the discharge papers and that was that.
I am beyond livid!!!!! I pray to God by daughter just has a virus. I'm so scared.

name: Diana Merriweather
text: I dont want to talk about my experience in labor and delivery i just want to say to deliever at fflowers . Only good reveiw i have is from my night  nurse Tiffany

name: Akromas
text:
I took my son here after he injured himself. We got to the back quickly which was good. That was about the only good part except friendly nursing staff. I just seemed like there was no rush to help a three year old. Not only did we wait for a doctor for a long period of time. We had to wait for the doctor to ask another doctor about our son's injury.
When we finally got some info it was fairly vague and we were told to take him home and make an appointment with this other doctor for the next day. They asked us if we wanted the nurses to set up the appointment. We said yes that would be great. When we were ready to leave we were told to pick up our son's meds at CVS and given the paperwork to make the appointment... Which they had said they could do.
After we left we headed to CVS, found out that they had NOT put in the Med request at CVS. They had actually put it in at Walgreens. We drove to Walgreens, waited for them to fill the order (they did not have it ready after it being in their system over an hour). Found out that Walgreens does NOT accept our insurance after waiting 20 mins. Called the emergency room back and asked them to put the request in at Publix and asked them to call me when they had done it. I got the call and headed over  to publix a few hours later. Once we got there we found out that they had NOT put in the order at publix. This place has the worst service ever. It's scary, if I had another hospital to take my son I would have. I do not trust this place, it needs to be reviewed or something.

name: Alexandra Amos
text: Wonderful hospital. I was a patient and employee for many years.

name: April Thorpe
text: I have always had a great experience here

name: Kristie Hunt
text: Very rude room staff they sleep on the job I was not there 9 months ago I was there 4 years ago to have my thyroid removed I've never left a review but my youngest daughter are always there for herself and her kids she left the review but I must agree no matter what part of the hospital you are in the nurse are just rude especially the er and patient rooms

resp.text: Hi Kristie Hunt, we can assure you that we do not find this type of behavior acceptable, and we would like to address the situation you have described.

name: Beth Hughes
text: This is just a great hospital all around!

name: John Grider
text:
My mother presented to the ER with lower extremity edema and ascites of unknown cause that had appeared in the past 3 weeks.  She had pitting edema, rapid breathing and reported that she became breathless lying flat on her back.  Her pulse was 120 - - tachycardic.  These are classic symptoms of congestive heart failure and the expected course of workup would be ECG, chest xray and echocardiagram.  These are fast, inexpensive tests.

Instead the ER staff seemed to suspect abdominal carcinoma (granted a possibility but pitting edema indicates heart) and investigated her liver using CT imaging with contrast media.

As far as I know, she was never given a simple ECG and/or echocardiagram which would have revealed  (to competent staff, anyway) the underlying cause of the edema - - congestive heart failure due to atrial fibrillation - - the most common cardiac arrythmia in the USA.  She was sent home with a prescription for a diuretic and orders to follow up with her primary care doctor in 4-5 days -- NO MENTION OF GREATLY INCREASED STROKE RISK from the undiagnosed a-fib.

In the end the ER billed Medicare for expensive, unnecessary CT imaging when a simple ECG would have revealed the root problem.  If you go in to the ER with something sticking out of your body that's not supposed to be there, maybe you will have better chances of receiving a correct diagnosis.  I give them 2 stars because she walked out alive - - they didn't do anything to kill her.  But, neither did they do anything to help.

name: Caren Carr
text:
The service was terrible. The doctor I saw, Dr. Christy Edwards, had no bedside manner. She came in delivered bad news and told me there was nothing I could do about it so I shouldn't worry. The information I got there was wrong. She terrified me for no reason. The whole medical staff treated me like I was a bother.
I will never go back there.

name: Deborah Trammell
text: Had outpt surgery.  The staff was awesome!

name: Dorothy Bechtold
text: Took my Mother to the ER waited 4 hours never got to see anyone,  she had all symptoms of heart attack.  We left and went to hospital in Dothan   and yes has blockage..we never had to stop at front desk immediately was taken care of.

text: Great care for my wife when my son was born!

Labor and delivery 💕
Will  never  choose any  other  place  to  have  children

text: Awful ER care! If Dr. Thomas Kelly is there RUN LIKE HELL!!!!

name: Ronda Benson
text: Awful! !!

name: Pablo Aguilar
text: Excelente servicio.muy profesionales todos

text:
(Translated by Google) Iwent, toMedicalCenterforaMRIpermyDoctorsinstructions!

Iwent,toMedicalCenterforaMRIpermyDoctorsinstructions!

text:
(Translated by Google) Over there works the love of my life.

(Original)
Por alli trabaja el amor de mi vida.

name: Jeremy Patton
text: Very well ran company.  Will treat you right in what is usually a tough time.

name: Pam Curry
text: Mom went to the ER because of symptoms related to COVID. She was admitted pretty soon after being seen and ended up in the ICU unit.  The nurses in the ICU were awesome!   Especially Hunter. He was her nurse for 4 days of her stay with them.  I never got his last name,  but he treated my mom and I both with such compassion and kindness. She got really good care while there.  I finally got to go in the hospital and see her on her last day with them and it was small and clean and really nice.  I recommend this hospital.

text: I am a huge fan of Dr. Sophia Lal.  As an athlete, my goal is to never miss a workout. name: Emily Kunkler
text:
We visited this wonderful hospital from out of town tonight as we were passing through to go to Florida for our vacation. My almost 4 year old was having an allergic reaction to something he shouldn’t have eaten and I have nothing but great things to say. We were greeted with a smile from the person checking patients temps at the door. Walked directly to the desk to get checked in and met another smiling face. Next the nurse doing vitals was very nice and friendly.  Our nurse Aida was SOOO sweet to my little boy and even gave him two prizes for being so good. He was so excited to give it to his brother when he got back to the hotel. (Reminded me of the old days when I went to the ER 25 years ago and got a stuffed animal that I still have to this day.) Dr. Gore was in the room before I even had time to sit down and was very kind, reassuring, and professional as well! Our little boy was okay too. Given some Benadryl and we were back to the hotel within an hour of leaving.

This experience was a great example of what people and hospitals should be like! Thank you!!!!

name: Ann McAnnally
text: I will not be seeing Dr. Kissel again. Worse 'patient/dr. manners I have encountered' I have been having excruciating pain in left knee, sleepless nights and misery for about 3 weeks. He was highly recommended, upon arrival they made one front board x-ray of knee after I told them explicitly it was the right inside of left knee. I am a very healthy 84 yr old, just had raving reports from primary Dr. this week on my lab work, agility and very active lifestyle. Dr. Kissels words to me were that's an old 80 year old knee, some arthritis. Take tylenol and get an otc cream. I asked if it could be a torn miniscus he said probably but that knee is old with a lot of miles. No mention of mri or further ckg into it. I could walk 2-5 miles with no limp before this onset, don't take pain pills, have not been admitted to any hospital since 1976 ,clean my own gutters, horseback ride etc. He repeatedly referred to my old knee. Well I plan to use these 'old knees' for several more years to play t ball and dollhouse in the floor with my great grands. Needless to say I cancelled my appt. to go back in two weeks, I heard him loud and clear about my old knees.  Love St. Vincent's Hospital this is totally about the one doctor.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We believe that compassionate care starts with listening. We would like to work with you directly, so could you please contact us at 205-930-2333 (Mon-Fri 8 am-4:30 pm)? Thank you. -Ascension St. Vincent's Community Manager

Everyone in the office was wearing a face mask. There is plenty of sitting space in the waiting room so everyone can easily be safety distanced. Checkin was quick and efficient. I met with the doctor at my appointment time without having to wait. The practice has its own X-ray so I was quickly  x-rayed & Dr. Worthen was able to review it while I was there for my appointment. Dr. Worthen is a excellent orthopedic surgeon. He evaluated my knee and we discussed my physical theraphy schedule. He will have me come back in a month to check my progress.

name: Emily Spivey
text: The only reason I went there was it was late Sunday night and I was very sick.  We only waited in the waiting room 10 minutes, in the other room about 15.  Girl came in, asked symptoms, said I had a sinus infection and she would prescribe something.  Left and never came back.  Total interaction, less than 3 minutes.  Tech came in and gave me a stack of paper work and said I could go.  No verbal instructions, nothing.  Came home and read stack of paper to find out a list of things I was supposed to take/do.  All they prescribed was Amoxicillin.  8 days later, still terribly sick.  The most ridiculous part was they billed my insurance $3090 for a 3 minute visit, that I found out was only a PA, not even a doctor!!!!!  I won't EVER go back there!

resp.text: Hello Emily, we'd like to look into this. Please reach out to our patient representative at (205) 939-7264. Thank you.

Thanks to all the staff at St. Vincent's Chilton very thankful for this group of doctors and nurses!!!!!!

name: Clarence1957
text: I cannot thank the staff of this new hospital enough. We were in our way from Indiana to Florida when I started experiencing stomach pains. For 3 hours my husband drove while I vomited in the back seat. It just got worse. He found this little hospital and I did wait in a gurney in the hall for a few hours but there were no open rooms in the ER, and although I felt like it I was not dieing. Tests were run and IV fluids and meds were administered. I was admitted and had to spend the night but I really am thankful for the ER Dr and nurses who helped me. I was treated with dignity & respect even though I was not an "ideal patient" (pulled my IV out once). So if you are in that area and need help, don't hesitate to go to this hospital. Thank you again for the excellent care and love you gave to me in my time of need!

text: Luckily, we have not had to use this new hospital until this past week while the kids were out on spring break. Our 5 year old son cut the end of his finger off so I immediately loaded him up and without hesitation went to the ER at St. Vincents Chilton, not really knowing if they would be able to help with a pediatric patient. The staff never hesitated about treating him. Our nurse was Meagan, nurse practitioner was BJ and the physician was Dr. Elliott. EVERYONE went above and beyond to help him feel comfortable and comfort us parents. Meagan and BJ are the best! Thank you to everyone for the outstanding service!!

text: Nothing but a horror show. My fiance wen today for a thyroid problem an they treated her horribly. Called her fat and put her down the whole time. Waiting for a call back from the hospital administration. If I could give a negative I would.

name: Kathy Peoples
text: Took my sister in early Sunday morning she had been up in crying pain with her tooth for over 13 hrs. Instead of offering some relief the young woman Dr. gave her a life lesson and told her she should take the money she buys cigarettes with and go to the dentist gave her an antibiotic prescription and walked away. I sincerely hope she never has a situation and is in so much pain and can't get help. I thought the new hospital would bring better care but it didn't just a new building. To the little Dr. With no bed side manner you want make it long in your career unless you figure out how to treat people like they matter and not down your nose at them.

name: Danielle Ware
text: My Aunt was rushed out to St. Vincent we got her about 4:30 pm. First off they put her in a Room with no information on her board to say who her Dr. was or who her Nurse was either.. It was almost 2 hours before they even had blood work done ( mind you my Aunt is 81 years old) then it was 2 hours before they came and told us what they thought was wrong.. I had questioned the nurses & Dr. Why are we still here at 12:35 & she still don't have a Damn bed here nor in Shelby County.. They told us her condition was critical but she still laying in this bed.. One the nurses tried to be sacrastic with me about how long we been out here, her name was Olivia Shoemaker the Dr. was Dr. Elliette.. Im convinced that these people are only here for the money not to care for the patients.. This trully sad & this a new hospital fairly!! It's like what was the point of giving us a new hospital if your staff could care less..

name: Tim White
text: Horrible. Nurses and Doctor decided my wife was faking or on drugs without tests. She was having seizures or convultions. We told them my wife's health and history was complicated but they didn't care. We had to leave and go to another Emergency Room. The 2nd E.R. ran blood tests that proved she was not on drugs. They ran several other tests that proved she wasn't faking. It was a reaction to a new prescription her doctor had given her. St. Vincent's Chilton is horrible and not to be trusted.

Carried my wife to the emergency room and was treated with utmost respect and everyone

But we are going to enquire about specialty doctors to see if we can possibly transfer here.
