name: Mickei Archie
text:
I went to St.Vincent's because the previous day Brookwood Baptist Shelby I had been diagnosed with multiple kidney stones.
They told me to come back if symptoms worsen, or new symptoms begin.
But because gas was low we reluctantly went to this facility. And once again got affirmation of the reasons why we should have not even bothered.
Dr.T as she is known  in the er, came in 35 minutes after I had been put in a room. And they were not busy as I went straight back, the bedside manner was hideous, the,nurses are rude one even has really bad,broken English you can't understand her words when she talks.
Anyway the doc came in, I told her about my hospital visit just yesterday and from that point she asked questions and we discussed it, she then listened to my chest and,back. Leaves the room about 15 mins after that a nurse (heavy Russian Accent!)  entered my room

name: Stephen “sknappster” Knapp
text: Service an attitude were great all staff were helpful and diligent in their cane.

name: Shay Jordan
text: So i have a cpl of foster children in my home and one had lice. We work all day so took our own children and foster children to get a perscription for shampoo to get rid of it before it spreads. The doc wrote over the counter shampoo (i explained it wasnt pay day and i could not at the moment afford to treat 6 children) and he flat out refused to write perscription strength so our insurance would cover it. (bcbs) He thought it better to just let it spread instead of actually assisting us to get it treated.

name: Stevie E.
text: Poorly managed is not nearly enough to say about this hospital. Nurses are getting their hours cut on a regular basis and then told they shouldn't be "in it for the money" by hospital administrators who cut hours because they're in it for the money. Hypocritical.

name: Johnathan Dopson
text: Literally the slowest hospital on this planet ive been here for 4 hours and no one else has been in here for the past hour and was told earlier that they had all the results in and now we're waiting for literally nothing

name: Wendylyn Geeslin
text: I can't say I'm not pleased... Had an abcess and with the swelling being so bad and omg did it hurt, my dentist sent me to the er for antibiotics. Gave me two high mg antibiotics And an injection of toradol for the swelling. Took a lot of Advil, picked up the antibiotics that morning by the afternoon the swelling was down and it felt soooo much better. Was able to get to the dentist and get it taken care of that Wednesday. Only drawback was this was on new years eve and the wait was from 6pm-11pm. Guess that's to be expected though sometimes.

name: Rosalie Pearson
text:
My mom lives in nearby Thorsby while I live in Montgomery. She called me at 11:30pm to say she felt lightheaded, a little dizzy, and had what felt like a slight pressure in her chest. She called the ambulance and the EMT's took her to St. Vincent's to be checked out.

I had left Montgomery immediately after receiving the call and arrived at the hospital minutes after her ambulance had arrived (the EMT's were just bringing out the gurney to their rig when I got there) I went into the Emergency Room, told them why I was there and gave them info on my mom (name, date of birth, address, phone, and reason for admittance). The woman told me they were going to get her in a room and then ask when I could come back. I was the ONLY person in the waiting room. About 20 minutes later she said again that they had her in a room and would see when I could go back. Fifteen minutes after that she said a woman had just gone back to see if I could go back. Needless to say it was over an hour before they let me go back. The worst part is that I had assumed they would at least let my mom know I was there. Even though she had been asking them and voicing concerns about how I had not yet arrived no one from the waiting room told her I was there and none of the nurses back with my mom bothered to check if I had arrived. This was not a far walk either, considering my mom was approx. 30 ft inside the doors from the waiting room I was in.

When I finally did get back to see her she was hooked up to a heart and pulse/ox monitor and they had a fluid IV in. They took her out to get chest X-rays and a CT scan minutes after I got back there. When she returned to the room about 15 minutes later, the nurse that brought her back first said she didn't know how to hook my mom back up to the machine and the IV...then was going to try...then decided no, she would have someone come in and do it. A half hour went by and no one came in to hook her back up. I stepped outside the door and explained that she had not been hooked back up and the nurse at the station said thanks, and they would come in and do it...which they never did. The original doctor she saw was also standing there when I told the nurse and did nothing. You would think if you were monitoring someone who you think may have had a heart attack you would want them hooked up to a monitor.

Finally, the doctor came in a little before 4am and said that the X-rays, and CT scan were just fine, but there were concerns with her blood work (PS no one had ever come in to hook my mom back up to the monitors). The doctor explained there are three types of cardiac enzymes. One that tells if there is actual muscle damage and that they use to determine if you've had a heart attack (which was normal and my mom did not), and two others. One of the extra two was normal and then the doctor said that the third was "significantly higher." She said that could indicate that although she may not have had a heart attack that enzyme could mean there could be something brewing or big That could happen on the horizon. She wanted to admit my mom so she could see the cardiologist in the morning...which we did. Kicker is when the cardiologist came in and looked at the tests he said it was slightly elevated, but nothing that he found alarming.

All in all I just felt like even though the ER was extremely slow, and at times there were 4 or more staff members sitting at the desk area within the ER, the overnight crew seemed fairly insufficient at simple things, like communicating that family members are there, or rehooking a patient back up to monitors and IV's.

name: Chauntel Abbott
text:
Unfortunately I had my gallbladder surgery here Monday. I only chose this awful hospital because BCBS will pay me $250 to have my gallbladder removed at this place and since I needed to have it removed why pass up $250. Like everyone else I did NOT have a pleasant stay.

Everything and everyone seemed so unorganized and detached. I drove myself to the surgery and naturally they would not let me drive myself home so the supervisor contacted my surgeon and he ended up admitting me overnight due to nausea. After I came out of surgery I was given Norco and Morphine at the same time and then they transferred me to the fourth floor. They would not let me take my 50mg prednisone I have been on even though the anesthesiologist gave me permission to take it. I brought the medication with me and ended up taking it anyway.

My first nurse Linda was OK and she came in and told me she was there to give me percocet which I did not know the doctor wanted me to take but I took it anyway. That was around 530ish or 6pm. Hours later around 1130ish and it was wearing off my overnight nurse came in and I let her know I was ready for my morphine and norco and that I was ready to go to sleep. So she says OK I will give you the norco and it will take 30 mins to kick in and then you'll have to wait for the morphine. Fair enough even though I told her that's not how they administered it to me upstairs. Well 30 mins pass and she came back and I asked if I could have my morphine and she said no I can only give it to you every 2 or 3 hours. That was not what she said 30 mins prior so I said you mean I have to wait till 3am and she said yes. Ok 3am came and she comes and I asked again for my morphine. Mind you I was in severe pain and it hurt to move, get up, walk, etc. Basically felt like a chainsaw grinded my insides.

Again she refused to give me the morphine and said she could only give it to me every 4 hours. At that point I called her out on it and said that is not what you said and you said every 2-3 hours. She kept saying no she didn't say that and I said I remember your exact words and you said 2 or 3 hours and at 3am. She then looks up and says "I might have said that" and she said since I am being discharged with pain meds they don't like to give shots only pills. What??? What does my discharge meds have to do with meds the doctor specifically ordered for me to take in the hospital? So finally I said look what is the problem I just had surgery and I am in pain can you please give me my morphine. So she says OK, leaves for 2-3 mins, and comes back and says good news I can give you morphine or toradol. She proceeds to try and explain what toradol is and and I stopped her and said I know what toradol is and that is not what they have been giving me and is not what I asked you for. Can you please give me my morphine.

She finally says yes and goes to get it and when she comes back she seemed annoyed. That nurse Sharon Hendrix refused multiple times to give me the pain medication the doctor ordered for me. A nurse does not have that right or authority to go against doctor's wishes like that. I just had my gallbladder removed for crying out loud and this is how I was treated. Not only that but she even tried to get me to leave the hospital at 3am. She kept saying "you know you are discharged and can leave anytime you want". Mind you 3 hours prior she gave me a Norco which was still in my system so basically had I left it would be considered a DUI if I was pulled over. She automatically labeled me a drug seeker and deliberately denied me pain medication. This was a last minute surgery I had to have even though I did not want to.

Also if you page a nurse it takes them like 30 mins just to check on you and you'll have to page them twice. No one seems to know anything etc etc. I will NEVER go back to this place.

I will be filing a complaint with the nursing board though I doubt they will do anything.

name: Brian McGee
text:
My father has been at NAMC 16 days.  He is currently in ICU on a ventilator.  Our family has been trying to get a single daily update from any doctor treating him without success.  I am able to go meet with his nurse daily and get updates during 10am visiting hour but the information is limited.  After going through Director level staff a few updates were received from a doctor and then stopped again.  The communication both internal and to the patents/patents families is terrible to say the least.  It is clear there is administrative problem in solving this as there appears to be no one being held accountable for providing comprehensive patent information in reasonable intervals.  I would not recommend this hospital and would transfer my father out if it were a safe option given his condition.  There are some great people working at NAMC but not enough to save the sinking ship.   My prayers are with the health care providers and the patents they see daily.  Praying NAMC steps up there game.

I am sure I will receive the following canned reply:
"Hello, if you wish to discuss your experience further, please reach out to our Performance Improvement department: (phone number). Thank you"

I did try to call this number before writing my review, unfortunately this number in NAMC's canned reply isn't a 24 hour number so they do not seem very concerned with actually receiving a response.  The recording states "administration main is not available, record your message at the tone...".

Hope this helps others.

name: Carol Lee
text:
The care by doctors and staff were adequate. So much is done electronically rather than personal interaction. Example: rather than seeing a nurse from time to time, I was monitored by approximate a dozen and half sensors attached to my frontal body. To collect and calculate the amount fluid I was discharging by urination, there  was a cup located in the commode. My husband had to ask them at the Nurse's Station to check and empty it as it was left unattended to the point of overflowing.
Starting outside, the building and grounds were unkept. There are weeds in the flower area, cigarette butts and other debris by the front door and the benches. The flower beds should be maintained by the Landscape service. Posting of no smoking signs and enforcement of such and individuals trash by Security.
Inside, debris was evident on the lobby floor, on the hallway floor of the 4th floor, in hall bathrooms, AND on the floor (considerable under my bed) of my room (#4402) where I spent Thursday evening through Sunday morning. Floor corners  of bathrooms, patient rooms, AND the elevators are not being touched when cleaning. The sink counter top in my room had debris (pieces of paper?) stuck to it.
The housekeeping staff seem as inefficient as they were at ECM, which was sadly poor. Shame! This beautiful new building's appearance  will deteriorate rapidly unless housekeeping does a better job.

My wife waited 12:30pm-7:32pm for anything.

name: C Clay
text: My husband and I are currently at the er of this hospital. He has a kidney stone and is in great pain. We have been here a couple of times before and have waited three hours or so. We  did not complain and we were patient. We have also had surgeries here as well. But tonight, in three hours and eight people in front of us, not one person has been called back for treatment in the ER. One lady told us she had been there since 5pm. I understand our country is in a pandemic but this still seems detrimental and discouraging to those coming for EMERGENCY care. This is not efficient and I hope the hospital finds some way to correct this. We plan to share this concern with our doctor because we have to have a more efficient plan of care for my husband. Hopefully people can begin to correct some major concerns that I have read in the other reviews concerning the ER.

name: David Underwood
text: My elderly father was brought to NAMC by ambulance, suspected of possibly having a mild stroke. He was kept about 4 days.  Before he was discharged, it was obvious he would need physical therapy (Rehab). One case worker gave me a list of facilities in the area for me to call about admitting him. The first place I called, the lady asked me why I was calling..."The case workers are supposed to do that for you." she said"....I was given to a different case worker and told her where we thought we would like for him to go. I never heard whether he was accepted or anything. On a Thursday AT 9PM, I FIND OUT BY ACCIDENT HE IS BEING MOVED AT THAT TIME TO A REHAB FACILITY.  I was on record as P.O.A., and person to contact. I was not contacted that he had been accepted. I was not contacted that he was being transported to another facility.  Two days later I called the Case Worker Supervisor and left my name and number. I have yet to hear from her.  His medical care was adequate, the rest was unacceptable.

resp.text: Mr. Underwood, Please call the hospital to identify who your father is.  We cannot look into the matter without the patient's name.  256-629-1900 Thank you.

name: Renee Austin
text: My experience was great. From beginning to end. NAMC was very clean, everyone was super nice. A shout out to my nurses, Kacie and Kelly on the 3rd floor. They were there for me every time I needed them. I had to stay overnight and they were great. Dr. Wakefield is a great doctor. I would recommend this hospital to everyone.

resp.text: Renee, thanks for choosing NAMC for your care! We're glad you had a great experience.

name: dave Drake
text:
I see a lot of negative reviews.  My experience was far from that.  I went in with what I hoped was bronchitis and found out I had COVID.  was told if my symptoms did not improve to come back....  I came back 4 days later with a fever and shortness of breathe.  They immediately admitted me to the hospital and ran a barrage of tests on me to find out I had COVID pneumonia and began immediate treatment on me that evening.  I spent the next 8 days in the hospital getting treated for COVID and Pneumonia and other COVID related issues.
I will say the care I was provided by the nurses,  respiratory aides, and technicians was nothing less than exemplary.  I had a few issues ( we all do when we are sick and want immediate gratification) with my medicine machine buzzing loudly when it was done and it taking what felt like 30 minutes ( closer to 10-15 minutes ) to get someone to come in the room and turn off the machine..Unfortunately this was more of a common thing than an uncommon....But that would be my only complaint with the level of service I received.....
I wish I had not had to be there but I would not hesitate to go back again if my symptoms relapsed and I truly beleive they cared about my well being and making sure I was comfortable during this trying time....

resp.text: Hi, Thank you for letting us know about your positive experience. Take care.

name: mimi Gloria lewey Rhodes
text: We went to ER last night February 7th 2021 my husband was running fever. He has been sick since Christmas. He has an abcess from gald bladder surgery. The ER Dr. Was rude and sarcastic. I just wanted to know why he was running a fever. He said there was nothing wrong with him and laughed. We got our stuff together and left. No one deserves to be treated this way. By then i was in tears that dr came back in the room when we were leaving i told him he had no clue what we had been through and we left. We will never be back in this ER.

Transfer to Florence Rehab.
Really unacceptable.
She is 85 and this puts a strain on the patient and the family.
This is supposed to be a hospital that cares for their patients.

name: Ethan Daniel
text: ER is literally painfully slow. My 2 year old daughter sat screaming due to  a dislocated elbow in a completely empty waiting room for nearly 3 hours. 1 other patient was there briefly when we arrived and there was literally no one else in the entire waiting room the rest of the time. God help you if there is a long line of people I can't imagine how long you would wait.

resp.text: Hi Ethan, we're sorry you had a longer than anticipated wait time.  Our staff must treat patients based on acuity. If you'd like to discuss your experience further, please call 256-629-1900. Thanks

name: Christopher Grigg
text: This review is specifically for the endoscopy department. Last month, June 2020, I went there for a colonoscopy. I wasn't exactly looking forward to that. I arrived at 5:30 am for the procedure. The entire staff... from checking in, prep, procedure, to discharge...was very friendly and efficient. It really made a positive difference. Great job.

resp.text: Thanks for the five-star review.  We will pass along your compliments to the Endoscopy department.  They are a great team, committed to excellent care!  Thanks for choosing NAMC for your procedure.

name: Carol Brewer Pickens (Tuter)
text:
Husband been here for bout 2 months for the most part we have been blessed with good staff members they have truly been kind to us and helped us .... thanks to each and everyone who has taken care of him in this horrific time for us💌🤍
Update:
After 4 1/2 months on hospital we got transferred to shoals hospital for better rehab while in hospital, I just wanna thank all the Drs, nurses and techs for all they done for us
The nurses and techs made a horrible situation a lil easier to bare.  We appreciate each and everyone of yall, you will never know how yall touched our lives and made things a lil easier for me to deal with.
Much love
Carol Pickens

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about your positive experience. Take care.

name: Clay Birdyshaw
text: Nobody here knows what they are doing. No common sense whatsoever

resp.text: Hi Clay, We're sorry to hear that you don't think there is any common sense whatsoever.  If you'd like to speak to someone directly about your concerns please call 256-629-1900.  We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Lisa Balentine
text: My special needs son and I spent the entire night of July 4th in the ER with a gallbladder attack. Everyone was very attentive at first, but after awhile we were pretty much abandoned. There were times when I had to physically go out and search for a nurse to help us. First we were told by the ER doctor that he had pneumonia, which then changed to a lung nodule, and finally gallstones. When I took him for his follow up with the surgeon that performed his procedure, I got the written copy of his CT scan which showed it was all clear. No nodules. No abnormalities. I never want to experience anything like this again. The ER was a nightmare. We were not even given pillows to sleep on the first night.  Thankfully our experience while admitted to the fourth floor was good.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback.  Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 so we can learn more about your concerns.  We're glad you had a positive experience on the fourth floor.

name: Brianna Cooper
text: The labor and delivery, and post partum nurses at NAMC are fantastic. Especially the L&D nurses. I had my first baby at NAMC in September of 2020, and almost every staff member that worked with us was amazing. They genuinely comforted me and answered every question I had. My care, and more importantly, my baby’s care were superb. The nursery staff is also very good. Special shout outs to: Andrea and Erica in L&D, Andy in an anesthesia, Robin C. and Melanie in PP, and Kaylee in the nursery! They all went above and beyond to make everything easier for me, and to ensure I had a wonderful experience.

resp.text: Enjoy your sweet baby!  Thanks for choosing NAMC for your care.

name: John Galt
text: Great new hospital with the same service you got at ECM. Very, very slow ER.  No employees show any sense of urgency. Patient care is poorly executed and employee moral is low.  If you seek treatment here you’ll find out the hard way. I’m guessing Executive Leadership and Hospital Administers are the culprits, but could be the nature of health care.  Extremely high prices with extremely poor service.

resp.text: Please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns.  If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: Ismael Mazate
text: Worst experience I’ve ever had in a hospital. Would not recommend it to anybody. Do yourself a favor and don’t go there!!!!!!!!

resp.text: Hello, if you wish to discuss your experience further, please reach out to our Performance Improvement department: 256-629-1900. Thank you

name: K Brand
text: I would advise staying away from this facility (previously named ECM). My mother a trained medical professional went there expressing that she knew she was having a stroke. Dr. Flowers sent her home telling her and her family that she was not having a stroke but just trying to get attention. The next morning my mother was found on the floor. She did have a stroke and because of that stroke is permanently paralyzed on one side of her body. Due to the arrogance and careless malpractice of Dr. Flowers my mother has to live the rest of her life without the use of one side of her body.

resp.text: Hello, If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: Joshua Miller
text: My wife was having contractions every 5 minutes for over 30 hours straight. She is considered high-risk because her last pregnancy ended in an emergency C section. We went to the hospital three times over two nights, each time begging to either be admitted or at least to be sent home with something for the pain or to help her sleep. Each time, Dr. Hurd told us with indifference, he would do nothing for us, to go home. I see now why so many people avoid this hospital. We will never be back if we can help it.

resp.text: Hi, if you wish to discuss your experience further, please reach out to our Performance Improvement department: 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: Becky Laremore
text: Excellence in care & service

name: Beck Norm
text: My dad had an operation here and everyone was so kind. The hospital is very clean. Top.notch clean. He was in there for 3 weeks. We weren't at all made to feel like we were a burden on anyone. He had a few bumps along the way and I will praise the CCU Unit nursing staff forever. They are kind, caring, and very helpful. They treat each patient and the patient's family wonderful. I know that they have many patients that they care for but in the moments when they are with your family it seems like they are only caring for you and your family. It was a very scary time and they were all true angels to us. I will never forget how wonderful they were to us.  Thanks for your hospitality and kindness. ❤

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words!  We appreciate your recognition.

name: Betty Cartwright
text: Their strict rules with the covid-19 makes this place safe for you and your loved ones

resp.text: Hi Betty.  Safety during this time is a top priority!

name: Richard Mccall
text: This hospital is so slow and the people that work in the er are slow and when u are in pain they do not do anything for you and look at u crazy so in nine months my wife will not have our baby here we will go to a different hospital .... That is better and faster about seeing people.

name: Quentin
text: While waiting to go to a delivery room I wasn’t allowed to be in the room with my wife. After in the delivery room I wasn’t there to keep my wife from breaking down while she received the epidural due to some policy that no one was able to actually provide for me. Once it came time to deliver the nurses pushed me aside and wouldn’t let me stand near my wife without bumping one constantly out of the way. I was treated more like an unwanted donor. After delivery we was a better situation but still not even what I would classify as good. They were understaffed everyday, constantly nagging about wanting to send the baby to the nursery, we never saw the lactation nurse even after request, amongst other things. Luckily this was our third child and not our first so we knew what to do on most everything. We were even told by staff that they were glad we were experienced parents so they didn’t have to check on us. If you are having your first or second DO NOT go to this hospital it’s not worth the added stress and disrespect. I would suggest going to Helen Keller or drive all the way to Madison as both of those hospitals treat you like human beings not cadaver bodies. We do not plan on going to this hospital again for any reason.

resp.text: Good morning, Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 to provide more insight on your situation. Thank you.

name: Gina Kiser
text: Our first experience at NAMC outpatient surgery center was terrific. We couldn't have been treated better or more professionally. Every employee and volunteer was kind to us. Even one of your employees who was clearly on a break went over and beyond to be helpful. I went to the cafeteria to have breakfast while my husband was having a small procedure done. The coffee dispenser was empty so when I mentioned it to the cashier as I was checking out, the lady behind me, who was an employee on her break, set her own  food down and took my cup to get me coffee. I just wanted to say how proud you should be off your staff. We were well taken care of. Everyone was efficient and seemed happy to be there.

resp.text: Gina, thanks for choosing NAMC for your care! We're glad you had a great experience.

name: Jessica Rena
text: ER doctor was terrible. i waited over 3 hours in pain before i was administered any medicines. its a new facility with the same terrible physicians and treatment

resp.text: Hello, if you wish to discuss your experience further, please reach out to our Performance Improvement department: 256-629-1900. Thank you

name: Monica Petersen
text: This place and its staff are AMAZING! I was admitted there Thursday morning from a different hospital. I was told I’d have to have my gallbladder removed, and a secondary procedure to remove stones from my common bile duct. From the moment I arrived, the nurses, doctors, and everyone in between were nothing short of amazing. The care that I received was top notch. Everyone from the surgeon to the housekeepers were so nice and accommodating. I will forever sing their praises and recommend their facility to anyone who needs medical treatment.

resp.text: Monica, thanks for choosing NAMC for your care! We're glad you had a great experience.

name: Denise Howard
text: They are holding a patient against his will... for 4 days! The doctor will not return calls to the family. Nurses can't tell us anything. They  won't let us in the hospital.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback.  Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 so we can learn more about your concerns.

name: Savanna Uhlman
text: I highly recommend this hospital! They got my grandfather in super quick when he was having a heart attack and probably saved his life! They did an amazing job and took excellent care of him! 10/10 recommend!

resp.text: Hi Savanna, thank you for your five-star review. We're glad your grandfather had a positive experience at NAMC.

name: Leah Black
text: We can’t say enough about the wonderful staff at NAMC, amazing is not a big enough word! They were ALL there for us on the most important day of our lives, having our son Silas Evan. They cheered me on, they counted with me as I pushed, taught me how to breast feed, they helped me throughout the night, and they made decisions about my care that I will be forever grateful for. I would not for one second hesitate to recommend this hospital and this staff! 💙

resp.text: Thank you for choosing NAMC for your care!  It was our honor to care for you and your family.

Want to know why a low scire, contact me.
I highly recommend Nirt Alabana Bone and Joinf clinic. Not the hospital.

resp.text: Hi, if you wish to discuss your experience further, please reach out to our Performance Improvement department: 256-629-2078. Thank you.

He is already up and walking. Couldn’t be more thankful for these people. Thank u Eric Perry for making sure they were taken care of

text: My husband was in North Alabama medical center on December 23, 2018. And he was treated very very great by all at the hospital from the Dr to the 4th floor nurses! Thanks for taking such good care of my husband!!!  We love N. A . M. C!!!

name: Drip Kobain
text: This is one of the most terrible places I’ve been, coming from a big city where I know if she’s 40 weeks and is more than 4 cm they will not send her home..but yet we’ve been discharged twice even tho her contractions are less than 5min apart. This is our first child and the whole maternity experience has been awful for her thanks to this facility. I strongly recommend finding another hospital to deliver your children. We will be going to another hospital as of tomorrow

resp.text: Hello, due to patient confidentiality, we cannot discuss this case online.  However, if you'd like to personally speak to someone regarding your experience, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078.  Thank you.

name: Carrie Blevins
text: Awful. I had to wait 2 hours only to be told what I had was "probably a migraine." If I could give 0 stars I would. The nurse practitioner was very rude. If I could remember her name I would put it... Terrible.. SMH

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback.  Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 so we can learn more about your concerns.

name: Diana Thomas
text: My Mother was taken to NAMC after a serious fall and stroke. I can not say enough about how tender, gentle and kind the staff treated her! Their compassion and care for not just their patient but also for the family during a very difficult and emotional time was something I have never experienced before. They cared for her like she was their own mother/grandmother! I can't thank them enough.

resp.text: Hi Diana, thanks for your kinds words.  We'd love to hear more about your positive experience.  Please call 256-629-1919 if you'd like to share more about your mother's care.

name: Fred Pearson
text: My wife was told to call the day before surgery between 1 and 3 PM to get the exact time of her surgery. This is to insure the exact time because of rescheduling. They told her 5:45 AM. We arrive at preop on time for a nurse to say you won't go to surgery til 7:45 AM because another patient had changed their mind on there procedure. This is completely unprofessional because of the way a person has to get their time in a 2 hour window the day prior. The nursing staff is great, but the schedule protocol seems to have been written for no purpose at all. They finally came to get her almost 4 hours later than the supposed stream lined schedule department said. What a joke, I wouldn't recommend this hospital to my worst enemy.

resp.text: Mr. Pearson, We're sorry you had a poor experience regarding the scheduling process.  Please know we have forwarded your comments to our surgery leadership.

name: Sara E
text: I was vomiting and having seizures, waiting in the lobby over 30min. The triage nurse saw me falling out of my chair, and SNAPPED AT ME. She didn’t help me back into the chair, she snapped at me. She was annoyed she had to ask for a room to be prepared for me.  The nurse practitioner told me there was no reason to keep me there while I was vomiting and convulsing. I asked to see another doctor, and they sent in a different nurse to discharge me. I spent 3 days at another hospital after leaving NAMC.

resp.text: North Alabama Medical Center is committed to delivering high-quality, compassionate care to everyone who walks through our doors.  Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 so we can discuss this in more detail with you. Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback.

name: Whitney Dover
text: The 5-4 stars shouldn't count when they are given by employees... state of the art buildings and equipment mean absolutely nothing if there's idiots with degrees attempting to operate them. Changed physicians just to prevent being sent to this "nice building". I am talking about a physician that I said I would use until he retired and when he did I would be devastated. I'm sorry but I'm not going to be a patient in this facility until I'm convinced of some MAJOR changes with their staff. If I could given a review without giving at least 1 star I would have. Travel to Vanderbilt, Birmingham, or  Huntsville if its something that Helen  Keller hospital can't do. Helen Keller may have an older buildings but the care provided is usually wonderful. And way more sanitary. Housekeeping comes in every patients room daily at Helen Keller. They also bring patients ice water regularly without patients having to ask and even offer snacks. NAMC, you need to get it together.

resp.text: Hi Whitney, if you wish to discuss your experience further, please reach out to our Performance Improvement department: 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: Rebecca Ballman
text: I had to go for a small very minor injury from work, which med plus would not see and had to go to the ER. I only waited in the waiting room for maybe 10-15 minutes. The wait in a exam room was a bit long, but I also understand that there were people there in worse shape than I was that needed attention first. All of the employees were very kind and personable. My experience was quite great considering the rate and the ridiculous reason I had to be there. No matter how minor, NAMC is there to help and serve the community!

resp.text: Good morning Rebecca, We are glad our ER could take care of your needs.  Thanks for the positive review and choosing NAMC for your care.

text: My father in law was admitted last night to north Alabama medical center he has not been given any IV he's been asking for water for over hour no one will help and when asked they said they are busy he was transferred from Keller last night who gave a lot of care and cared !!! about the family.my mother in law is not even allowed to be by her husband side except at set times  no one is watching him at north alabama medical center. Keller at least let his wife  watch him and be by her husband side what's the point of having the state of art hospital when the staff doesn't care about the patients or family the staff needs to learn some bed side manners and have some compassion for family and there patients if it wasn't for needed a cardiac unit I wish he would go back to Keller were they care!!!!

name: Megan Berryman
text: My Daughter had been seen at her Dr's office that Friday for issues. They told me to come back in if no better. Their weekend hours were already closed the next day so I called her on call triage nurse. She agreed i should take her to the er since she was in so much pain. We went to this emergency room because it is who our Dr's office uses so wanted to be there incase she needed to stay. Upon arrival the waiting room was completely full so i knew it would be a wait which was expected and fine. I walked to the front desk and let her know that they had faxed over information that we were coming. She then told me she may have but they hadn't looked and i was looking at atleast an hour wait if not more. The way she kept talking was to try to discourage me from stay at waiting. I told her that was fine we would wait. After waiting a while we were called back to the area behind the front desk. They sat her on the bed, the doctor walked in said she was fine pretty much and walked out. They never brought her to a room or even gave her a bracelet as a patient. They told us to wait out front and they would discharge us. They brought us back again to get some info from me and discharged us then as we were leaving they called us back to the are because they realized they had not even checked her vitals, temperature or anything! They always told me they were understaffed and the doctor was frustrated and overwhelmed at how behind they were with all the patients and if she didn't feel better I COULD COME BACK LATER. Needless to say we left and i will not be paying any kind of bill i receive and i will be contacting them today. We drove an hour away to another hospital where we were taken right back. They did vitals, an exam, lab work, ct scan, and medication and are helping us with further testing. We have been to your hospital before and while it is always understaffed (this is noticed by patients and the workers be sure to let you know that and that's why you're not being helped or getting 100% care) i have never experienced anything like we did on Saturday. I never leave reviews much less negative ones but I was speechless. I am leaving one star but if i could leave negative i would. EDITED TO SAY: I HAVE SPOKE TO SOMEONE FROM THE HOSPITAL TODAY AND THEY WERE SO HELPFUL,APOLOGETIC AND TOOK MY CONCERN SERIOUSLY.

resp.text: Hello, Please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns.  We've forwarded your email to ER and Nursing leadership.  If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078. Thank you.

text: Literally terrible service takes way to long the main doctor is very rude and doesn't give out all the information that may be needed you walk in with whatever illness and stay for 4-5 hours and only 30 minutes of that time is actually used being tested or cared for would not recommend

name: CEO at This is my Circus
text:
Frequently we get from an experience what we bring to the experience.
My husband was a patient in the ER within days of the move to the new facility. Fast, efficient , quality compassionate care is what he received.
Shortly afterwards (about 6 weeks later)he was admitted for surgery.
Everyone was very friendly, helpful, professional, and most important to me- demonstrated skill in their profession -Healthcare provider.
We didn’t come seeking a hotel experience- Snacks, unrealistic meal requests , etc...We came seeking MEDICAL CARE.
Yes, all of his comfort needs were also met.
All areas of the hospital were clean. Housekeeping came to the room DAILY.
Food service employees were very kind and helpful. Always friendly and smiling.
The rooms are so quite .
Many of his nurses have been with this company for YEARS. The doctors that work for the hospital were all amazing as well.
Wouldn’t go anywhere else.

resp.text: Good morning, Thank you for the positive review about our facility and for choosing NAMC for your care!

name: cwtrapp
text: I have been a patient, had family members be patients and I have worked here for almost 2 years. The care I have given and received by nurses, physicians, and care partners has always been phenomenal.

resp.text: It’s our privilege to serve the healthcare needs of Northwest Alabama.

name: Donna Harrison
text: Some of the hospitalist doctors pushing out patients to early. Good doctors other wise. Just problems with some the hospitalist.

name: LOUD N PROUD
text: The absolute best medical institution in the state in my opinion

name: Jeremy Patton
text: Not good.

resp.text: Jeremy, we're sorry your experience didn't meet your expectations. If you'd like to discuss your experience further, please call 256-629-1900. Thanks

name: Tyler Masur
text: The majority of the nurses here are sweet and very helpful but it is obvious that they are SEVERLY understaffed. The nurses were clearly not able to keep up because of how busy they were and I can only imagine how many patients they have each night. Great, kind-hearted staff that is poorly managed and clearly being failed by those at the upper levels.

resp.text: Hi Tyler, we are aggressively recruiting more nurses. If you know an RN interested in a position, nurses can apply online:  www.namccares.com/careers

name: Diane Gargis
text: I am currently in this hospital.  There is not 1 good thing I can say.  The service is horrible!!!!!  I waited 15 min. For my call service to be answered.  My IV was beeping driving me nuts!  And forget about getting a nurse.  I never see them and when they do come in they plop on the chair and stair at computer.  My day shift nurse was the charge nurse so I knew I was screwed.  She told me she was overwhelmed with work.  I think if that's the case a new building was a total waste of money!!!!!

name: Eric Harvey
text: they were extremely slow and if felt as if they did not care about you as a person. it felt like you were there experiment. first they did not know what the problem was so they misdiagnosed then they didn't even recommend future assistance or a referral.

resp.text: Please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns.  If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: Alvie Rodgers
text:
NAMC is a brand new hospital. Most are friendly, but too many rude nurses. Example: was on medication to urinate, call to get help to go to bathroom, 1 hour later she comes and
Complains to my wife that the alarm also rings her phone. Just go sit on one of the floors and listen to all the alarms that go off, sometimes for over and hour. My wife was on a possible fall patient. Again after waiting over an hour to be taken to the bathroom, One nurse actually pushed my wife down on the bed and raised her voice saying "Stay, Don't move". I mean really? Like a dog. I confronted her about it, she said she had to go get someone. I asked her "Did you get someone? " which I knew she didn't, she then said "I had to deal with the guy next door." I asked her "Can't you take her?" She agreed that she could have.
Another issue, my wife was I the hospital for a week, they never changed her sheets or gave her a sponge bath. I had to do it when I got there after work, or one of my family members.
After checking out, they gave my wife some new prescriptions. Said they called them in. But they did not. The next day, after two calls speaking to someone and 4 voice messages, I can't get them to call me back, or call them in.
Now my wife hates the place and so do I.

name: Neshia Pages
text: Omg I don't go if you in alot of pain. When I say slow it slow. Need to go out business.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback.  Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 so we can learn more about your concerns.

name: Delana Hicks
text: Very bad... They said hurtful things while they was spouse to take care of my mother and done some things that wasn't good

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback.  Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 so we can learn more about your concerns.

name: WMBW Love
text: Expensive, even if you have insurance. They hit me with a $344 bill out of nowhere. Now it's on my credit score. And You'd be better off diagnosing yourself at home. I had a breathing problems and they gave me coughing pills smh. So I ordered a breathing machine online and got better.

name: Allison Franks
text: Absolutely would not recommend this place. My mom was transferred here for a possible stroke. It took them 8 hours before they even ordered a CT scan which is ridiculous considering the first few hours after a stroke are vital. The neurologist stopped by for 3 minutes while my mom was sleeping and gave hardly any feedback. He didnt even announce who he was or that he was a doctor. I only found out who he was after describing him to the nurse. After being there for 24 hours a doctor has yet to stop by to give any comforting feedback. Any updates we did receive were from the nurse. Absolutely horrible service. Do not come here if you can avoid it!

name: boomer hanback
text:
The good: it's pretty. Most of the nurses seem friendly enough.
The bad: My grandfather is going on 38 hours no food, drink or his medication while waiting on a swallow test that has been ordered yet no answer as to when its scheduled. He is currently trying to eat his blanket because he thinks it's a double cheeseburger from Jack's. Unless you are bleeding out I'd reccomend anywhere else.

name: Wanda Hughes
text: My niece went last night by ambulance. She was choking on a piece of chocolate and having a panic attack. They let her sit there unable to breath by herself and gave her nothing to try and stop the waves of panic she was experiencing. We won't be back that's for sure. Would not recommend to anyone. Also DO NOT GO IF YOU OR SPOUSE HAS ANY KIND OF ARREST WARRENT. THEY WILL LET THEM KNOW YOU ARE THERE.

name: Regina Fox
text:
I don't know what's happening, but I have tried 3 times to write a review and it disappears.
My doc's were great, the staff is horrible.  My daughter came to stay with me and it was so bad she asked me if we were on Candid Camera!!!!

name: Gennie McCaig
text: Amazing staff.. all of my nurses were absolutely helpful and knowledgeable. I never felt like a burden or just someone's job. Dr. Robbins was the on call Gyn..  now my new Doc! So nice and helpful, I feel blessed to have had her during my stay. They saved my life.. thank you.

resp.text: Hi Gennie, We're glad you had a great experience.  Thanks for choosing NAMC for your care.

name: Brian Cameron
text: Took excellent care of me from the nurse's to the doctors to the receptionist. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Hi Brian, Thank you for your review. We take pride in taking excellent care of our patients.

name: Vicki Murray
text: This star is for the nurses that are really trying. My 82 year old Mother was in the E R from 4:30 pm until 2:00 the next afternoon. It’s 3:00 Saturday afternoon and she’s been told she would get a bath and clean sheets since 9:00 am. Keep saying they are understaffed. This makes me wonder if they will shortcut her meds and the other procedures she’s scheduled to have. You can be assured that no one else in my family will EVER be a patient in this hospital again. This shows the poorest of managment. With all that being said, the nurses are doing all they can

resp.text: Good morning.  Please know we take your concerns seriously. It's our understanding administration has addressed the issues with the patient.  If you wish to discuss the experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629 2078. Thank you.

name: Katie Foster
text: Terrible Hospital! My neighbor was in palliative care begging for water .. and we asked the Nurse several times if he could have water ... it took a hour for a glass of ice water to be brought to us.. then after we left we saw the nurses at the desk sitting on top of the desk playing on their phones.. awful nurses.. awful. They want the money but don’t want the work that comes with it.. she was a rude NURSE! Shouldn’t even give it one star.

resp.text: Ms. Foster, Please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns.  If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629 2078. Thank you.

text: This has got to be the worst hospital to ever go to. Go to Nashville or Birmingham since the nurses complain about there pay. Stayed in waiting room for 3 hours after 4 people came out and questioned them about it and they say they are not payed as much as Nashville TN or Birmingham AL to do there job in the ER.

resp.text: Michael, if you wish to discuss your experience further, please reach out to our Performance Improvement department: 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: Billie Smith
text: The nurses are super nice and attentive. It’s a very nice hospital but, I feel like on the first floor, they invested too much money in the all the furniture and not enough money on the hand sanitizer....

name: Sandra Stowe
text: A new hospital should not have holes in the chairs and stains in the sink. That tells me that everything is cheap. They also need a more efficient way of handling some of the medical issues.

resp.text: Good morning Sandra, Thanks for making us aware of these issues.  We hope to address all holes and stains we come across to provide a great environment and experience for our patients and visitors.

name: Rickye Frazier
text: Very clean facility, respectful staff,not to mention good doctors. I really recommend this hospital they seen and took good care of my momma .

resp.text: Rickye, Thanks for choosing NAMC for your care! We're glad you had a great experience.

name: kenneth uding
text: The staff dropped the ball a couple times on house keeping. But nurses and doctors where excellent. I was impressed and I probably learned more about how a hospital is run this time.

resp.text: Hi Kenneth, We're sorry you had a poor experience regarding the housekeeping services.  Please know we have forwarded your comments to the director of Environmental Services.  We always strive to provide excellent care, which includes a clean and sanitary environment.  We are glad the nurses and physicians were excellent in your care. Thanks for choosing NAMC.

name: Becky Jaggars
text: My mother's nurses were great especially Kim Green. Only problem we had was with Dr Murkett he is the rudest person I've ever encountered. He has a God complex and treats patients like they are the dirt under his feet. I worked in healthcare for many years and he is by far the worst Dr I have ever dealt with. He stood at the door and said everything the other Drs said didn't matter. He would not let my mother speak and everything we said he responded it didn't matter. If my mother is ever admitted back into the hospital he will not be allowed in her room.

resp.text: Becky, Thanks for making us aware of your experience with a physician at our facility.  We're glad the nursing care you received was great.

name: Janie Rohen
text: My husband and I were visiting family in florence when he began to develop chest pain. As a seasoned nurse, I unreservedly understand the wait in the Emergency Department, but what I do NOT understand are the incompetent, rude nurses. We immediately regretted choosing this hospital. I thought, "these people are going to kill him." The feeling subsided once we got to the 5th floor. Which is the ONLY reason for the 2 stars. You all can thank: Andrea who I believe was to be the manager of the floor. Ramsey who was our AM shift nurse, and her "partner in crime" as she would say, Whitley, and Shielk our PM nurse. So administrators, y'all better thank these hard workers because they are surpassing your ER.

resp.text: Hi Janie, Thanks for your feedback.  We take your concerns seriously and will pass along your comments to the ER Director as well as the Nurse Manager for the fifth floor.  We always strive to be better and appreciate the recognition for the nurses who provided care for your husband.  If you'd like to discuss this further, please contact 256-629-1919.  Thanks

name: Jonathan Lovelace
text: Er doctor was cool and seemed to listen but i plainly told the nurses and the dr i did not want opioids i just wanted 1 ambien to help me sleep through the pain they sent me with norcos and  hydroxyzine which is a horrible drug that can cause sudden death I'm glad the discharge papers have the suicide prevention hotline because waiting there for all that really made me think about it

resp.text: Hello, Please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns.  If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: bryana finney
text: It took 30 minutes to be seen at the ER and we were the only people in the waiting room. Once placed in a room each attending  nurse, tech, dr came in to assist my family member. I must say not once did I see any of them wash their hands! I moved from we’re I was in front of the sink out of the way so they could do so, but not one did. I could have swore soap and water was invented before hand sanitizer. This is hygiene one on one...

name: Jennifer Atkinson
text: My father is currently at this facility. The ER was great. They jumped right on his problems. We were admitted. While on the floor we were told not to let him get up without nursing staff. He has to use the restroom and we hit the call button. By the time they answered we already had him to the bathroom and back to the bed. Housekeeping is awful. The first night we were there my dad was really weak and off balance so when he went to the bathroom he missed the toilet. We told nursing staff what had happened and no one came to clean it up. I cleaned it the next morning with the hand sanitizer on the wall after we told them again and no one came to clean it.  As a matter of fact we have been here 5 days and the only time they have been to clean his room was when we threw a fit. They did not come in yesterday when my sister called to have someone come take the garbage out the supervisor got smart and told her she saw them come in the room on camera. We have been there 24\7 since he was admitted and that was a lie. We had to personally gather all his medical records from his doctors who do not have privileges at this hospital. Only after we started being aggressive about his care did they start acting like they care. They have lots of patient but I only have one father and I expected this facility to be better than the last. NEW FACILITY SAME OLD BULL! The head nurse on his floor is great she now comes to check on him and comes in with the dr.

name: sea_ playz
text: My mother went in to North Alabama medical center to have an arteriogram. From the time we arrived to the time we left the next day was a great experience . I want to personally thank and mention 2 nurses in the Cath lab, Jacob and Nicholas they did a great job tending to my mother. She needed a little extra care and they saw to her every need. Thank you again

resp.text: Tina, We're so glad your mother had a great experience at NAMC. Thank you for sharing your experience.  We are very proud of our Cath Lab staff and always strive to provide the highest level of care.

name: Tracy Crump
text: I had knee replacement surgery there on May 10th and I have to say every one was super nice. I feel like I got amazing care there. The nurses that took care of me on the 4th floor are great. My main 2 nurses Heather(days) and Kim(nights) were awesome!!!! I have to have my other knee done and I will not hesitate to go back to NAMC. 😎

resp.text: Hi Tracy, Thanks for choosing NAMC for your care.  We're glad you had a great experience.  We wish you well on your recovery.

name: Valerie Hines
text: Poor attitude and listening skills. My son went in to get his wet cast off. Nurses have no knowledge in how to put right kind of temporary cast since the Bone and Joint office was closed.My son has broken thumb and they tried to give him a wrist brace. It was not going to secure the broken thumb. They had wrong information in the system. Who knows where they got it from. I even told them that the Bone and Joint after hour service has given me instruction what to do and tell the ER. None of them were right and I had to correct them.  I am not a nurse but it's COMMON SENSE! Hope no one else have to go thru this like I did. They also have someone who does not speak clear English. It's person who have different accent which was hard to understand. I will be calling the director about this. I am SO DISAPPOINTED in their staffs and service. There are more to it but this is the main part.

resp.text: Valerie, please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns. We've shared your comment with our ER Director. If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078. Thank you.

name: John Works
text: This place was awful when I was in there. I may have later in the bed with blood pouring out my ears for 12 hours. I thought I was going to die. Luckily by the will of God I was able to crawl out the window and make it to my car and drive to the other hospital. DO NOT GO HERE

name: Holly Stutts
text: WORST HOSPITAL I'VE EVER BEEN TO! THEY DO NOT EVEN DESERVE 1 STAR!

resp.text: Feedback from our community, both positive and negative, is valuable to us.  Please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078 so we can learn more about your concerns.

text: I don’t care what I do in my life, I will end it all before I hate my job as much as this hospital staff. They treated my dad well when he went for a procedure, but they all act like they don’t want to be there any time i've went.

The nurses are so understaffed it's crazy!..Do the powers that be not care?  NO!

resp.text: Teresa, please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns. We've shared your comment with our ER Director. If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629-2078. Thank you.

text: If I could give less stars I absolutely would. This place is so disgusting the staff is extremely rude and snooty. I brought my 4 year old daughter in after being suggested by after hours for possibly signs of something serious when mentioned to the doctor she immediately brushed off and went and talked trash to the nurse RIGHT OUT SIDE MY ROOM! As I could hear everything. Also the result was one of the possibilities I had mentioned which was the flu!!!

name: Waynette Mcclish
text: Having to rate this a 1 star because of the day shift nurses in critical care. My dad was transferred from Helen Keller (which had awesome nurses and drs. They actually cared about the patient). The night shift nurses were pretty good; but day shift nurses are rude.  They brought my dads breakfast and set it across the room where he couldn't reach it ( he's not allowed to get up). He begged for water for almost 2 hours and didn't get any. He is supposed to be on iv fluids but they havent even started them yet. When we finally got to ho back to visit he couldn't even talk because his mouth was so dry , the nurses said the reason he didn't get any water is because they had an emergency and couldnt get to him. We asked if my mom could sit with yo give him water they won't let her stay with him. Very very rude nurses no compassion for the patients at all.

name: Cindy Smallwood
text: I have had 3 family members at this hospital since it opened and each one of those visits was horrible. Spent hours in ER. We were told there were no vacant rooms.  Waited 3 days before a doctor finally came in and told us what was going on. One family member had to have help getting to rest room after surgery, and was left there for 45 min. Finally got herself back to bed. I dont think this move was thought out very well. They should have made sure they had proper help to take on extra patient load. They are severely understaffed. If you have a family member get admitted prepare to stay if you want to insure they are seen to. They just dont have enough people there to take care of everyone. I just hope I dont have an emergency myself in the near future

name: Amanda Borden
text: Would give a zero if it was available! Daughter hit her head and we waited over three hours in a room only to ask for discharge paperwork so we could leave. Then doctor came in all snooty looking like what's wrong. I told them we are going to Helen keller after waiting this long. He didnt care...ofcourse. So no I dont recommend this place at all!! O and I forgot to mention how dead the place was. So a three hour wait seems unfair for what hospitals charge for service.

resp.text: Please know we take your comments seriously and appreciate you making us aware of your concerns.  If you wish to discuss your experience further, please contact our Performance Improvement department at 256-629 2078. Thank you.

text: Went to the ER, I was diagnosed with shingles, which was ( is) very painful. The LPN at reception desk was unfriendly, almost rude. Waited 4 hours to go back. Diagnosed by a Nurse Practitioner almost immediately, and released. I told them I preferred ECM, for their compassion.

name: Thomas Robertson
text: On Feburary 4,2019 I arrived at 345pm with a self diagnosed harna after a physical examination it was confirmed. I was discharged at 922pm with no care plan no pain management or information to contact a general surgeon. This was a complete 360 of the care my wife has received from this medical center and we both were disappointed in my care.

name: Bethany Stewart
text: WOW! I went to labor and delivery at 31 weeks with contractions. They wouldn't let my husband come back until they got me "admitted". Took them 30 minutes, then they wanted to do swabs without him around. I have been to other hospitals with early contractions with my first pregnancy. This was the first time they ever separated us. I was hurting and scared and they wouldn't allow him back there. They told me I am not allowed to drink. Then 20 minutes later they come in and said the doctor says drink a lot of water. All they did was hook me to the monitor and then tell me drink water. Contractions are normal they said. I have never heard that. We never even saw a doctor. Just the nurses. They called security on my husband because he kept asking what was taking them so long to get me admitted because he knew I was hurting and scared. I am changing doctors so I never have to go back to that hospital. It was the worst experience of my life!

name: David Mott
text: took care of me well

name: Mandi Farris
text: If I could give this hospital no stars I would. This is the most rude, unsympathetic, ignorant and unprofessional hospital I have ever seen. The nurses sit at the station eating and talking about the patients like they don’t matter. This is the 5th floor rooms 5110-5113. The red headed nurse that is huge!! She is very rude. My dad had a stroke and she told me nothing is wrong with him. I’ve been a nurse for the past 10 years and she has no idea what she is saying to ppl she don’t know. I wouldn’t bring my dead dog to this hospital if I was paid to take it. I have seen n been in a lot of hospital (working and family) this one takes the cake with the people that work there. And on top of everything the doctor was a pulmonologist trying to be a cardiologist lol that was funny. Please don’t take your loved ones here. Take them to a really hospital (UAB or DCH) best two hospitals I know in Alabama.

text: The place is new and clean that's why I gave 1 star. I had the worst experience of my life. I was racially profiled. If I had to go to the hospital I would choose one in Colbert County because I would rather die then to go back to them!!!!😣

name: Samantha Perez
text: Every review on this that is above 1-2 stars is FAKE... My boyfriend (WHO HATES TAKING MEDS FOR ANYTHING & ALWAYS WAITS TIL THE LAST MINUTE TO EVEN GO TO THE HOSPITAL BECAUSE HE HATES THEM) went here twice, both time they didn't run any test aside from a nose swab, the first time which is when they did the swab they told him he was negative for the flu but then diagnosed him with it. Later we had to take him to Shoals hospital & they found he had a SEVERE ear infection, Florence didn't even bother to check his ears/throat. The second time he went they accused him of being a junkie, DIDN'T RUN A SIGNAL TEST, had a guard watch outside his door while he was there & then diagnosed him with an upper respiratory infection. This entire hospital is A FRAUD & EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! The entire staff is UNTRAINED & UNDERQUALIFIED. Will be reporting every last one of them!

name: Justin Nixon
text: I came to the ER for sever dehydration. I’ve sat in the ER for 4 hours. It was only 3 people ahead of me. They we’re calling people back in the order that they arrived. However, a lady that got here after me by about 10-15 minutes was called back before you. Mind you, I’m the only black person in the waiting area and I’m the only person to get skipped……. Not a coincidence

name: Lisa Reisner
text: Our daughter, Leah Blankenship, had a baby here. She received excellent care from admission to discharge. Nurse Emily was such an excellent Nursery nurse, teaching us about breast feeding, bathing, comforting her, etc. Emily was very supportive and gave our new baby a thorough exam in the nursery. She showed me the bath through the nursery window. Nurse Megan was an excellent Postpartum RN on her first day here. She helped Leah with her post-op pain, etc. She was also very supportive and informative. We appreciate all the other nurses who cared for Leah and her baby. The OB and Pediatric MDs were the best!!! The room was so comfortable and Leah’s husband slept in her room. Thanks to all of you. God bless you and yours!

name: Jacinda Haines
text:
I gave this office a call seeking a second opinion about a procedure that my seven-year-old son was scheduled to have. I had some trepidation about the procedure, which was a colonoscopy to check for things like polyps, ect. I wanted to know if a proctologist could examine my son without anesthesia. They were more than helpful.

First of all, the nurse was very helpful in walking me through the steps necessary to book the appointment whether it was a referral, or a second opinion. Then, she began to ask me about the problem that my child was having. To my surprise, she handed the doctor the phone. I immediately felt as if I was being heard by the medical profession,  which is something that we have lost over time.

When the doctor picked up the phone, it was as if my son was already a patient of his. He asked me everything that was going on from the timeline to his symptoms. After listening to me, he assured me that I was on the right track with the colonoscopy.

He had every opportunity to schedule an appointment just because he could, as we were at such a vulnerable state. But he didn’t, and I respect and appreciated that. I can tell that this doctor really cares about his patients, their care, their results, their well-being, and he loves what he does!

If you watch his video, what he says lines up with what he delivered to me over a simple phone call. I can only imagine being his actual patient.

If you are looking for a proctologist, he is highly recommended!

Thank you Dr. Bornstein and you’re nursing staff!

We had my son’s colonoscopy, and everything came back well!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We are grateful to be able to deliver compassionate care for all.  Have a wonderful day! -Ascension Providence Community Manager

name: Ashley Whitfield
text: I've recently had a second proceedure with Dr. Joseph Bornstein, and, again, I am extremely grateful and pleased. He's a very compassionate doctor whose only concern, in my opinion, is the patient's overall health & well-being. He explains, in detail, EVERYTHING, and listens to your concerns about your health issues, then plans a strategy for better health. He's dynamic and his overall staff @Providence is amazing & friendly. I'm super happy that I was recommended to him and that he and his staff are really interested in each patient's wellness. If there were 10 stars to give, they'd have them all!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review! We work hard to provide high quality care. And we are committed to delivering compassionate care to the community. -Ascension Providence Community Manager

name: Joyce Saviak
text: My husband was recently diagnosed with cancer.  This is a time when you need someone who is not only skilled but compassionate.  We found Dr. Bornstein  and his staff to be all we need to face this and move forward.  He performed textbook surgery and was there to answer our questions and move us forward to the next step.  Very grateful to have found a great surgeon and a doctor who takes all the time you need to help understand what is happening.  Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave us positive feedback! Have a great day! -Providence Health System Community Manager

name: GG Nelson
text: Fantastic doctor!  He is young BUT know his medical information.  Been to two other doctors that couldn’t diagnose my problem and wanted to operate to explore.  Dr Bornstein studied my test and took a look and examined my problem and told me exactly what was wrong.  No surgery needed   I highly recommend him and if I ever need a general surgeon Dr Bornstein is mine

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback! We will share it with our leadership. -Providence Health System Community Manager

text: I was referred to Dr. Bornstein by another surgeon, best referral I've every received. He is professional, personable but most of all a very good surgeon.  His willingness to take the time to explain every aspect of my surgery left me with no questions and feeling confident in having the surgery.  I  have always found him willing to take as much time as needed to answer any questions you might have.  I am very grateful to have found such a caring and giving doctor.  I would recommend him without hesitation.

resp.text: Patricia, thank you for sharing your observations with us. Feedback helps us know what we’re doing right or where we need to improve.

I personally didn't know what to think the first time seeing him. but soon had to return and ended up needing a hemmroidextomy he was very very honest about everything as to were most doctors would sugar coat it . It scared me but I also appreciate his honesty because if he wouldn't have been I would have never been prepared for what I have had done so I thank him greatly. He's super nice but super straight to the point.

name: Rocker Properties
text: I've been doing business with this company for almost 4 years.  I receive an email every Monday asking if we have any reclaimed refrigerant for pickup.  I respond yes to the email and we never received the pick up.   My office manager calls later in the week to get a pick up, they never come.  I call to get a pick up, a week later, and they never come.  I call again this morning and I get a lecture on how we don't spend enough money with them.   Then they call the office and list the amount of money we spent with them over the last 4 years.  Completely unprofessional.   DO NOT do business with this company.  All they want to sell you is a R-22 drop-in refrigerant called 421A.  Don't do it.  It's snake oil and it doesn't work.  Trust me, we tried it.....

I would love to make these people that work here spend days waiting in a room the size of a closet so they could see what it's like.

text: Staff was friendly for the most part. Wait times were not terrible. However the doctor did nothing to explain my MRI results. Just a nerve block. Made a second appt to talk to the doctor to any other options and was told that its nerve blocks or antinflamitories. To top it off the doctor has a horrible bedside manner.  He isn't at all friendly, explains nothing, rushes through everything and is out the door leaving you more confused about your condition than before you arrived. I'll be finding a different doctor.

text: I just left this “ clinic/unsterile morgue “. They do everything but pain management! The MD tried to overrule everything my neurologist has been treating me for since February. He has no social and most importantly very few brain cells left when it comes to dealing with neuropathy. It’s a great place to go if you don’t own a swimming pool and have an addiction of having an mri done on every part of your body with no rhyme nor reason. Basically do not go there, if you happen to be in his waiting room now ,leave. You can find better treatment at planet fitness, stop by and get a hot cup of coffee and Advil on your way.

text: Dr. Thomason and his staff are always so compassionate and professional. My wait time is minimal. The facility is clean. I have chronic migraines and my occipital blocks are on point and have helped my pain tremendously.

name: Thomas Malone
text: Had a nerve block done. Was over before I knew it. Very professional people. Shout out to Tony and Charlie, baldy and whitey. Lol.

name: Robert Maddox
text:
Never be the last patient in the working day to have a nerve block at this facility . I was not given "ANY SEDATION " as I requested from the moment I arrived ahead of time until recovery staff ushered me out the back door. Initially I was given a  IV install and a nurse did provide a excellent medical evaluation of my health status and current medicines. Later, when I was  carted back for the nerve block in a very alert status, my doctor never advised  me of his presence. or his readiness to start. Within less than a minute from onset of the numbing injection, the larger needle was inserted that contains the medicine normally used for my type procedure. I was not under any sedation during this time and afterwards in the recovery room. In my 74 years on this good earth and a veteran of major operations, I have enough sense to know if I have received even the mildest form of sedation. After seeing my referring physician I told him about my patient experience at Spinecare.  I did not feel the standard of care was there at least in my case. I cannot in good conscious recommend Spinecare to anyone bases on my experience there but I am sure there are others that say "Spinecare hung the moon". Again, I feel it advisable not to be their last patient as I was closing time. This is the way I saw things there that particular day. I am sure they do good work regardless of my complaints.
Robert W Maddox   2061 cross creek Drive   Tuscaloosa  35404

resp.text: Hi Robert, we appreciate your honest review. We set a high standard for ourselves, so we are disappointed to hear that your experience with us was not a positive one. Please reach out to us at info@dchsystem.com when you can so we can address this situation directly. Thank you and have a great day.

text: The ER doctor was great but the RN left something to be desired she came in once to hand me my paperwork, she didn’t go over the paperwork. text: They starve you to death if admitted here. They always forget your tray altogether or bring you things you cant eat. For example, a person on a low sodium no caffeine diet gets ham and coffee or bacon.

name: Brian Turner
text: I had friendly,and surprisingly prompt service by the staff and doctor,my only problem is they didn't screen anyone who came in the er and at least 4 people that came in weren't wearing mask!!! They need to in force the mask wearing especially in er !!! They didn't check anyone's temperature either( I don't think this helps anyhow) over all good job!

name: Bonnie Allred
text: Don't go!!!!! I understand if your critical and can't make it any where else.  However if at all possible do not go to this hospital!  My husband spent 5 days in this hospital with Covid-19.  We needed to have his short term disability and FMLA paperwork completed for him to maintain his paycheck.  It took a week to even get someone to tell any information on the status of the paperwork.  When I did get information (3 attempts on my part) I was told the hospitalist, Dr Hargraves worked 7 days on and 7 off.  That could be the reason for the delay.  I received another followup that said the Dr. stated it would take 2 weeks to get that paperwork completed and if we needed it sooner to call our primary care Dr and have them to complete them.  I don't see that happening as the family Dr did not see my husband at all during his hospital stay.  My husband does not receive his pay until these papers are returned to his company's corporate office.  Thank you MMCN for your concern and care of our family.  I am sure we will extend the same customer/provider relations when we start getting in those medical bills.

name: Gwendolyn Horton
text: If u want to be sent home after having 2 strokes and your blood pressure being 220/160, this is the place to go.  What a joke.

name: Joseph Quinones
text: Son was born here 6/7/19 and the staff was nothing short of amazing. Excellent care, clean quiet facilities and the food was really really good; especially the chicken fingers! Almost makes me want to have another kid...almost. Seriously though, very good experience

name: Dani Frost
text: They literally starved 25 pounds off me in 1 week because i never got my food trays and the nurses don't get in a hurry trying to get you anything else.
