text: My mom went to Marshall Medical Center twice and they gave her xrays and said it was a little hazy and nothing was wrong, 4 days later here I am watching her breathe on a ventilator in the ICU. This new hospital she's in said she had pneumonia and had been sick for awhile. I told the doctor she went to the hospital twice about this and he just gave me a puzzled stare. If you have an extreme medical problem that requires serious attention go somewhere else if you have the opportunity.

name: Bevely Smith
text: No long waits when going to the ER. Great Drs and stafg.

name: Hazel Gracelin
text: This is a great place,  you have to remember these nurses and doctors are working their hardest to help each and every person. I’m proud to have a hospital this nice and convenient for where it is. Sure beats driving an hour! Anyways long story short, thank you guys! I appreciate all y’all do!

name: Jojo Eiland
text:
Had wife taken there for a possible stroke.the er Dr.was arrogant rude and apathetic.after addition was still basicly nothing done room was filthy nurses are lazy and rude techs are no
No better the doctors can't be found and will do nothing eitherwent home for a couple hours came back asked about her nurse hadn't bothered to check on her the tech got up and went to check vitals right then.told me she was asleep and had been whole time.when I looked she wasn't asleep she was trying to communicate.she pressed nurse call button someone said they would get nurse I repeated several times over the next hour including calling switch board and the shift supervisors number.nothing nurse finally showed took vitals said she was would call doc.couldnt find him when one did show he did Not him gave a shot for pain and left.i wouldn't take anybody there again if I wanted them to live!!!

name: Andy Knowles
text:
My dad and I called an ambulance to take my grandmother to this hospital (ON CHRISTMAS EVE) because she could not use her legs and they would not admit her. They took a single x-ray, "saw nothing," and said they couldn't admit her because all she had was "muscle weakness." My grandmother finally sees a specialist three weeks later and she has a fractured vertebra which she has to be fully admitted for.

Tl;dr: don't take your loved ones here if you can avoid it, very poor quality of care.

name: laura doss
text: Got a bad report from an urgent care in Madison Alabama saying besides being anemic there may be a possible blockage in my intestines. I was also severely dehydrated needed intravenous hydration administered. The doctor there literally said, "your bowels are dead, they arent working at all". So she referred me to Hospital ER for further testing and treatment that she said they just werent equipt to do. They printed my blood test results and  xray results and gave me a copy to take to Doctor at ER. She told me she wouldnt be surprised if the admitted me.  So, being tired and not wanting to wait long hours in an ER waiting room, I decided NOT to go to Huntsville or Madison Hospital (where I should have gone) and went to one closer to my home in Marshall County. I had been to Marshall Med Center North for broken ribs a few years prior and they seemed to be ok so I figured, "how much different could they be, they are all educated medical professionals right? " They had a way shorter waiting time and at first everything seemed to be going as it should. I gave the girl who did my intake my urgent care paperwork and she asked if she could hold on to it for awhile. I said no problem cause of course the Doctor needed to see it. They put me in an er room and the doctor came in and told me that even though they had the urgent care results they were gonna start over and then if they saw the same thing they would do CT and further testing. He said I was dehydrated and the hooked me up to a bag of water to hydrate me while I waited. The xray girls came to me and took three xrays of me in one position with an xray machine that looked like it was older than me (I am 48) . After my bag of water ran out the doctor came in and informed me that he saw nothing on the xray but they found a UTI with cystosis and he believed I had viral gastroenteritis. He said they werent going to admit me and made me call a ride even though they had not administered any meds to me. He wrote me a rx for an antibiotic that specifically warns not to take if you are anemic and an anti nausea med. There was no mention of why my red blood count was so terribly low, or why I hadnt  urinated but maybe twice in a month or had a solid bm in over a month. I just feel like there is more to it than a virus. Anyway I asked the doctor for an excuse for two days from work and he said he would write me one. When I got to the pharmacy (my 80 year old neighbor came and got me) i realized there was no dr excuse and they hadnt given me my urgent care results back. Called them when I got home, talked to Heath  and he assured me he would have my paperwork and excuse waiting for me at front desk in morn. Got up early, drove back to hospital (18 miles away) and no paperwork or excuse to be found. So the girl comes out hands me a freshly written excuse for only one day (I was on my second day of missing work at that moment) and tells me they misplaced my urgent care paperwork (overnight) and apologized. I told her I could probably get a reprint from urgent care, not to worry about it. Been a week today and I have been urinating more but my other conditions havent changed. I hope it wasnt a total waste of time to go to mmcn.  Cause this doesnt seem to be over quite yet.

name: BMAC Live
text:
Horrible care by an uncaring staff. I brought my grandfather to MMCN on Monday for what was suppose to be a direct admit from Lakeside Clinic. We were instructed to go to the Emergency Department waiting area by his physician. When we got there, however, we were told by the front desk staff at the ER (brunette female and male with a heavy mustache) that they “didn’t have a bed available right then.” We said that was fine and began waiting patiently. After about 15 minutes, however, the staff members came up to us again and asked if we “could just come back tomorrow because they don’t have enough nurses.” I was honestly stunned. I’ve never been to a hospital where the staff encourage you to go against a physician’s order for admission/treatment. After relaying that concern to the staff member, she left to speak to her supervisor and was able to move forward with the admission. Once we were placed on 2nd floor, however, the substandard care continued. Every single Nurse and CNA that entered the room continuously talked about how ready they were to be off shift. It was really sad to me because my grandfather was extremely sick (Afib, double pneumonia and an acute mental status change that caused confusion). He has never been so sick that his level of orientation has diminished and instead of being comforted by his “care team”, he was hearing how much they didn’t want to have to continue to care for him because they were “so ready to go home.” This is also the first sickness he has had since the passing of his wife of over 50 years which makes him feel even more vulnerable and fearful.

Currently, he has been waiting for over 24 hours for the cough medication he requested yesterday. When we asked his Nurse about it just now, her response was that “She did not have time to deal with that right now because she was trying to check another patient in.” It’s so sad that as medical professionals we have the opportunity to serve these vulnerable patient populations yet some of us don’t take that as an honor but instead act as if it is a burden.

name: Harold S
text: Quick wait time in ER to be seen.  Oversll good experience

name: Katiyanah Hollis
text:
8-1-19 I went to the ER for severe leg cramps, especially my left calf. I was crying with it. Did not mind waiting. I was never given an ultrasound in my legs nor any other testing even though a week prior I had been in ICU for heart issues. They said I was ok, gave me a muscle relaxer and sent me home.

8-2-19 I stand up from my bed and feel a pop in my left calf. I take one step and cannot breathe, cannot move, I fall to the floor. My family calls 911. I get to South and still no xrays, no ct, no ultrasound even though I try and tell them it's my leg. When blood tests come back that my heart enzymes are off, I am transferred to Birmingham, AL Princeton Hospital. I am told a blood clot in my calf dislodged and went to my heart. I got lucky and I lived through it.

Never again will I go to Marshall South or North. I would have died if not for Birmingham. Due to having not just clots in my legs but in my lungs. Never again!

name: Natily
text: This is not a place to go to if you have issues beyond needing a bandaid or birthing a baby with no complications. It's just a bunch of glorified nurses pretending to be doctors

name: Sam Tedder
text: Doctor talks over you, doesn't listen, told me livedo reticularis is "caused from anxiety"

name: Rachel Wilkes
text: Don't waste your time going here. Completely useless.

name: Kaye Salorio
text: I have, over the past several years, had the pleasure of dealing with MMCN hospital throughout several  ER visits, extended stays, surgery, you name it, with my Mom.  I know everyone has good and bad experiences with every area of hospitals. This has NEVER been the case with this hospital. I'm grateful for the way my Mom has been taken care of each & every time. You guys wouldn't want to move to Florida, would you?  Thank you for all you do!!!!

name: Mistah Z (TheTechnician)
text: Presented with really high heart rate, and low oxygen levels. Spent 2 hours in the Er(not a big deal) then I was given a chest xray which the Dr. Said was "slightly hazy " yet I've been coughing up foul smelling sputum with a fantastic bright yellow color to it. They denied me oxygen 3 times, even though my saturation was 88-91 which is low enough to warrant o2 therapy. The Dr didn't even introduce himself to me, and barely let me speak two full sentences. They eventually gave me a shot of strong antibiotics and still discharged me with 35 breaths a minute and a heart rate of 140 at rest. Ultimately they made me feel like their oxygen bottles were more important than my respiratory distress. They didn't even culture my sputum after I showed it to the nurse and Dr to see what kind of chest infection I have. But according to mr ego dr every thing was "fine" Also was denied water after asking a few times, yet I wasn't going to need surgery. So there shouldn't have been a problem with me having water. They kicked me out after 5 hours once they realized they wasn't going to get any money off me, since I have poor people insurance if you value your health, skip Marshall Medical North and go straight to Huntsville or Uab at Birmingham. My Treatment plan included some weak antibiotics and cough syrup. /sarcasm/ top notch health care.

name: Kenlon Burcham
text: Care is adequate.  Would be better if, like tonight, we did not have to deal with Nurse Ratched.  Elderly Mom deserves better than an unhelpful snob who desperately needs an attitude adjustment.

name: Miranda Hadden
text: My personal experience has been poor in multiple areas.  The support staff are usually very nice and hrlpful.  I have had issues with the physicians and professional staff on most occassions.  ER Docs, CT Imaging, Family Practice Physicians all need some improvement.

name: Haha Noope
text: If you value your life RUN.. Go to another hospital! I am having an allergic reaction to an antibiotic and they are telling me its just a "side effect" of prednisone (I have talked to a pharmacist who says that prednisone DOES NOT cause this reaction). They are going to kill people by telling them this.

name: Noodly Panda
text:
What kind of bloody idiots keeps trying to call a deaf person?  **Ring Ring** **Pass phone to my husband** Hi is this Glenn?  Oh, can we speak with him?  Hurr durr.

I'm deaf.  DEAF.  I CANNOT HEAR YOU!  This means no sound.  None.  What kind of idiotic, stupid, inane, moronic imbeciles see on file that the patient is deaf and requires an ASL interpreter while in the hospital STILL freaking tries to call a deaf person over the damn phone?

All I can say is, I've officially blocked their number from being able to call me.  I only have a cell phone for texts and IM's to begin with, calling me will do you absolutely zero good.

So note to the hospital staff:  Read my damn file you morons and if you're unsure what "deaf" means, pick up a dictionary while you're at it.

And one last thing, note to the nurses and doctors.  I CANNOT HEAR YOU WHEN YOU TALK TO ME FROM BEHIND!  And if I happen to be sleeping during my stay, it is NOT ok to just waltz up and put pain killers in the IV.  I'm sure you looked at the arm band and verified who I am, and was just verbally saying everything to me expecting me to wake up and hear you but alas, I cannot magically hear you when you speak to me in a hospital.  I know, it's crazy right?  A deaf person can't hear you talking, crazy notion.

And to that one tubby nurse guy, no I don't read freaking braille.  Look up the word deaf in a dictionary and then quit your job because a nurse that doesn't realize what the word "Deaf" means is terrifying.

name: Eddie Petry
text: I was at marshal North ER with arm pain and high B.P.  Dr Pettit along with his Nurses and tech's were very thorough. Very caring, compassionate .  I really appreciate the way they went out of their way to make sure I felt at ease. Thanks Dr Pettit and everyone . Great to have such quality in our hospital...

name: katina adams
text: My dad is getting old and sicker. We  go a lot more than normal now days to the E.R.. My dad has seizures , extremely high blood pressure, artery issues and stroke and heart attack history . They go to work on him right away. I feel safe and good when  they are done because I know he has had good treatment.  Dr Christensen is the best doctor ever.!!! He explains for my dad everything going on in a way that he can understand.( I am a nurse but he doesn't listen to me as well. I'M JUST THE DAUGHTER  ;-)    ). The nurses and lab techs are also great. Marshall north has saved my dads life by surgery three times . We have nothing bad to say about this hospital. I am very impressed with everyone and their skills.

name: JOE Montana
text: I was rushed to the ER because I was choking on a piece of chicken. Coming in and out of concessions from lack of oxygen stomach and face numb. I couldn’t stand and fell to the floor below the desk as 3 women working at the desk stared at me and said nothing as I’m trying to say I’m choking and cannot breathe. 30 seconds later they ask me to physically walk around. Started asking questions like my weight and height my address as I’m still choking and can hardly talk barely getting breathes. I finally get into a room 10 minutes later. I wait in the room for 10-15 more minutes with a piece of chicken still lodged into my esophagus. A doctor finally walks in and tells me to calm down. I’ve been choking for over 30 minutes at this point. They give me medicine to puke it out. After I finally get it up there comments were “wow, there really was something in there.” And the nurse comments “he just hocked up a hen!” Everyone’s attitude changed as they finally realized how serious the situation was. They was all peachy sweet after the realization. So 1/5 stars for when my life was in danger. And 4/5 after I was okay.

name: Kim Sawyer
text: I'm disappointed in Marshall North.  We have had some good experiences with them in the past, but the last  2 times have been very disappointing.  The first disappointment was over a year ago with my son who definitely had a concussion after a wreck he had. The care was non-existent.  They did not care.  That's a shame.  Well I decided to give them another chance with my husband yesterday.  He has early onset Alzheimer's and had a fall on our driveway.  I told them at arrival that he has Alzheimer's and I have power of attorney which I brought with me.  They didn't want my power of attorney.  I try to be discreet about his diagnosis as he is aware.  He prefers to call it a head injury or concussion. He gets extremely upset and depressed when the A word is connected to him.  Triage was fine.  The wait was non-existent.  The nurse and Dr talked to him.  He was not explaining the events correctly to them so I chimed in as is normal for us.  They kept looking at me like I'm crazy so I whispered he has Alzheimer's to the nurse.  Do these medical professionals not understand what that means?  There are varying stages of Alzheimer's but my husband's is mid to late.  He can't write, he can't drive and has not driven for almost 2 years,   he can't retell any event accurately,  he can't fix a sandwich,  there are so many things he can't do that he once did.  To look at him,  people say he looks normal.  His obsession is working out so he's fit.  I guess they thought I was crazy or controlling,  I don't know what they thought.  But they were rude.  I'm with him 24/7 as his caretaker. This would be like ignoring the mother of a child.  In his mind,  he is a child.  Anyhow I had to tell them many times he has Alzheimer's.  They just continued talking to him,  he kept looking to me.  His hand was covered in blood,  his head was bloody where he hit the driveway.  They did do a CT  scan,  I guess???  They did an x ray of his ribs.  They did not clean up his wounds to check the damage.  The nurse did put a steri strip on the brow/ temple cut but did not clean it first.  He put an antiseptic but I do believe cleaning the wound should have been the first step.  This wound later popped open with the swelling.  ( WE did ice it, but it did swell)  I cleaned his hand up and it appears to have debris embedded; nothing big but I could have used some help considering his mental condition and he is bigger than me.  I was mainly concerned about the head injury.  He hit his head on the concrete.... hello?!  That is how the biggest onset of symptoms began 2 years ago when he fell from our roof.  The doctor did not discuss the CT scan and walked off when I told him I had a question.  Not professional at all and highly upsetting to me as his caregiver.  I am responsible for him.  I need to know.  The nurse discussed discharge instructions with him, not me.  Not cool at all.   He has Alzheimer's, he is not going to remember.   I was upset,  they did not care.  I told them they were rude.  I have been married to this man for almost 29 years and his Alzheimer's caregiver for 2 years.  I was told congratulations and sorry I had a bad experience.  I don't appreciate the snarkiness.  It is disrespectful and highly unprofessional.  Are you not in the business of caring for people?   I really wanted to make sure his brain was not damaged.  I still don't know.  Maybe to them it doesn't matter,  I don't know.  He seems to be acting "normal" for him but I will have to get Marshall North to send records to his neurologist to get pace of mind.  I'm not going to give the names of the doctor or nurse but I do hope they exhibit more care with people on a regular basis and for heaven's sake,  clean up the wounds so they can be evaluated properly. That is common sense.

name: Chris Gilbert
text: Really great and caring hosiptal.  I see some bad reviews but they cant cure every problem.  I stayed 11 days about 5 weeks ago and would return in the future for any problems thx so much for the caring staff at this hosiptial ✔✔✔✔✔

name: No Name
text: Wowl, aweful service. Wouldn't give my son, with a severe migraine a room where it was quiet. People out in waiting room with 10 kids running around yelling and their parents not making them mind. wow couldnt even give my marine son thatll represent our country a quiet room. what a dump of a hospital! i wont be back. no common sense or respect here, beyond disappointed! no stars for yall, 0 rating

name: deranda ruiz
text: Wait time was awful and always is. There was no one else in the waiting room but still had to wait 20 mins to get back but once back it was great. We've had really bad previous visits. My husband has been in and out of the hospital since 2010 with chronic pancreatitis. In December 2010 I brought him to the er for stomach pains they ran all the test and sent him home. Normally when he has a flare up he stays for 3 days to a week. 3 days later he ended up having to go back to the er this time they emitted him. I came back the next day to find his room empty. I went to the desk to find out where he was which they replied he's been moved to ICU. I got no phone call nothing. When I reached him he was breathing very heavily and they had him sedated. The dr told me that they were going to put him on a ventilator to help him breath that his body was shutting down. Later that day they told us there was nothing they could do at this hospital for him we had him transferred to UAB. There are some nurses and Drs that are great then there are some that aren't. I know that's with every hospital but there just seems to be more bad than good in this case.

name: Tracy Edwards
text: The Nurses and Dr's treated not just my son who was sick with his heart rate 32! Every Dr,Nurse,CNA,Phlebotomist.X=Ray Technician,even the cleaning  people mopping and sweeping the rooms EVERY SINGLE SOUL we had contact with treated my son on the spot if an alarm went off his nurse was rite there. I've ALL WAY'S USED RMC OR STRINGFELLOW OR CARROLLTON ER's because of where I lived! This is sad to say but out of my 39 yrs experience with the Dr's and Hospitals in the calhoun Al and Carroll Ga area have NEVER HAD A DR NURSE NO ONE EVER stop everything and take 15-20mins with the patient and family to go over each and EVERY TEST Explaining in so much detail but yet in a language we that do not have alot of Medical knowledge will understand. Review Marshall Medical Center North at 8000 Alabama 69, Guntersville, AL 35976 I was very impressed in how the dr went ahead and had EVERY TEST my son needed done rite there in the ER they even had to call in someone to do a test that is NORMALLY ONLY done Monday-Friday! I WANT TO THANK EACH AND EVERY PERSON DR NURSE ETC. I sure hope we don't have a reason to return to any ER again anytime soon but if we did there would be no doubt we will NEVER USE ANOTHER ER! The Nurses came in every 2-3 mins checking on him me every family member was allowed to stay with him and they made sure I was beside him at all times!! Thank You Review Marshall Medical Center north

name: Anna Madaris
text: THIS HOSPITAL IS THE MOST SORRIEST HOSPITAL THEY LET MY DAD ALMOST LAY UP AND DIE SO WE WENT TO GUNTERSVILLE AND THEY SAVED HIS LIFE! THIS HOSPITAL IS NO GOOD! DONT GO HERE

name: Heather Nailer
text: I brought my husband to the er couldn’t stand up on his on and he explained this to the two young ladies doing the X-ray they were very unprofessional very rude wouldn’t help him in any way to get up or back down from the X-ray table this was the night shift X-ray techs April 1 2019

name: Windale Roberts
text: This will be the last time we will ever come to the place.

name: Sonya Buchanan
text: TERRIBLE. WORST OF THE WORST.

name: amber wright
text: My mother went to ER she had sepsis shock it was bad. They knew it was real bad . The doctor and nurses kicked us out of the room and told us she was being moved to ICU we could visit her then. As we waited for visiting hours we heard code blue on the intercom. It was my mother they revived her but she was sedated later that day she passed I never got to tell her I loved her or got to speak to her before she passed this stays with me every day.

name: Candy Atchley
text: I'll never be back.

name: Aaron Rodriguez
text: Avoid this place at all cost.  I went in with symptoms of chest pains, painful joints, dizziness, not being able to stand up, and have trouble breathing. Took for ever to be seen. They took blood and released me and told me they would call in 2 days when my blood culture came back.

name: Jackie Thomas Rice
text: Genuine care for their patients

name: Ziptiemotorsports
text: Do not use this hospital or should I say dog doctor I requested them to test my daughter of or nose bleeds and throwing up well long story short they said she had a virus we took her to a different doctor who actually tested her she had mrsa this place is a joke and will be hearing from a lawyer soon

name: Autumn Hankins
text: Terrible place for an emergency.

name: Gail Mitchell
text: 5 hour wait, unreal...

name: Yudi BT
text:
(Translated by Google) Wkwkckkk coy far away ...

(Original)
Jauh sekali coy wkwkckkk...

name: Janice Simms
text: Noland Hospital in Montgomery, AL is the Worst place to send your love one. This is a warning!!! I recently lost my mother due to covid-19 complications and poor care/medical treatment. Upon arrival to Noland, my mother was doing well. She came to this facility because she was told that she needed to come in order to be weaned off the ventilator. Within 3 days, her health decreased tremendously. The nurses didn’t close monitor her blood pressure, did not turn her every 2 hours as required (the bed sores worsened), and  they lacked knowledge of their job. They weren’t familiar with her previous chart from Baptist East Hospital. THE FACILITY (NOLAND) IS UNKEPT. THE ROOMS AREN’T SANITIZED LIKE THEY SHOULD BE. My Mom ended up with staph infection due to the filthiness of the nurses and facility. One infection lead to another. Day or night shift nurses did not take the time to read and become familiar with her previous health conditions. All of them have really bad attitudes.  They did not do a blood culture for days to see if my mother had infection or not. The team of doctors that works for them are HORRIBLE!!! Especially Dr. Patel. He has very poor bedside manners. None of them has compassion. My Mom passed due to septic shock. Which is a complication due to covid but it wouldn’t have gotten to this point (septic shock) if they had only took blood cultures to possibly treat the infection before it got out of hand. It’s so much more!!! If you truly love your family, spouse, etc. DO NOT TAKE THEM TO NOLAND.

name: B Reave
text:
Some of the nurses are wonderful. They really are loving, caring people. But there are a few of them that leave A LOT to be desired. They are rude, uncaring and all around mean. My husband was not able to get up on his own. When he would call for help, either they would take forever to come to his room or they wouldn’t show up at all. When they would, it was with a horrible manner. This place also needs some serious updating. It was clean enough, but very run down. My advice, make sure that you are certain your loved ones nurse is one of the nice ones. If not, you better be sure someone is there to help the patient. Because the horrible couple  of nurses this place employs CERTAINLY will not. They need to fire the ones who are so mean. They would be MUCH better off.
PS. If Beverly is your or your loved ones nurse, BEWARE. She is the rudest person I have ever encountered. How she has managed to keep her job is beyond me.

name: the dolphin
text: Were back again. My loved one had his third resperatory arrest in 5 years. Read my review from the past year below. It still applies. I know that NOLAND read my last review since I discussed it with numerous staff including the administrator. They made sure this time my loved one got no bed sore. That may be due in part to their having replaced all the old beds with brand new bariatric beds. They made sure my loved one got his baths regularly this time and that I do think made a world of difference. All in all this time arround while more serious in some ways things went better than last time. Again this is your only option in Montgomery, Al. You should read my past review. Pretty much everything I said back then still applies although I will say that they have improved quality of care noticably. My sister is a labaratory tech at Prattville Baptist and visted with me many times. She spends time talking to the nurses about the information in the charts to include his tests and chemicle levels etc... My sister understands the scientific and medical side of things, so I can say nurses at NOLAND know their stuff; as do the resperatory techs. I would not pay attention to some one star review suggesting otherwise; neither would I be able to point a finger at anyone at NOLAND and describe them as cold blooded and heartless as was mentioned in one of the reviews. There is one nurse I have called Nurse Rathcet a few times, but I do so more out of fun and jest. Nothing she ever did rose to the level that made me think to complain. I have had in excess of six months over two seperate hospitalizations to make my assessment and most of the staff that were there the first time were still there the second time more than a year later. The one star reviews are simply not true.

name: Truff Hurts
text: i wouldnt send my dog to noland.lazy cold hearted staff...and the charge nurses are heartless and lazy.nurses have no knowledge of patients charts..nurses come to work looking sloppy in dirty white coats.there were only 2 great nurses working that showed compassion and knowledge and those two people are clearly there to help and not just collect a check

name: Ray Nelson
text: Rooms are clean through the week staff is ok... during weekends they just sedate the patients so they don't have to be bothered

name: hermes trismigistus
text: Clean facility. Only two of the many members of the staff had serious attitude problems, but my complaints were addressed properly when I stood up to them and went over their head. Some of the staff are great; and the rest are all pretty decent people. You have 2 nurses and 2 respiratory therapists in addition to a charge nurse taking care of up to 36 patients on any given shift. There are a few other assistants to suppliment them. On occasion I felt they were under staffed for the number of patients and the amount of attention each one needs. This becomes a big problem when a patient goes critical and requires a whole team. There really should be a doctor on the floor 24/7, but there is not. One of the more uncomfortable issues I had to deal with is how the doctor to patient-family relationship is non existent. A number of doctors take turns rotating and call themselves Hospitalists. You will barely get to know who they are unless you live there. They make their rounds; write the orders; and then disappear. I got the distinct feeling they want to have as little to do with the patients as they can get away with, but that is not just them. It appears to be the trend everywhere. Not to say the doctors will not do their best to address your questions and issues when you do get to see them, but I have to say I always felt like I was being hurried by them which makes it easy to get flustered into forgetting to mention, or ask something important. The most serious issue was the stage 4  bed sore my loved one contracted during his stay at Noland. They were not turning my loved one over, nor were they cleaning the wound everyday like they should have done. I did not realise how bad it was until it got infected and smelled up the whole floor. They tried to tell me the smell was normal. I don't think so. That was when I put my foot down, but by then the damage was done. Even after the doctor wrote orders to change the dressings every day they were missing days. The staff did not take care of the bed sore the way they should have. Best advice I can offer you is to have a family member pretty much live in the room with your loved one. They have a fold out bed and an easy chair to use for that purpose and it is allowed. That is the main reason I give it 3 star thumbs up rating. You will not get a 4-5 star facility unless you are wealthy and connected. Not sure there even is another choice in Montgomery besides Noland anyway.The cable TV service is adequate. The cafeteria is nice and the prices are not outragious, but they are not cheap either. It was a scary 50 day experience for me, but my loved one made it despite a few close calls. Two of them because my loved one was not restrained. If the staff says your loved one needs to be restrained LISTEN TO THEM. There is a very good reason for it. This place is serious business peeps. Your loved one would not be in this facility if their condition were not serious. Be vigilent and most importantly try to drop in to visit (inspect) your loved one at least two to three times a day if you can't arrange for someone to stay 24/7. I was only able to spend on average 5 hours a day total and I got myself pretty stressed out and exhausted coming and going. I am glad that I learned to interpret the important readouts on the monitors and looked at them often. Beware your loved ones CO2 level building up when they come off the ventalator and progress to the collar. Watch that oxygen concentration readout on the monitor. It may be your eyes that save their life by sounding the alarm and getting them back on the ventalator in time. Were it not for me arriving one day at just the right time my loved one very well may not have made it since the staff had dropped the ball and were oblivious to the seriousness of the emergency until I walked into the room and immediately sounded the alarm. I recall the night two patients passed away one after the other despite the staff's best efforts. Forget trying to get a staff member to come to your room when that is going down. Visting hours are 24/7.

name: Ze Cyanious
text: Me and my aunt went to visit my grandpa today or tried to cause he is inpatient, the lady at the ER area denied us when this morning my two aunts and grandma was allowed up there. My aunt was gonna be able to visit, but I couldn't, but I cannot be by myself due to disability I have which is Autism. It is against Covid-19 hospital law to deny a disabled person's caretaker or take them away from caregiver. Hopefully you take this into account. Thanks.

name: Kevin McCall
text: Overall great experience! ER wait was long but it was crowded. Dr. Cole the ED physician and Dr. Beard the cardiologist were both AMAZING. The hospital did an awesome job at recruiting these two talented young physicians.

resp.text: Hi Kevin. Thank you for taking the time to review your visit and recognizing Dr. Cole and Dr. Beard. We agree they are amazing!

name: Rachel Lacroix
text: They get 1 star because it wouldn't let me do 0...worst hospital I've ever been to...they are slow...lazy...the staff sits around talking and goofing off....left us in the room for hours...I had to go to the desk to ask all questions they didn't check on us or anything. I'd sit at home and die before I came here again...and don't write a response talking about how you care blah blah blah...I only read 1 good review on this hospital...it's horrible...close the hell down

name: Kim Paige
text: Worst experience I’ve ever had. Got into a car accident and broke my heel. When I arrived at the hospital I was in so much pain I was screaming and in tears. They never gave me anything for the pain and told me “there’s no magic medicine that will make the pain stop.” After they told me the X-rays showed my foot was “just sprained” one of the male nurses forcefully shoved my foot into a boot while I was screaming for him to stop the whole time. They sent me home with some prescriptions that I couldn’t get filled until the morning so I was in pain all night. I went to another doctors office and got more X-rays just for them to tell me my heel is fractured. Luckily I won’t have to have surgery because after the 2 weeks I’ve spent in bed it’s showing it’s heeling but I’ll be in bed for another month at least. Do not trust their opinions and I would advise anyone who had to go here for X-rays to get second opinions from other doctors. I’m glad I took the advice of others to stay in bed and not try to walk on my foot until I got a second opinion because it could have caused more damage to my heel if I had.

resp.text: Hello Kim. Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations and have shared your concerns with our hospital administration team and clinical leadership. We strive to provide quality care to all patients, so we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. If you would like to give us more feedback, please reach out to Jeremy Glassco, our ER Director, at 256-997-2411. Again, we appreciate you and your input and will strive to do better in the future.

name: Madison Goodwin
text: I honestly wish I could put 0 stars but that’s not a option. I sat for long time in a lot of pain and didn’t hear anything from anyone. Worst Emergency room EVER! Please don’t waste your time, it’s extremely slow. I just left without being seen.

name: glenda hutson
text: We we’re for 6 1/2 hours.  When we arrived there was only 2 people before us.  My husband could not talk so I had to go to get he waiting room.  My husband could not speak or breath yet we wait led there for 4 1/2 hours for him to go to the back.  The registering  staff on the 2nd shift we’re very rude.  They did absolutely nothing to help him except need to go to the VA hospital which is over a 100 miles away. I will never go there again, I rather die and home.

resp.text: Hello Glenda. Thanks so much for your feedback. We are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations and have shared your concerns with our hospital administration team and clinical leadership. We do strive to provide quality care to all patients so we do appreciate your bringing this to our attention. If you would like to give us more feedback, please reach out to Jeremy Glassco our ER Director at 256-997-2411. Again, we really do appreciate you and your input and will strive to do better in the future.

name: Heather Hallmark
text: Nursing staff was nice, but the billing department is quite a pain to put it simply.

name: Kimberly Sinns
text: The only reason I’m giving 1 star is because I couldn’t leave a zero star review. I got into a car accident and had a severe ankle sprain. First off they would not give me anything for the pain while I was in the ER and left that night having to wait until the next morning to fill my prescriptions so I was in pain all night. While I was in the ER a male nurse came in to put my foot into a boot and while I was screaming and pleading for him to stop he would not stop trying to forcefully shove my foot into the boot. When he finally finished I felt like my foot had been sprained all over again. After that I literally tried to roll myself out of that hospital in tears because I was in so much pain and I couldn’t call my parents to get me out of there because my phone had died and they wouldn’t let me call my parents from one of the hospital phones. After being left in the chair not able to leave the room because i couldn’t open the door open for a while the guy finally came back in and rolled me out. We sat outside in the cold while I had to wait for another nurse to find my parents in the parking lot. By the time we left I was still crying in pain and just wanted to pass out. I am going to another doctors office to get more X-rays done and get more advice on what to do to help it heal because they didn’t explain anything to me. They just told me it was severely sprained, forced my foot into a boot and rolled me out. I hate this hospital and will always hate this hospital! Oh and this is just from one visit, there have been other visits (I’ve had to bring my grandmother here a few times for strokes) where the staff is just rude and take their time getting to you even if it a scary emergency! They send my grandmother home one time after they took a catheter out of her after surgery and we had to go to Memorial in Chattanooga because Dekalb Regional sent her home with an internal bleed. And most of the time when you go into the ER for something unrelated to a UTI they tell you you have a UTI and send you home without you even know what’s wrong with you! The worst part is I am a grown woman and have never felt so degraded or treated like a child in my life! I felt so helpless.

name: Lisa Bailey
text:
They are very overwhelmed i think right now bc if covid.
But they are all doing the best they can.
They helped me n I just wanted to say thank you!

resp.text: Hello Lisa. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your visit. We want to say thank you for choosing us for your care. We put a high priority on the customer experience and patient satisfaction, and your review reaffirms the hard work we put in every day.

name: hali mae
text: They are so slow I came in with a temperature of 103 and they kept calling people who came in after me back. I have a sore throat and a headache. Worse hospital besides gadsden.

resp.text: Hi Hali. First, thank you for coming to us and for reaching out. We are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations at the ER. Our goal is to have all patients seen by a clinical professional in 30 minutes or less, but sometimes the acuity of patients coming in or the volume of patients we are seeing doesn’t allow us to maintain that goal. We do apologize for your wait. We have shared your concern with our ER team but if you want to give more feedback, please reach out to Jeremy Glassco our ER Director at 256-997-2411. Again, thanks for the feedback, and we will keep working hard to provide quality care in a timely manner in our ER.

name: R H
text: Took my Fiancé there with Covid.  Her 02 level was 88-89.  They took her in their ER. Ran blood tests and xrays. Said she had pneumonia in both lungs and a UTI. Gave her steroids, antibiotics, and liquids and sent her home with 5 prescriptions. 2 days later her 02 dropped down in 70’s. Took her to scottsboro where they admitted her. In serious condition in special care unit. Do your research and pick a health care facility that will give you the care you should receive. We will NEVER go back there.

name: Beate Russell
text: Staff at Registration is incompetent. Nurses have great attitudes, but supplies are terrible in case you need an iv. They use very big needles and don't numb the area. The administrator is......

name: Lizzie Testa
text: The doctors and nurses have poor service. I took my son here at 1 in the morning and we just sat there until 4:00 that morning and I went up to the desk and the nurses and doctors were just sitting their cussing a lot and then they turn around and say oh what do you need. I then asked for the discharge papers so I could take him to another hospital then they came in right after and gave me his prescription and paper work so they are really lousy at their jobs.

name: GREGORY BRADLEY
text: this hospital has very mean doctors and nurses and we will never ever use them again and i will never let my girlfriend/wife ever use them again either they are suchs they don't know how to treat their people to make them feel better i wish this hospital never came about this hospital just needs to shut and luck its doors for good

name: Wendy Robertson
text: These people are Awesome. Went to emergency room with head laceration due to a fall. They kept me over night in ICU for observation. At the time I had nothing. No job, nothing. These guys not only operate in the black but they are affiliated with charity organizations which covered 96% of my expenses.  Some of the best trained professionals! Both in administration and in the operating room.

name: KLG
text: Negligent. I was hit in a car accident and the ambulance took me here. They discharged me the following day, but about 8 hours after I left I got a phone call saying doctors missed the x ray and MRI that clearly showed blood in my abdomen from a spleen laceration. How could all those medical “professionals” miss something so obvious? I was hospitalized in Chattanooga for over a week after that.

name: Cristy Guffey
text: Would refer my dog here I been here for over 2 hours and in back for hour in room and they still havent checked on me yet or dr hasnt came in at all

name: Josh Douglas
text: Went to the ER for stomach pains and got put into a CT scan the CT scan dye had an allergic reaction to it took the nurse almost 30 to 40 minutes to come help me my throat and tongue started to swell shut just to find out that the nurse call button was turned off at the nurses station I could have died in that hospital poor treatment of their patients

resp.text: Hello Josh. Thank you  for your feedback. We are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations. We do strive to provide quality care to all patients so if you would like to give us further feedback, please reach out to Jeremy Glassco, our ER Director, at 256-997-2411. Again, we really do appreciate you and your input and hope to do better in the future.

name: Timmy Hooper
text: The staff are always rude. They give you a fake smile. They are not helpful at all. The admin stay on their phones or talking to one another instead of helping the patients waiting. I think some have done this job they are miserable and therefore make you miserable by being there in their presence.  I highly recommend going to another hospital if you can. That's my honest opinion and I've been here numerous times and same treatment.

name: Jennifer Campbell
text: I am rather new to the area and was very apprehensive about my surgery and stay at this hospital. Several people have told me it was a bad hospital but with no real examples. Eleven days post surgery and I have nothing but good things to say. Dr Weemes, the nurses and staff on the womans floor were all great and took care of my every need.

name: Madison Hughes
text: All they do is put you on drugs or send you home with more problems.  I’ve gone there multiple times and it was just money waisted.

name: Frank Dean
text: My wife sat out there in the emergency waiting room with stomach pain for 3 hours before even being seen. Them saying they need to wait on more nurses to come in. I will never go back to this hospital again unless I need a band-aid. That's all that y'all are good for I guess.

resp.text: Frank - We are sorry you weren't pleased with your experience. We would be happy to speak to you or your wife if you would like to discuss your concerns. Please call the Director of the Emergency Department, Amy St Clair at 256-997-2411.

name: Donna Knight
text: I was recently a patient in the radiology department for a MRI with arthrogram. Dr. Mill's was very compassionate and did a fabulous job with the joint injection. Kathy, Alisha, and Josh went above and beyond to make my procedure a great experience! so glad we have such a great place in our town.

name: Chris Conde
text: Currently still sitting in the E.R. waiting room. It has been close to 4 hours. To top it all off the person that is supposed to be seen is my 2 month old daughter. I understand triage and priority, but this is ridiculous. A 4 hour wait time for an E.R. that isnt even that busy is insane. By far the worst hospital I've ever been to.

name: dbsimona
text: I took my mother here due to a staff infection, they prescribed her the very things she had listed as allergic to, so I had to take her back.  I brought in my girlfriend with a high fever and screaming in pain, they had us wait in the lobby for an hour!  Only to tell her that she had a UTI, the next day I took her else where and we were told that she had gallstones.  That doctor suggested we take her back to Dekalb Regional to schedule surgery, they won't do it without $1,500 up front.  Your health is not important to these people only your money.  If you have to risk going to Gadsden, Huntsville, or Chattanooga, you won't be turned away by those with proper ethics and education.

name: Tara Bethune
text: My husband recently had an upper scope by Dr. Thompson. The staff and Dr was wonderful. Norma O'shields was his nurse and she did an awesome job!

name: Tricia Furby
text: This place is horrible.  The ER check in clerk had my paperwork mixed up with someone else’s...doctors response oh no.   Plus the nurses are so rude.  For now on I will be going to a military installation.

name: Dale Carver
text:
I got lucky!& found this Hospital in Fort Payne.
& they ARE the BEST! **E.R. was packed & a lot of folks that NEEDED Help & care
They Patched me up & got me a Surgeon to rebuild what I shattered. & they were Super Nice, to me. *even when I was NOT
Thanks, Again! FPMH! Keep up the GOoD works! 🤠

name: Christy McGuire
text:
My child suffered an injury while our family was camping several weeks ago. I was nervous about using this facility, but my husband decided it was the right choice, and I am so glad. The ER staff quickly took and sent x-rays to the orthopedic doctor, who came in especially for our child. He called in the OR staff, and addressed the injury.

All of the staff from the receptionist, to the nurses, to the anesthetist, to the surgeon had excellent clinical skills and were exceptionally personable. The entire staff was above and beyond helpful, even though several of them had given up part of their Saturday off to help us. You don't get this kind of personal, caring attention at a big city hospital.

We are doing follow up in our home town, and the injury is healing perfectly, thanks to the timely and professional care.

name: Randy Reed
text: Will drive to Rome next time! Floyd or Redmond! Highly not recommended!

name: Louis Germain
text:
My mother went in for a procedure her doctor is doctor Cole. He is great.  He will stay with you and answer questions as long as you ask them.  When in ICU her nurse was Robert. Could not ask for a more caring person.  I am very greatful for him.  I will be going back to thank him in person.
so far nothing but great things to say about the staff.

name: Gary Mellick
text: Great hospital friendly staff.

name: Steven Simmons
text: Friendly & sweet staff. Everyone  did a wonderful job helping my wife after she had reactions to everything given her for gallbladder surgery back in November at Thanksgiving . Job well  done & my wife is doing better.

name: Anthony Brown
text: Went to get an MRI, and they where very nice and sweet!

name: Dora Tucker
text: I have had surgeries I have had different kinds of a test I have been treated with the most at right respect I would highly recommend the DeKalb  regional medical center to anyone

name: james sandmeier
text: Excellent service & care. Amazing staff and doctors.

name: Jan Short
text: I went to the hospital with blood coming out my nose and mouth. The doctor suggested that I gently lay my finger on the side of my nose and it would stop bleeding. I was holding a glass with paper towels and blood clots I have been spitting out. He claimed he didn't see any bleeding and sent me home. They did nothing to help me!

name: samantha Perrydore
text:
The Emergency Department!
The staff at DRMC ED work hard to provide prompt, thorough care with a compassionate, caring approach. Tonight we had to seek care for our daughter who was very apprehensive and fearful.
Everyone from triage to discharge went above and beyond to help her feel comfortable and safe. She especially loved the special “bracelet” Cathy made her after the blood draw was over.
Thank you to all who worked hard to make the experience great! Jesar, Melanie, Cathy, Sandra, and Dr. Crystal did an outstanding job with a little girl who won’t forget the kindness she was shown tonight.
The ED staff at DRMC work hard to ensure there is optimal medical care available everyday in our own backyard. Thank you for all you do!!!!

name: Nicholas Freeman
text: Just left ER. Everyone was very friendly and nice. I was in and out in no time. Thank you to everyone that helped with me in ER visit.

name: Eric Jennings
text: Worst of the worst

resp.text: Hello Eric. Thanks for reaching out to us. We are so sorry you weren’t happy with your recent experience at our hospital. Our teams take pride in our work and hearing about your experience is concerning. If you would like to give us more input, please reach out to Candra Roberts our Patient Experience Coordinator at 256-997-2308. Again, we really do appreciate you and hope to do better in the future.

name: Wyn Morgan
text: Quadruple bypass 4 years ago.  Presented tonight with a possible stroke (have 9 tias) after a 2 1/2 hour wait I still have not been seen.  This place stinks!  Would be a nice place for a hospital.

name: patrick cooley
text: Dekalb regional is by far the worst hoapital/E.R. facility that I have ever been too. They will straight up let you suffer and die if you don't have enough money/insurance to pay them because they a privately owned facility. They need to be shut down period. Aren't they suppose to help the patient first besides worrying about how much money you have? If you need medical attention in northeast alabama, go to Huntsville Hospital. They treat you like family.

name: max bruce
text: The people make this hospital a wonderful place to go for acute healthcare.

name: Lora Ashley Jones
text:
I hate to be like this, I do, but this all needs said.
I want to start by saying, I don't go to the ER, and my husband doesn't go to the ER, unless we feel like something is actually wrong. Currently my husband has no insurance. They see he's been here a few times and treat us both like a joke.
I can name one good experience out of the ER. The fact that they can somewhat give IV fluids from a bag without being rude, because I was dehydrated during my pregnancy.
When I was two, I had a break of C1-3 in my neck. My parents took me to the ER here. They didn't see the break, and it wasn't caught until 2 weeks later at Isbell, where I had to be transferred to Birmingham for emergency surgery. You'd think something would change in 18 years but evidently not.
Today, we've been here since about 5:45, and it's 9:00. My husband has been having back pain and numbness in his right leg, and we have been here a ridiculous amount of time. It doesn't take this long to read an X-Ray.
Mind you, upon arrival, there was a woman in the waiting room gasping for breath. They didn't take her back until she was unconscious, and even then, the people in the waiting room had to beg the woman at the desk to call a damn nurse.
That's just from TODAY. We have a list a mile long on why you shouldn't take your family to DeKalb Regional Slaughter House.

name: Kelley Wood
text: Billing is extremely messed up and rude!!!!!!

name: Adam Mahaffey
text: Very rude nurses doctors aren’t doing anything to make the patients feel better I went in with the flu on a Wednesday and was diagnosed with the flu they told me if the symptoms got worse to come back well I go back on a Friday cause the medication I was prescribed made me have a reaction and they told me there was nothing they could do worse service I have ever experienced

name: Jason Rice
text: I had an echo, stress test, and PFT. Could not ask for better service. Everyone was friendly and the facility was very clean.

name: Nicholas Hunt
text: Went to E.R. for kidney stone pain. Not too bad for emergency but unbearable pain. No one in waiting room, and made me wait 2 hours to get in while screaming and vomiting until I begged them to let me in and they had bad attitude. When I got room there was no one in E.R. an 20 nurses and a doctor waited additional hour for pain meds with them complaining about how they said how do I know I have a kidney stone? Ive have 29 in total I know what they feel like. They were so rude then they never checked on me ever.

name: Stacy Smith
text: Poor ER who puts someone with lower back injury in a hard chair. Doctors no idea what there doing this Hospital is nothing but a joke owner needs to step 8n and make some needed changes.

name: Nik Cee
text: Worst hospital experience EVER!! Wait times are ridiculous, some of the staff acts as if I are a burden, ER is disgusting! Would rather drive an hour or more to a different hospital!!

name: Phyllis Kilgore
text:
My fiance' fell fri.Feb.23rd I called a ambulance ,he had been sick so they checked him for flu and pneumonia which was negative, he kept telling them his knee and foot hurt,his knee was bleeding.
They would not listen,his foot started swelling and turned real red..I took him to the doctor on mon.he sent him to hospital for xrays.Dr.Crystal was dr.on call.changed over to Dr Kole came on and dismissed him.well his foot is fractured in 2 places..So beware.theres many complaints I could make but this is the latest.They need better drs.and that cares about the patients and their needs..I guess I will have to start going back to Gadsden.but I have been sick and didn't feel like driving down there.as far as the hospital they was very good to me when I was in there.but ER stinks.and they are so slow.
Update..,.the bone  on the inside  of his knee was also broken..his has had alot of problems because of this and alot of medical bills.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback and we are sorry your expectations were not met. Please contact our Administration Office at 256-997-2145 if you would like to discuss your experience. We appreciate your taking the time to give us your input.

name: Derek Stiefel
text: Wife went in pregnant told them she was bleeding. They only ran blood work told her that her hormones were too low to be pregnant. She miscarried at our house later that night.

name: Leighann Canzano
text: Th worst place ever I do not care if I'm dying I will not be seen here ever again pls if u can help it go some place else....Worst staff ever except with th exception of about 2 of my nurses one in icu an th other on th second floor ...This place must get paid to watch u die or suffer...

name: Beverly Dean
text: Sent me home from hospital after 4 days. Didn't know what was wrong. Still running fever m

name: Scott Hudgins
text: took 4 hours to get called to the back...

name: Angie Marshall
text: Do not care to go to this hospital

name: Elena Carter (Dorito)
text: 🙏 This place gives you hope!

text: Very disrespectful rude nurses. Who are stereotypical. Alabama's health Care system needs reform!!!!!!!!!!!!

text: Dr Cole has no compassion and discharged me in unbearable pain.

text: Visiting patient

text: Can't even find anything out about my mom
